v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: 3+ years of Business Systems Analyst experience, degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, or related field, experience with Agile methodologies is an asset.

job_information.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What you'll be doing

As a member of CIBC’s team, the Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for formulating system scope and objectives, validating developed requirements, testing, training, and implementing applications and providing end-user support. The role performs technical depth and breadth tasks, validating and documenting business requirements for assigned projects to maximize operational efficiency and ensure project control procedures and policies are executed. The Senior Business Systems Analyst determines project methods and approaches, providing business support relative to developing, analyzing, and identifying process changes or system enhancements. The role uses judgment and autonomy on daily tasks, providing operational support for projects after implementation, including problem resolution and recommendations to ensure ongoing success. The role proactively addresses problems within the scope of responsibility and identifies areas for possible improvements.

At CIBC, we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed during your interview.

How you'll succeed

  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.

  • Solution Design - Build client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate solution design documents around areas such as scope clarification, solution requirements, and quality assurance.

  • Leading and Mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who you are

  • You have 3+ years of Business Systems Analyst experience (i.e., writing user stories, creating and updating systems Use Cases, etc.).  

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile because it’s the right thing to do.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least three years in a BSC role leading projects and designing solutions.

  • It’s an asset if you have experience with Agile methodologies and Application and/or Architecture Development.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, defined benefit pension plan*, an employee share purchase plan, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

*Subject to plan and program terms and conditions

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

  • We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills tests (such as simulation, coding, French proficiency, MS Office). Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us.

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 27th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Analytical Thinking, Application Testing, Business Requirements, Business Systems Analysis, IT Process Improvement, Operational Efficiency, Operations Support

v5_processed_job_data.company_tagline: Element Fleet Management re-defines the fleet management industry to be people first, delivering superior client experiences.

job_information.description:
Get started on an exciting career at Element!

Element employees make a difference in the lives of others every day. We are re-defining the fleet management industry to be people first, then business – delivering on our promise of a superior client experience. This takes hard work and innovation, and we need more like-minded people on our team.

What We Need  

  

We are looking for a Status Analyst to join Element Fleet Management.   As the largest pure-play fleet manager in the world, we provide unmatched products and services and solutions to our clients.  

  

At Element, employees play a critical role in delivering value to customers and ensuring an exceptional client experience. We are committed to the success of our clients, employees, and investors by fostering a culture where every employee can make a difference!  

  

Are You:  

  • Solutions focused with strong relationship building and influencing skills? 

  • An effective problem solver with the ability to work in a fast paced environment? 

As the Status Analyst, you will be responsible for providing proactive order status data/reporting for Element’s top tier clients. This role will work closely with all areas of Acquisitions and FPS (Fleet Partnership Solutions). This directly impacts client satisfaction and vendor accountability.

A Day in the Life   

  • Generate, export to Excel, analyze and disseminate new order reporting to internal and external stakeholders

  • Participate in or Lead conference calls with Clients, FPS and Vendors

  • Stay abreast with the national state of the automotive industry.

  • Research order status, which includes communications to OEMs, Upfit Vendors, Transportation Vendors via email, telephone and Teams/Zoom

  • Answer Service Cloud cases from internal/external customers with +90% On Time Target Closure rate.

  • Providing a seamless and transparent order process for our clients, directly impacts future orders and client retention.

Requirements  

  • College Degree in Business (or equivalent business experience) or related field 

  • 3-4 years of experience in Fleet Management and/or Vendor Management

  • Excel- Advanced User (VLOOKUP Formulas, Formula Writing, Pivot Tables, Macros)

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Client relationship/ management skills

  • Bilingual in English and French is an asset

  • Demonstrated high level Customer Service skills

The hiring base salary range for this position is $54,400 - $74,800 annually. Actual compensation within this range will be dependent upon the individual’s knowledge, skills, experience, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data.

What’s in it for You
•  A culture of innovation, empowerment, decision-making, and accountability
•  Comprehensive health and welfare benefits that serve the needs of you and your family and foster a culture of wellness
•  Additional benefits and amenities, including paid time-off programs (vacation, sick leave, and holidays)
 

Applicants will be required to undergo a background check only if and after a conditional offer of employment has been extended.

Element Fleet Management and its wholly owned subsidiaries are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability, national origin, Aboriginal/Native American status, protected veterans’ status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application and interview process are available upon request. Should you require an accommodation with our hiring process please send an email to talentacquisition@elementcorp.com or call (800) 665-9744.

job_information.description:
For over 50 years, SCIEX has been developing groundbreaking technologies and solutions in mass spectrometry and capillary electrophoresis. Our products enable our customers to quickly respond to environmental hazards, better understand biomarkers relevant to disease, improve patient care in the clinic, bring relevant drugs to market faster and keep food healthier and safer. At SCIEX, you’ll find a rewarding role that amplifies your impact on the world and helps you realize life’s potential.

SCIEX is one of 10 Life Sciences companies of Danaher. Together, we accelerate the discovery, development and delivery of solutions that safeguard and improve human health.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

Start with an inviting tag line: Are you ready to make a significant impact in the world of IT finance and procurement? We're seeking a talented IT Budget/Procurement Analyst who is eager to manage and optimize a $20M+ IT budget, drive cost-efficiency, and influence strategic investments. Bring your passion for financial analysis, strategic procurement, and compliance, and be part of a dynamic environment where your insights and expertise will shape our organization's future technology landscape. If you're ready to blend strategic thinking with hands-on budget management and procurement excellence, we'd love to hear from you!

The IT Budget and Procurement Analyst is responsible for Responsibilities include preparing and monitoring IT budgets, analyzing costs, and overseeing procurement activities for IT spending. The role involves collaborating with various functions and vendors, ensuring cost-effectiveness, and maintaining compliance with policies. Strong skills in budgeting, procurement, financial analysis, and management of $20M+ are essential.

This position is part of the Global IT Team servicing SCIEX, Molecular Devices, and the Life Sciences Platform and will be located in Concord office.  

In this role, you will have the opportunity to: 

  • Budget Management and Analysis:- Develop, monitor, and adjust IT department budgets. Analyze spending trends and ensure alignment with financial goals. Identify and report on budget variances, proposing corrective actions.
  • Procurement Planning:- Manage procurement of IT hardware, software, and services, ensuring compliance with all policies. Evaluate vendor bids, negotiate contracts (MSA, SOW, order forms), and secure cost-effective pricing through negotiations, internal benchmarking, consolidating.
  • Vendor and Contract Management:- Compliantly maintain relationships with vendors during negotiations and evaluations to identify potential issues and risks, track contract renewals, and ensure SLAs are met. Monitor vendor performance and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
  • Financial Forecasting and Reporting:- Work with finance, IT teams and other budget owners to forecast IT expenses and prepare financial reports. Provide data-driven insights and recommendations on cost-saving opportunities.
  • Basic Procurement Functions:- Identify opportunities to standardize and improve current processes, benchmark industry standards and pricing, improve DPO, work cross functionally with special teams (Legal, Privacy, Security, Finance) for new vendors. Review IT usage, services, technology, and department specific projects to identify, forecast, and develop IT needs. Ability to move total cost savings opportunities to action. 

The essential requirements of the job include:  

  • 5+ years of experience in Budgeting, procurement experience, and negotiating with vendors (pricing, terms, etc)
  • Experience in IT Procurement and managing budgets preferred
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain, or a related field.
  • Experience with negotiating contracts, strong communication skills, project management ability, and proficient in Microsoft applications.
  • Competent in procurement software and budgeting tools.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in: 

  • Familiarity with Oracle ERP systems preferred.

SCIEX, a Danaher company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.  

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

job_information.description:
Location

Brookfield Place - 181 Bay Street

Brookfield Culture

Brookfield has a unique and dynamic culture.  We seek team members who have a long-term focus and whose values align with our Attributes of a Brookfield Leader:  Entrepreneurial, Collaborative and Disciplined.  Brookfield is committed to the development of our people through challenging work assignments and exposure to diverse businesses.


Job Description

Opportunity

As a Client Relationship Management (CRM) Analyst/Associate within Brookfield’s Family Office client coverage group, you will support the Family Office team by assisting with a diverse set of initiatives related to client relations and capital raising efforts for Brookfield’s private fund vehicles, across infrastructure, renewable power, private equity, and real estate.

  Position Summary:

  • Provide client service for both current and prospective family office investors

  • Maintain Brookfield’s internal CRM system (SalesForce), as needed by the Family Office team, ensuring that the system is up to date

  • Support the Family Office team on deliverables, including assisting with the preparation of briefing notes and materials for LP meetings, roadshows, and conferences.

  • Liaise with Brookfield Investor Relations, and other internal teams (Project Management, etc.) to support daily operations, as needed

  • Collect data from annual and quarterly reports, and other valuable information on investors and prospective investors to assist with the creation of client summary reports.

  • Coordinate and complete ad-hoc requests both externally, from family office investors, and internally, from internal Project Management Teams and leadership across all fund structures

  • Conduct industry research and client-specific research

  • Work with the Canadian Family Office team to originate new client investment activity

  • Facilitate broad investor communication initiatives and assist with ad hoc conference/meeting planning

 Requirements:

  • Undergraduate degree in business or finance, with an excellent academic background and extracurriculars

  • An understanding of financial concepts, keeps up to date with financial news, capital markets, etc.

  • 1-3 years of relevant working experience in the financial services industry; real estate, infrastructure, private equity or alternative asset funds knowledge is a bonus

  • Demonstrates an analytical and qualitative perspective when problem solving

  • Time and project management skills are highly valued.

  • Proactive, detail-oriented and well organized.

  • Highly proficient in MS Office (Word, PPT and Excel), experience with SalesForce

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills that can bring different stakeholders together on delivering solutions

  • Team-oriented attitude with a willingness to continuously learn and share knowledge with others

  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and work in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines

Brookfield is committed to maintaining a Positive Work Environment that is safe and respectful; our shared success depends on it.  Accordingly, we do not tolerate workplace discrimination, violence or harassment.

Brookfield is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Should you require a Human Rights Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!
 

Job Description

This Business Analyst position requires a focus on client success, client-facing skills and a strong understanding of the project lifecycle and software development lifecycle. You must bring leadership, analytical thinking, and be an inherent curiosity to the role. The successful candidate would be detail oriented with the ability and eagerness to learn and understand business, customer and technology needs. You are a creative thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills and embrace detail but summarize and express it clearly and accurately. This opportunity is based fully onsite at our Mississauga, ON office location.

Compensation: $111,000 - $132,000

Benefits

  • Health Insurance (includes Virtual Health, and HCSA)
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Long-term Disability
  • Short-term Disability
  • RRSP Match
  • Paid Vacation
  • Floating Days
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee Engagement Events
  • Awards and Recognition
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Service Awards
  • Employee Perks & Discounts

WHEN YOU JOIN US YOU WILL BE;

  • Lead projects from a Solution Delivery perspective, from requirements gathering, design to delivery in an Agile, Scrum-based, environment and support project and program managers to build project plans and timelines
  • Support the Project Manager in both Agile and Waterfall projects
  • Build and maintain accurate User Stories / Business Requirements with User Acceptance criteria that will be used by developers, testers and shared with clients to ensure that business value is effectively captured and realized
  • Liaise between the client and project team in evaluating business value of User stories / Business Requirements and prioritizing them for execution by the team.
  • Position solutions and options to business stakeholders
  • Support and collaborate with the development team during the implementation of the requirements in order to clarify and refine User Stories.
  • Collaborate upstream with strategy team and downstream with Technology Architect 
  • Create supporting technical documentation (matrices, sample calculations, field definitions, flow diagrams) where UI/UX designs and API definitions do not capture nuanced product requirements
  • Play a senior consulting role for specific areas of domain expertise including technology and solution choices to implement the solution.
  • Direct development methodology and play a role of technical leader within the team. This includes- supervising, mentoring and coaching Developers and acting as a positive and supportive force within the team
  • Act as the Functional lead on complex projects from conception to implementation including leading interactions with internal architects, and/or 3rd. party Systems Integrators.
  • Perform day-to-day troubleshooting and support of in house built and procured production systems

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE;

  • 5+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst, on large and complex technology projects with a focus on Sales and Customer service in the Manufacturing industry
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience with large and medium size projects that involve a combination of internal teams and external partners
  • Business process flows and modelling
  • Strong analytical skills with developing new reporting analytics
  • Analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to different levels of the organization (written and verbal – i.e. PowerPoint)
  • Experienced with SDLC methodology run projects from Requirement Gathering, Design, Testing, Documentation Training through Implementation and Post Live Support
  • Previous experience in implementing business application of CRM, Loyalty Program, Ecommerce systems and integrations
  • Client-facing / Customer-facing experience to deliver solution overviews, webinars and training
  • Ability to communicate, produce documentation, prepare and lead client sessions, etc.
  • Strong ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion and simplify complex situations
  • Solid presentation, facilitation, interview and workshop facilitation skills
  • Solid communication skills with ability and experience working with executive level staff
  • Previous experience with collaboration tools such as JIRA/Trello
  • University degree is required
  • PMI-PBA certification is an asset

Additional Skills:

  • Experienced with large ERP applications; Oracle JDE is an asset
  • Knowledge of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software-preferably Salesforce.com and Salesforce Communities
  • Demonstrative experience using native Mobile apps and Responsive Design to digital solutions to strengthen client brands, and improve customer relationships leaning on tools such as CRM
  • Successful delivery of Ecommerce, Digital Marketing and CRM projects
  • Working experience with a leading Ecommerce and Integration platform(s) including but not limited to
    • Salesforce
    • WordPress
    • Oracle Fusion Middleware
    • Exposed to or directly used ECM, or Web CMS
    • Integration Frameworks (SOAP, REST, JSON)
    • XML/XML Schema and experience with Data Modeling
    • UI/UX Design Principles
    • SharePoint experience is an asset
    • Basic knowledge of CSS/HTML/Javascript

WORK AUTHORIZATIONS AND TRAVEL;

  • Travel within North America and to some Europe locations may be required

#LI-SM2 

Benefits of Employment: IKO recognizes that its success is due to the strength of its employees. A primary goal of IKO is to promote individual employee's sense of accomplishment and contribution so that employees enjoy their association with IKO. The Company invests in its employees so that they are the most knowledgeable in the industry, and undertakes great efforts to nurture loyalty to, and teamwork at, IKO. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!
 

Job Description

Reporting to our Business Analyst Manager, we are looking for a passionate, inquisitive, detail oriented and customer focused Senior Business Analyst to join our growing team. The Senior Business Analyst will work collaboratively with the business and technology teams to gather and document detailed requirements and being responsible for the analysis stages for all the application projects. This role is based onsite out of our Mississauga, ON.

Compensation: $110,000 - $125,000

 

Benefits

  • Health Insurance (includes Virtual Health, and HCSA)
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Long-term Disability
  • Short-term Disability
  • RRSP Match
  • Paid Vacation
  • Floating Days
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee Engagement Events
  • Awards and Recognition
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Service Awards
  • Employee Perks & Discounts

 

Job Responsibilities

Requirements Gathering and Analysis

  • Work with the business owners, developers, architects, PMs, and other BAs to break down the designed solutions into detailed business requirements.
  • Conduct workshops and meetings to gather requirements.
  • Conduct process mapping
  • Document business processes and rules from a user perspective and identify the gaps and be responsible for recommendation of process optimization.
  • Own capturing the data flow mapping across various business and system processes and interpret the value offerings and validations.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements for new projects or enhancements to existing processes. Document current business processes using tools such as flowcharts or diagrams to identify all areas.
  • Create and maintain documentation related to business requirements, process flows and system configurations.
  • Own the creation and maintenance of Business Requirements Documents (BRD).
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization to gather requirements, provide updates, and facilitate decision-making processes.
  • Work closely with business and IT stakeholders. Understands the business requirements, application systems, limitations and constraints, company’s policies.


Projects Support

  • Support business case development and presentation for steering meetings.
  • Contribute to high-level technical solutions discussions.
  • Support organization change management, training, and related document creation.
  • Build and review test plans and ensure test strategies.
  • Ensure test cases align to document business and solution requirements.
  • Ensure projects are aligned to business requirements.
  • Provide support to defect review and resolution.
  • Participate and monitor QA activities, SIT activities.
  • Lead UAT sessions with stakeholders.


Coaching and Monitoring

  • Collaborate closely with the other members of the Business Analysis team and ensure effective implementation of all Application projects to achieve all client’s objectives playing the role of the most senior business analyst position on the team.
  • Keep project team informed of problems, issues, and resolutions, being the liaison between the Business Analysis team and business users.
  • Provide Applications training to the business users and IT teams.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 10 years of overall IT experience as a Business Analyst with focus on Enterprise Applications, Custom-applications and Cloud-applications.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience with Sharepoint administration (a must-have for the role), and demonstrated experience with MS Teams administration
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with mindfulness and accuracy.
  • Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques, such as process mapping, data analysis, and requirement gathering.
  • Experience with project management methodologies and tools.
  • Experience with Concur and Workday would be an asset.
  • Ability to develop and prepare technical specifications and documentation.
  • Experience working with the manufacturing and/or building industries is desired.
  • Excellent analytical, planning, and organizational skills.
  • Excellent written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills with the ability to articulate innovative ideas and concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences.
  • Organizationally savvy, with situational and contextual intelligence of the political climate of the enterprise and how to navigate obstacles and politics.
  • Rapidly comprehends the functions and capabilities of modern technologies.
  • •Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
  • 15% business travel slated to Europe and across North America.

•    Support business case development and presentation for steering meetings.
•    Contribute to high-level technical solutions discussions.
•    Support organization change management, training, and related document creation.
•    Build and review test plans and ensure test strategies.
•    Ensure test cases align to document business and solution requirements.
•    Ensure BI projects are aligned to business requirements.
•    Provide support to defect review and resolution.
•    Participate and monitor QA activities, SIT activities.
•    Lead UAT sessions with stakeholders.


Coaching and Monitoring
•    Collaborate closely with the other members of the Business Intelligence and Analytics team and ensures effective implementation of all Business Intelligence and Analytics projects to achieve all client’s objectives playing the role of the most senior business analyst position on the team.
•    Keep project team informed of problems, issues, and resolutions, being the liaison between the BI team and business users.
•    Provide Business Intelligence and Analytics training to the business users and IT teams.

Requirements and Qualifications
•    Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
•    Minimum of 10 years of overall IT experience as a Business Analyst with focus on Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Warehouse related projects.
•    Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with mindfulness and accuracy.
•    Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques, such as process mapping, data analysis, and requirement gathering.
•    Experience with project management methodologies and tools.
•    Experience with Power BI would be an asset.
•    Ability to develop and prepare technical specifications and documentation.
•    Experience working with the manufacturing and/or building industries is desired.
•    Excellent analytical, planning, and organizational skills.
•    Excellent written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills with the ability to articulate innovative ideas and concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences.
•    Organizationally savvy, with situational and contextual intelligence of the political climate of the enterprise and how to navigate obstacles and politics.
•    Rapidly comprehends the functions and capabilities of modern technologies.

job_information.title: Senior Treasury Analyst
job_information.description:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!
 

Job Description

Job Summary: As a Senior Treasury Analyst reporting directly to the Global Director, Treasury, you will be a key member of the team and will be exposed to and/or will take ownership of variety of Corporate Treasury functions including global cash management and forecasting, FX exposures, investments analysis, liquidity reporting, treasury operations, banking portal administration and payment processing. In addition, the Senior Treasury Analyst will also be involved in numerous special projects related to treasury process improvements including implementation of a Treasury Management System.

Compensation: 85k-105k per annum based on experience

Benefits

  • Health Insurance (includes Virtual Health, and HCSA)
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Long-term Disability
  • Short-term Disability
  • RRSP Match
  • Paid Vacation
  • Floating Days
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee Engagement Events
  • Awards and Recognition
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Service Awards
  • Employee Perks & Discounts

Job Responsibilities

  • Gather, review and consolidate daily cash positions across multiple banks in multiple jurisdictions, and forecast daily cash requirements of the global operations
  • Execute all forms of electronic payments, which includes wires, ACH/ EFT, Bill pay, etc.
  • Monitor and analyze credit card activity and process payments
  • Manage and maintain the internal bank database system particularly bank account details, ASO and cheque signatory listings.
  • Prepare bank and other financial institution documentation for account opening and compliance.
  • Act as an online bank account administrator and monitor user access  
  • Track movement of major global transactions including the management of cash pooling/concentration arrangements
  • Provide strong support to the Treasury team in the implementation of a Treasury Management System (TMS) and taking a lead role in performing data input/migration and bank connectivity processes
  • Perform investment analysis, review holdings and their performances against benchmarks across multiple entities/geographies and highlight any overlap in risk exposures
  • Digitalize the investment tracking and reporting process across multiple entities, and support the Treasury team in opening new investment accounts as needed
  • Review and analyze bank interest income and bank service charges to ensure alignment with agreed upon agreements
  • Support the Treasury team in preparation of internal presentations to various stakeholders 
  • Evaluate FX exposures and track FX activity across multiple units, and advise on natural offsets
  • Act as a back-up to the Treasury Manager and Treasury Analyst during their absence
  • Identify and implement process improvement initiatives to drive efficiency in treasury processes

Qualifications

  • Post-Secondary Degree with emphasis on Business Administration / Finance / Accounting
  • 3 – 5 years' experience in a Corporate Treasury environment is preferred
  • CFA, CPA or CTP designation or actively working towards these designations
  • Experience working with a Treasury Management System (TMS) is preferred
  • Project Management and Financial Modeling experience is preferred
  • Experience working for a global entity is advantageous
  • Familiarity with use of a Bloomberg terminal (helpful)
  • Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint and Outlook skills
  • Discretion in handling confidential information
  • Detail oriented with focus on accuracy
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to perform well within a fast-paced, multi-task, deadline-oriented environment
  • Familiarity with JD Edwards, SAP or Navision a plus

Benefits of Employment: IKO recognizes that its success is due to the strength of its employees. A primary goal of IKO is to promote individual employee's sense of accomplishment and contribution so that employees enjoy their association with IKO. The Company invests in its employees so that they are the most knowledgeable in the industry, and undertakes great efforts to nurture loyalty to, and teamwork at, IKO. We are pleased to offer competitive compensation, health care, a progressive and challenging workplace and a commitment to teamwork and integrity.
 

Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment: IKO Industries Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or disability. IKO Industries Ltd. encourages and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Job Description

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for business analysis activities on medium to large size projects. The role demonstrates advanced knowledge and ability and can apply the competency in new or complex situations and guides other professionals. The role is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery- planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, management, and support - for changes to Business Areas and Technology


What will you do?

  • Perform requirements stakeholder analysis to identify impacted or influencing groups and stakeholder requirements responsibilities
  • Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates
  • Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties
  • Define the business analysis approach including tasks and deliverables based on the project and delivery methodology
  • Lead requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out business priorities
  • Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review
  • Apply advanced elicitation techniques to work with different types of stakeholder groups
  • Analyze and document scope of the business solution using enterprise-standard requirements methodology
  • Analyze and document detailed business and system solution requirements using enterprise standard requirements methodology
  • Analyze and document detailed business and system solution requirements using enterprise standard requirements methodology
  • Verify requirements for quality and validate requirements with the impacted stakeholders
  • Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
  • Utilize SQL to query and analyze business data to support requirements validation and business insights

What you need to succeed?
Must have:

  • Minimum 3+ years of progressive Business Analyst experience with increasing responsibilities in requirements management on large and complex projects
  • Strong SQL skills including ability to write and optimize queries, retrieve data from complex databases, and analyze business data to support requirements validation
  • Basic understanding of programming concepts including ability to read and understand code, familiarity with APIs and their role in system integration
  • Proven experience with various project delivery methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative and/or Agile
  • Experience in requirements planning and prioritization including stakeholder analysis and effort estimation
  • Requirements elicitation techniques such as document analysis, Interviews, facilitated workshops, Observation, Prototyping, Focus groups, Survey
  • Requirements management and communication - requirements walkthroughs; scope and change management; traceability; configuration management, Backlog Management
  • Relevant college, university, or post-graduate degree in Business Analysis

Nice-to-have:

  • Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Institute -Professional in Business Analysis Certification (PMI - PBA) (Preferred)
  • Master's Certificate in Business Analysis (Preferred)
  • 3+ years of experience in Wealth Management
  • Database analysis and modeling experience
  • Experience with business intelligence and analytics tools such as Power BI or Tableau

What's in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • A world-class training program in financial services.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Job Description

The RBC Capital Markets Client, Banking, Data Analytics & Digital Technology (CBDDT) team is looking to hire an experienced Senior Business Analyst to lead deliverables for the Client Analytics and Banking portfolios. This role focuses on driving roadmaps, gathering and defining requirements, delivering innovative solutions, and collaborating with Sales, Banking, and Technology teams to advance Capital Markets objectives.

What will you do?

  • Act as a primary technology point of contact for Capital Markets, facilitating stakeholder engagement, requirements gathering, product design, and delivery in an Agile environment
  • Drive priorities in our product roadmap, ensuring alignment with business goals and focus on high-impact items
  • Collaborate with software engineering teams to deliver solutions by documenting detailed business requirements & user acceptance criteria using tools such as Jira and Confluence
  • Partner with UX Design to develop mockups and wireframes for brand new products or features, ensuring an intuitive user experience
  • Work with Quality Assurance (QA) teams to define test cases and ensure comprehensive testing coverage
  • Engage directly with Sales and Banking teams to gather feedback, provide product demos, and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT)
  • Support product rollout and adoption efforts by collaborating with the Product Rollout & Customer Success team to deliver training, feature content, and improve user engagement
  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis to support decision-making and product enhancements

What do you need to succeed?

Must have's:

  • Proven experience as a Senior Business Analyst in a financial services or technology environment, preferably within or aligned to Capital Markets
  • Expertise in Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Agile methodologies, requirements documentation using tools like Jira and Confluence
  • Experience working with UX design teams to create user-friendly interfaces
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including communication (written and verbal) with the ability to build relationships among a diverse set of stakeholders
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently to manage competing priorities and deliver results
  • Knowledge of Global Markets, Investment Banking, or Corporate Banking products (e.g. DCM, M&A, Leveraged Finance, FX, Rates and Credit, Futures, Commodities, Loans, etc.) preferred
  • Strong presentation and training skills to effectively communicate product features and benefits to end users
  • Excellent data analysis skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, e.g. Excel & PowerPoint
  • Proficient at Jira and Confluence
  • Bachelor or Master‘s Degree in Computer Science or business related fields preferred

Nice to have:

  • SQL querying skills with ability to independently extract data from SQL databases for ad-hoc data analysis
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools and analysis tools

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.

  • A world-class training program in financial services.

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst – Mobile Banking
job_information.description:
Job Description

What is the opportunity?
 

In this role you will get the opportunity to join RBC’s Digital team in delivering exceptional mobile banking app experiences to our clients. You will be responsible for requirements analysis activities on medium to large size projects where you will drive requirements planning, elicitation, analysis, documentation and management. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in both business and systems analysis, a deep understanding of agile methodologies, strong agile experience, digital product experience, a background in financial services, and a passion for digital banking.

What will you do?

  • Act as a liaison between business and technical teams, ensuring alignment and effective communication throughout the project lifecycle.

  • Analyze and document detailed business requirements and system requirements using enterprise standard requirements methodology.

  • Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise and digital standards.

  • Perform stakeholder analysis to identify impacted groups and stakeholder responsibilities.

  • Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties

  • Define the business analysis approach including tasks and deliverables based on the project and delivery methodology.

  • Support Design, Development, and QE activities by providing requirements clarifications.

  • Support QE test activities including planning, defect triage, and root-cause analysis for requirements-related issues.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst and/or Business Systems Analyst, preferably within large Financial Institutions.

  • Strong experience in both business and technical analysis, with the ability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions.

  • Experience with user stories, business and systems specifications, business context diagrams, business process maps, use cases and user story maps.

  • Hands-on experience with agile methodologies and working on agile projects

  • Experience in requirements elicitation techniques such as Document analysis, Interviews, Facilitated workshops, Observation, Prototyping, Focus groups, Surveys

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience working on Digital (Online and Mobile) banking projects

  • Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Institute –Professional in Business Analysis Certification (PMI – PBA)

  • Agile certifications such as Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), or similar.

  • Master’s Certificate in Business Analysis

What’s in it for you?

  • The opportunity to make a lasting impact on the digital banking experience for millions of clients.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team that thrives on innovation and excellence.

  • Opportunities to tackle challenging projects and grow your career in a supportive environment.

  • A chance to contribute to RBC’s mission of helping clients thrive and communities prosper.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
About the role

We are looking for a skilled Business Analyst with strong eCommerce expertise to join our team on a part-time basis. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Commercetools, a solid understanding of subscription models (e.g., Zuora), and a proven track record of supporting scalable eCommerce solutions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, translating business needs into actionable technical requirements and ensuring successful project delivery.

What you'll do

  • Gather, analyze, and document business requirements for eCommerce platforms, subscription models, and related integrations.
  • Translate business needs into functional specifications, user stories, and workflows for development teams.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to design scalable eCommerce and subscription solutions using Commercetools and Zuora.
  • Identify gaps, challenges, and opportunities in current business processes and propose improvements.
  • Support solution design by providing detailed analysis of eCommerce features, product catalogs, pricing, and subscription workflows.
  • Participate in project planning, testing, and user acceptance, ensuring deliverables meet business and technical requirements.
  • Act as a liaison between business stakeholders, product owners, and technical teams to ensure clear communication and alignment.
  • Stay up-to-date with eCommerce and subscription management best practices and emerging trends.

Who you are:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst with a focus on eCommerce solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with Commercetools and familiarity with subscription platforms such as Zuora.
  • Strong understanding of eCommerce processes including product catalog management, pricing, promotions, and order/subscription workflows.
  • Experience creating functional specifications, user stories, process flows, and use cases.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and documentation skills.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, able to bridge business and technical teams.
  • Ability to thrive in fast-paced, evolving environments and manage multiple priorities.

What We Offer: 

  • Opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team. 
  • Continuous learning and professional development opportunities. 
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment. 
  • Flexible work arrangements

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Who We Are:

Price Industries Limited, North America’s leading manufacturer and distributor of air distribution products (www.priceindustries.com).  The founding principles of Price have never changed – business integrity, first-class service, innovation and a commitment to people. Our dependable quality, reliable delivery, and knowledgeable follow-up service have made Price a market leader in supplying air distribution, critical controls, and noise control products.

After more than 60 years, Price remains a privately held family company with a deep heritage and commitment to innovation and service. Our long-standing vision, values, and the Price way of doing business are the cornerstones of our success.

We are a dynamic, progressive and innovative organization looking for new talent in our growing Winnipeg manufacturing facility. If you thrive on new challenges, and working in a friendly, team-driven environment, you should consider the following opportunity.  

What You Can Expect:

  • Health and Dental- Employees and their families enjoy paid benefits covering an extensive list of medical and dental expenses and services.  
  • PocketPills – You and your family will have free access to Canada’s first Digital Pharmacy, PocketPills enables you to call, text or email the pharmacy care team from wherever you are.  You will enjoy free delivery of your prescriptions and vitamins straight to your home.
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)- You and your family will have free access to consultation and support for your mental, emotional and financial well-being
  • Life and Disability- You will be provided with life insurance in a multiple of your salary with an option to purchase additional coverage.  
  • Pension Matching Program- Invest in your future with each pay cheque through our Defined Contribution Pension Plan and we will match your contribution (up to 3% of your salary).
  • Gym Subsidy Program- Employees are eligible for a gym membership reimbursement of up to $300 per year, this includes Fitness related App’s.
  • As part of our Goals, Rewards, Improvement and Teamwork program qualifying teams can enjoy a monthly reward.
  • Personal and Professional Development- We are committed to helping you reach your potential through training and education.
  • Community Involvement- Generously supporting health, charities, youth, and education opportunities is our passion, and you’re invited to be a part of that.

Job Summary

A Business Analyst (BA) acts as the connector between business needs and technology solutions. In this role, you’ll work with stakeholders to understand requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and support the design and implementation of systems that improve operational efficiency. You’ll also be involved in testing, documentation, training, and ongoing support to ensure solutions meet organizational goals and enhance overall performance.

 

The Successful candidate's responsibilities will include:

1. Requirements Gathering & Analysis
• Engage with stakeholders to understand business needs
• Document functional/non-functional requirements, user stories, basic data requirements, and business rules
• Conduct interviews, workshops, and observations to collect detailed information

2. Process Modeling & Improvement
• Analyze current (as-is) business processes and define future-state (to-be) workflows
• Identify inefficiencies, gaps, and opportunities for improvement
• Create process diagrams using tools such as flowcharts, BPMN, or UML

3. Business–IT Liaison
• Translate business requirements into clear technical specifications for development teams
• Ensure proposed solutions align with business goals and add value
• Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders

4. Solution Assessment & Validation
• Work with QA/test teams to develop test plans
• Create test cases and maintain a Traceability Matrix
• Support UAT, including BDR setup and user role/profile requirements
• Validate system functionality against documented requirements

5. Documentation & Communication
• Prepare BRDs/SRS, process flows, user guides, basic data requirements, and test documentation
• Provide timely updates to stakeholders and managers
• Maintain accurate project documentation and version control

6. Project Support
• Support project managers with timelines, status updates, task breakdowns, and SCRUM activities
• Identify risks, blockers, and dependencies
• Assist with change management, user communication, and training
• Support post–go-live activities such as bug reporting, additional training, and user assistance

The ideal candidate for this position will have:

• Understanding of SDLC (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid)
• System architecture basics
• Jira, DevOps, Confluence, Trello
• Microsoft Visio or Lucidchart
• Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
• ERP/CRM systems (IFS, SAP, Oracle, Salesforce)
• Understanding of financial processes, supply chain, and/or manufacturing (based on domain)

Soft Skills Required
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Analytical and critical thinking
• Problem-solving abilities
• High attention to detail
• Adaptability and willingness to learn
• Strong documentation skills

Should this excellent opportunity interest you, please submit your resume, including salary expectations.

 

Price Industries Limited hires based on merit and is strongly committed to equity and diversity. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including all genders, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, individuals of diverse gender and sexual orientation and all groups protected by the Human Rights Code. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodation throughout the selection process and while working at Price. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a disability, please contact us at HR@priceindustries.com.  

  

We appreciate the interest shown by all applicants, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

We are currently seeking a motivated analyst, specialising in oncology, to join our growing team. In your role as a Business Analyst you will be working on a wide variety of projects for our pharma clients. You will be expected to help with the smooth running of current projects, contact external sources (such as a range of industry stakeholders and key opinion leaders - KOLs) through telephone research, and attend international medical congresses. Quick adaptation and learning skills will be necessary as you move from one project/therapy area to the next.

Overall scope of role:

Integral and key member of client engagement team, committed to developing and delivering executable project outcomes to meet specific objectives of our global clients.  Working proactively and collaboratively with numerous stakeholders, to ensure smooth running and delivery of multiple projects.

Key Accountabilities:

  1. Conducting primary and secondary research using the most appropriate sources

  3. Working with team subject experts to develop different perspectives and substantive insights
  4. Partnering and overseeing sub-contractors and project work streams
  5. Creating and presenting accurate, insightful, impactful and persuasive reports and presentations to clients
  6. Creating and maintaining project timetables, project plans, quality control practices and procedures to support agreed deliverables

Key Skills/Personal Qualities: 

Technical Skills:

  1. PhD/PharmD + BSc/MSc in life sciences. 
  2. Strong expertise/background in oncology. 
  3. Strong research and analytical skills with an ability to conceptualise analysis into processes and frameworks
  4. Advanced skills in PowerPoint, Excel and Word
  5. Foreign language skills are preferred

Behavioural Skills:

  1. Strong communication skills – good listener and observer with the ability to communicate effectively and succinctly, verbally and in writing to any audience
  2. Dependable and able to work to own initiative with minimum direction
  3. Curious and critical thinker – passionate about learning new things and striving to do things better
  4. Ability to multi-task and deliver high quality outputs under time-pressured deadlines
  5. Team player – able to work collaboratively and effectively across culturally diverse teams and build credible and strong professional relationships
  6. Excellent attention to detail
  7. Drive and ambition to progress and grow personal capability

job_information.title: Business Analyst Consultant
job_information.description:
At Equitable, we believe work should be a place where you feel supported, inspired, and empowered to grow. In our caring and collaborative environment, your curiosity is encouraged, your passion is recognized, and your contributions truly matter. Together, we create meaningful impact, for our clients, our communities, and each other.

The Opportunity:  At Equitable, we believe great things happen when we work together. We’re a Canadian mutual company driven by purpose - putting people first and helping Canadians protect today and prepare for tomorrow. If you’re passionate about making a difference and growing your career in an inclusive and collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you. Our culture is built on care, passion and curiosity. We put people above all else, strive to be our best and welcome new ideas to deliver positive outcomes.

 

The BA Consultant will be a primary liaison between key business and delivery stakeholders on key divisional strategic initiatives. Extensive experience with project delivery and exceptional analysis skills; including process, data and business needs analysis are required to assess current and future state, and determination of the suitability of proposed solutions to solve business problems. The BA Consultant will also leverage their experience with Business Architecture to ensure that proposed solutions align with the organization’s strategic objectives and deliver exceptional client experiences and services. The BA Consultant is proficient at eliciting and documenting the actual needs of the Business. This position will focus on projects with a high complexity and/or large breadth of impact to the Business.

Join one of the region’s top employers and be part of something that truly makes a difference.

 

Work Arrangements: This is a hybrid role. You will work in our office in Waterloo, ON a minimum of two (2) assigned, consecutive days every other week, plus a fifth (5th) assigned day per month. You are welcome to work from the office more than the minimum requirement and there may be some roles that are required to work in our office more than the minimum requirement.



What you’ll do:

 

  • Lead and drive requirements analysis and review, identifying the most optimal requirements to meet business needs;
  • Develop current and future state process models, identifying gaps and developing requirements to support ideal state client experiences and client service models;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop business architecture models that align with business strategy, driving operational efficiencies and client-centric solutions;
  • Advocate for client needs during project discussions to align solutions to strategic outcomes;
  • Document business architecture models and requirements; facilitate requirements review sessions with Business sponsors, project stakeholders, IT partners and vendors where applicable;
  • Participate in technical analysis meetings/daily stand-ups with IT partners and support Systems Analysts during the development of functional specifications;
  • Closely work with solution delivery partners to advocate for the business, to ensure user satisfaction;
  • Works in partnership with Quality Assurance teams to ensure test strategy mitigates business risk;
  • Development of User Acceptance test strategies and regression test frameworks to augment QA testing while address business process and client specific risks;
  • Supports and coordinates User Acceptance Testing by supporting planning, development of test cases, execution of tests and consideration of automated testing techniques;
  • Creates or assists others in the writing of user documentation, instructions, and procedures;
  • Supports post-implementation testing, ensuring coverage of user testing to ensure no production issues;
  • Identify and escalate project risks and issues;
  • Provide coaching, leadership and mentorship for Business Analysts/User Acceptance Testers, at all levels (junior through senior) by assessing gaps and providing training. 

 

What you’ll bring:

  • Post secondary degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience;
  • 5 years as a Lead Business Analyst or Business Analyst Consultant on large/complex projects, in the financial services or insurance industry;
  • Strong knowledge of all project delivery methodologies and methods to articulate business needs;
  • Proven experience in business architecture, including capability mapping, value stream mapping and business process modeling;
  • Experience in collaborating with stakeholders to support the design of end-to-end business solutions, ensuring that technical, business, and user experience requirements are met;
  • Expert level knowledge of Business or System Analysis, including process, tools and techniques. Certification highly desired;
  • Expert level understanding of Individual Insurance systems, products and processes in support of client solution delivery and exceptional experience enablement;
  • You’re logical, a big-picture thinker and able to confidently challenge the status quo;
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical capability, with the ability to define and resolve complex issues;
  • Excellent documentation & presentation skills (written and verbal) with attention to detail;
  • Strong conceptual skills and ability to exercise flexibility and judgement in a changing environment;
  • Required Technical Skills:
    • MS Office;
    • MS Visio;
    • Power BI;
    • Azure Dev Ops;
    • Experience with Miro beneficial.


What’s in it for you:

  • Career Growth: Regular learning sessions and development opportunities 
  • Total Rewards: Incentive pay, annual salary reviews, employer-paid benefits and pension matching 
  • Time Away: Competitive vacation plus one paid volunteer day each year
  • Flexibility: Healthy work-life balance with employee wellness always top of mind, complemented by a “dress for your day” approach



At Equitable, we’re committed to fair pay and an inclusive, accessible hiring experience. If you need accommodations or alternative formats at any stage, just reach out to us at careers@equitable.ca. We’re happy to help.

Your base pay will be based on your skills, qualifications, experience and education. In addition to your salary, this role is eligible for a discretionary annual incentive award tied to business performance, plus a wide range of competitive benefits.

If you’re selected to move forward, our Talent Acquisition team will walk you through all the details of our total rewards program, so you know exactly what’s included.



Reports To: Director, Individual Portfolio Management
Department: Individual Portfolio Management
Term:  Permanent Full-Time

As part of the recruitment process, you will need to go through background screening, as per our company policy.

At Equitable, we believe work should be a place where you feel supported, inspired, and empowered to grow. In our caring and collaborative environment, your curiosity is encouraged, your passion is recognized, and your contributions truly matter. Together, we create meaningful impact, for our clients, our communities, and each other.

The Opportunity:  At Equitable, our focus is on making a meaningful impact in the lives of Canadians by putting clients at the heart of everything we do. We lead with empathy, act with intention, stay curious, and support one another every step of the way. If you're looking for purpose-driven work in a collaborative and inclusive environment where your voice is heard, and your growth is encouraged we’d love to connect.

The Business Analyst, Intermediate will be identifying business needs and solving problems to help the business meet its goals and objectives. This can be accomplished by researching, assessing, and documenting business needs. The Intermediate Business Analyst will understand how work is currently being conducted, and through analysis, determine solutions to the issues. The solution could include training, a process change, modifications to business rules, modifications to or implementation of new technology or a combination of the four. The quality of the Intermediate Business Analyst’s assessment contributes to the on time, on budget success of a project by accurately capturing the requirements and scope.

Join one of the Waterloo Area’s Top Employers for 2025 and Southwestern Ontario’s Top Employers for 2024 and be part of something that matters.

 

Work Arrangements: This is a hybrid role. You will work in our office in Waterloo, ON a minimum of two (2) assigned, consecutive days every other week, plus a fifth (5th) assigned day per month. You are welcome to work from the office more than the minimum requirement and there may be some roles that are required to work in our office more than the minimum requirement.

 

What you’ll do:

  • Assesses, researches, analyzes and documents sponsor/stakeholder needs;
  • Recommends business solutions that satisfy sponsor/stakeholder needs with focus on process improvement opportunities;
  • Analysis on call drivers into the Contact Centre including recommendations on how to mitigate or eliminate calls;
  • Process mapping and revising documentation for processes within the CC and between CC and admin areas or other areas outside the CC. This includes negotiating better TAT’s if applicable;
  • Attend project/initiative meetings, either IT or Operational focused, on behalf of the CC to identify any impacts to the CC;
  • Work with the Individual Project and Training team to ensure proper documentation and tools are provided to the CSR’s;
  • Manage CC operational initiatives as needed;
  • Subject matter expert on the Individual CC;
  • Assess training needs for all projects and initiatives along with Training team;
  • Provide back up to the Specialist team as needed;
  • Recommends business solutions with a focus on process improvement;
  • Act as sole BA on medium to large projects;
  • Consults and coordinates with stakeholders to design and map business processes and procedures;
  • Leads Business Requirement sessions and identifies, tracks and escalates issues for resolution;
  • Prepares and consolidates requirements documentation;
  • Creates or assists others in the writing of user documentation, instructions and procedures;
  • Identify and escalate project risks and issues;
  • Works in partnership with Quality Assurance Analysts to ensure test strategy mitigates business risk;
  • Seeks to identify and support resolution of system related production problems quickly, to diminish the impact on productivity and service standards; and
  • Assess the magnitude and implications of each problem to determine the best approach to resolution.

 


What you’ll bring:

  • Previous experience within the contact center space/domain;
  • Strong organization skills and well-developed project management skills;
  • Influencing skills with the ability to negotiate with representatives from other areas;
  • Thorough knowledge and understanding of analysis and productivity improvement methodologies;
  • 3-5 years experience as a Business Analyst on medium to large projects
  • Post secondary degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience;
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail;
  • Documentation & presentation skills;
  • Strong motivational and communication skills;
  • Adaptable to change;
  • Conceptual Thinking: ability to make the complex simple or link together things not obviously related;
  • Problem Solving: identifies optimal solutions based on the analysis of causes;
  • Knowledge of the various stages of the business analysis process, including business requirements, data mapping, screen design, workflows, etc;
  • Solid self-management and time management skills;
  • Knowledge of process improvement methodology;
  • In-depth understanding of technical support for system updates & queries; and
  • Ability to consider both sides when making decisions (corporate/client) and anticipate potential outcomes (positive/negative).

 

 

What’s in it for you:

  • Career Growth: Regular learning sessions and development opportunities
  • Total Rewards: Allowance provided in place of vacation pay and benefits
  • Flexibility: Healthy work-life balance with employee wellness always top of mind, complemented by a “dress for your day” approach

 

 

At Equitable, we’re committed to fair pay and an inclusive, accessible hiring experience. If you need accommodations or alternative formats at any stage, just reach out to us at careers@equitable.ca. We’re happy to help.

 

Your base pay will be based on your skills, qualifications, experience and education.

 

If you’re selected to move forward, our Talent Acquisition team will walk you through all the details of our total rewards program, so you know exactly what’s included.


Reports To: Manager, Client Care Shared Services
Department: Impact
Term: Temporary Full-Time (ending December 2026)

This position is open and we are excited to find the right person to join our team. 
 
As part of the recruitment process, you will need to go through background screening, as per our company policy.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
At Kruger Packaging, we foster a culture of collaboration, integrity, and continuous improvement. We value our employees as key drivers of success and offer opportunities for growth in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment.

Project Overview

Kruger Packaging is making changes to its business processes and systems. Two major projects will occur simultaneously: an in-depth analysis of the current end-to-end business processes across operations to determine the most effective future process, and the implementation of a new CRM solution, which requires reviewing existing processes and applying an ideal solution to support the business.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly experienced and results-driven Senior Business Analyst to lead the review, modeling, and optimization of our end-to-end business processes within a manufacturing environment. This role is pivotal in driving operational excellence and will also play a key role in the successful implementation of supporting systems.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business process analysis, manufacturing operations, and enterprise system implementations, with a proven ability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions. We are looking for a rigorous, versatile, and autonomous professional who thrives equally well in structured analysis and in agile environments.

The candidate must demonstrate excellent communication skills across all levels of the organization and be willing and able to travel to various sites, including those located in the United States. Travel requirements are estimated to range from a minimum of 10% and up to 40%, depending on project phases.

Key Responsibilities

Manufacturing Process Analysis & Optimization (70%)

  • Analyze, design, and implement improved processes across production, procurement, maintenance, quality, customer service, finance...
  • Identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities for automation or standardization.
  • Lead cross-functional teams to develop future-state process models and drive change management initiatives.
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement throughout the packaging division.

CRM Implementation Support (15%)

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners to support the rollout of the new CRM system.
  • Ensure manufacturing processes are aligned with CRM capabilities and business requirements.
  • Participate in system configuration, testing, training, and go-live support.

Cross-Departmental Collaboration (5%)

  • Facilitate workshops and meetings with teams from various departments to gather requirements and validate process improvements.
  • Act as a liaison between manufacturing, IT, and commercial teams to ensure successful project delivery.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all organizational levels, from shop floor to senior leadership.

Documentation & Reporting (10%)

  • Create and maintain process maps, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and improvement charters.
  • Provide regular updates to leadership on project progress, risks, and outcomes.
  • Track and report key performance indicators (KPIs) related to process optimization and CRM adoption.

 

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, or related field.

Minimum 7–10 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a strong focus on manufacturing environments.

Proven experience leading cross-functional process optimization initiatives.

Proven experience with business process modeling tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, BPMN).

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Experience with ERP systems (e.g., Dynamics 365, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM or similar CRM platforms is an asset.

Bilingual (English/French) is mandatory.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Willingness and ability to travel to various company sites, including locations in the United States. (The candidate must be legally authorized to travel to the United States.)
