job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst, Data & Insights
job_information.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Senior Business Analyst, Data and Insights plays a pivotal role in advancing the organization’s analytics and digital intelligence agenda across business units. This position is responsible for identifying, shaping, and supporting business needs related to reporting, data platforms, advanced analytics, and AI/ML initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives and Kruger’s enterprise data architecture.
Collaborating with teams across Finance, Operations, Sales, Supply Chain, and Innovation, the analyst drives user adoption, solution design, and the delivery of trusted insights through platforms such as SAP BW, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Business Data Commons (BDC), Databricks, and Power BI.
This role is critical to shaping Kruger’s data-driven culture and will support the enablement and transition toward S/4HANA, enterprise data lake, and emerging GenAI technologies.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Data and Analytics Demand Shaping

Partner with business stakeholders to identify and prioritize analytics use cases and reporting needs.

Lead discovery sessions and manage intake for dashboards, KPIs, data models, and insight solutions.

Act as the primary IT liaison for advanced analytics initiatives involving SAP and enterprise data platforms.
Solution Delivery and Design

Translate business requirements into detailed functional and data specifications.

Collaborate with Data Engineering and Architecture teams to support integration, modeling, and visualization.

Serve as product owner or analyst lead for the delivery of dashboards in Power BI, SAC, or Databricks.

Support the development of semantic layers, data marts, and governed self-serve reporting assets.
Platform Expertise and System Integration

Provide functional expertise in SAP BW/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Power BI, and BDC models.

Support solution integration with ERP systems (SAP ECC, JDE), operational platforms, and enterprise data lakes (e.g., Databricks).

Participate in data validation, User Acceptance Testing, and ongoing performance tuning for data-driven solutions.
Data Governance and Quality

Promote data stewardship and ownership practices across functions.

Help define and monitor data quality metrics, lineage, and cataloging efforts in partnership with the Data Governance team.

Contribute to metadata standards, reporting definitions, and harmonization of KPIs.
Enablement and Change Management

Train business users on dashboards, insights tools, and analytics best practices.

Support citizen data analysts and functional power users in adoption of new tools and capabilities.

Contribute to communication plans and user adoption strategies for enterprise insight programs.
Innovation and AI Readiness

Collaborate with IT and innovation teams to identify opportunities to embed AI/ML models and GenAI-powered analytics.

Contribute to proof-of-concepts (POCs) and pilots in areas such as predictive forecasting, anomaly detection, or intelligent automation.


QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering, Finance, or related field.
Post-graduate certification or coursework in Analytics, Data Engineering, or AI/ML is an asset.


EXPERIENCE

Minimum 10 years of experience in business analytics, BI, or data platform roles.

Hands-on expertise with SAP BW, SAC, and Power BI is required.

Exposure to BDC or similar semantic layer environments, as well as platforms such as Databricks, Azure Synapse, or Snowflake platforms.

Strong experience working across Finance, Operations, Supply Chain, or Commercial analytics domains.

Familiarity with S/4HANA data structures or roadmap planning is a plus.


SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Excellent stakeholder engagement, documentation, and communication skills.

Able to navigate complex enterprise environments and work across divisions.

Strong data storytelling, visualization, and user enablement skills.

Comfortable with agile delivery models, product ownership, and iterative development.

LANGUAGES

·       Bilingual - French / English (advanced level)

Knowledge of English is required for this specific position as Kruger deals with partners across North America and the successful candidate will be required to communicate frequently with them. Kruger has taken all reasonable steps to avoid imposing English language requirements, including assessing the actual language needs associated with the duties to be performed, ensuring that the language skills already required of other employees were insufficient for the performance of those duties, and limiting as much as possible the number of positions with duties requiring English language skills.

v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: 10+ years in analytics/BI and data platforms; SAP BW/SAC/Power BI; Databricks; Azure Synapse; Snowflake; cross-functional Finance/Operations/Supply Chain.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
WHO WE ARE: 

Mariner innovates always and everywhere, turning novel ideas into practical solutions. From products and services to venture creation, we build better futures powered by people. We partner with people embracing change, leveraging data, cybersecurity, cloud, and change management to drive successful business outcomes that matter to our customers.


Mariners build for change. Like SHIFT Energy, our energy management and decarbonization company. Or East Valley, created to scale social economic impact in our communities through investment and mentorship of emerging change-makers and their companies.


Mariner’s purpose has always been to be a great, everlasting technology company and the core values that guide us every day are:


OUR VALUES

  • We care for our team.
  • We care about the impact we have on our community.
  • We serve by solving complex problems.
  • We grow because growth fuels opportunities.
  • We innovate always and everywhere.
  • We build a business that lasts.


OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE: 

We are seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our Mariner Innovations team to help in our planned growth, and contract opportunities for our clients in Atlantic Canada. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING IN THE ROLE:  

  • Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements.
  • Documentation of current and future state process mapping. 
  • Prepare Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements.
  • Collaborate in the development of test plans and test cases.
  • Define reporting and alerting requirements.
  • Prepare integration plans for deployment of system changes into existing environments. 
  • Help design, document and maintain system processes.
  • Change and support process management for new technology delivery.
  • Facilitate stakeholder sessions, interviews, and analysis to identify areas for process and systems improvement. 
  • Communicate key insights and findings to client team.


WHAT SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS YOU’LL NEED TO DO THE JOB:   

  • Post-secondary education in business, computer science, or a related field from a recognized institution.
  • 5+ years of progressive corporate experience functioning as an IT Business Analyst/Functional Analyst.
  • This is a hybrid role requiring onsite presence in Moncton on a regular basis.
  • CBAP certification or willing to obtain.
  • Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis and process mapping and design as part of a business transformation.
  • Experience in working in a formal systems development lifecycle methodology environment involving such artifacts as functional and detail design documents, business use cases, and requirements traceability.
  • Demonstrated skill in building consensus among process stakeholders.
  • Exceptional communication skills and experience in working with business experts at all levels and technical subject matter experts.

  

…AND YOU ARE...  

  • Always improving your skills and knowledge: you want to be the best at what you do  
  • Curious and creative; comfortable taking on new problems and challenges  
  • A self-starter with the ability to recommend priorities to the project leader   
  • Comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision  
  • Great problem-solving skills: thorough and reliable  
  • Able to work in a team: share knowledge and assist other team members  
  • A good communicator: able to explain your ideas and recommendations  
  • Well organized and dependable under pressure: you manage your time effectively  
  • Energized by our company values!    


MARINER OFFERS YOU:  

  • A values-driven workplace where people really matter 
  • Competitive salary, retirement savings program, and rewards program  
  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans and access to e-health care  
  • Paid vacation, maternity/parental leave, paid sick leave and paid Mariner MyLife days  
  • Unlimited training   


WHY MARINER? 

We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work! Not only are we passionate about nurturing a thriving technology sector here in Atlantic Canada, but we are also committed to solving technology challenges that will make an impact worldwide. Technology is everlasting, and we take pride in connecting world class talent to world class projects and business solutions.  


If you are an IT Professional, Software Professional, or Management Consultant, that is passionate about career development, data, and problem solving, we want to hear from you! If this sounds like someone you know, share this with them so they do not miss the opportunity to experience Mariner!  


To achieve this, we know we need to be all in on training and development of our team so we can continue to move the needle in the technology sector together. Of course, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our team, but our competitive edge is the development and training that our team experiences every day.  


Be part of our vibrant community that values diversity and embraces inclusion at every level. We are committed to fostering a culture where individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life feel empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. Our collaborative environment celebrates the richness of ideas and experiences, and we believe that by embracing diversity, we can achieve greater innovation and excellence together. Come and help us create a workplace that reflects the beautiful tapestry of our global community.  


Join our growing team!

job_information.title: Business Analyst, Business Transformation
job_information.description:
Who we are
You know those big cities that still feel like small towns? Where everyone’s friendly and helps each other out? That’s like Doane Grant Thornton. Except here we’re all professionals and there isn’t a mayor or a general store. What we’re trying to say is that we’re a large and growing professional services firm that still feels like a community. We employ about 3000 people across Canada, and we truly care about our colleagues, our clients and the communities where we work and live. That’s what’s most important to us. We’re building a thriving organization that’s purpose driven and still want to remember what your favourite milkshake flavour is.

As a Business Analyst, Business Transformation your responsibilities will include:
•    As a business analyst on complex programs, work with business stakeholders to elicit and document requirements, collaborate on process models with an understanding of system capabilities, analyze data needs, assist in evaluating solutions, and ensure appropriate testing against requirements
•    Work collaboratively within the Business Transformation team and with key colleagues across the firm including the Technology team and business subject matter experts in documenting functional, data, and technical requirements, and assist the project manager in developing project plans and business cases
•    Facilitate workshops with both business and technical colleagues to gather information for the development of technical requirements
•    Manage the prioritization of requirements for changes to our core systems
•    Participate in data mapping for integration activity between applications
•    Collaborate with project managers, developers, and other members of the cross-functional team

Doane Grant Thornton
If you’re a bit like us, you’re driven to connect with how others are feeling and thinking. Here we walk in others shoes before taking action. Just imagine being part of a team that puts “we before me”, where flexAbility is a mindset, and where you trust your colleagues to have your back. At Doane Grant Thornton, you’ll work with inspiring leaders who support your development, both personally and professionally. This is a place where your insatiable curiosity enables you to think, see and hear from a variety of perspectives, a place where every day is different and having the courage to grow is part of who you are. And when all this comes together, well that’s when the magic happens!

Want to learn more about who we are and how we live our purple every day? Read our colleagues’ stories at www.discoveryourpurple.ca

Think you’ve got what it takes to be a Business Analyst, Business Transformation? Like the colour purple? Great. Here's a few more boxes we’re also hoping you can tick:
•    Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a Business Systems Analyst or Business Analyst
•    Diploma/Degree in business administration, computer science, information technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills
•    Ability to communicate with business and technical stakeholders
•    Experience with Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
•    Experience in Waterfall and Agile-based projects
•    Ability to work with Business Process models (BPMN)
•    Experience with User Interface and User Experience design, wireframing, and prototyping
•    Ability to support multiple projects concurrently, balancing deliverables, and prioritizing across projects
•    Strong interpersonal skills
•    Resourcefulness and creative problem-solving skills

At Doane Grant Thornton we’re focused on making a difference in the lives of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. That’s our purpose. Or, as we like to say, living our purple.

What's in it for you?

Profit sharing, Flex days, RRSP contributions, Firmwide holiday closure, Wellness benefits, Concierge-like benefits, Work from anywhere in Canada in the summer for 4 weeks, and more!

At Doane Grant Thornton, we believe compensation should reflect more than just market data—it should reflect you. We’re serious about compensation.  We benchmark regularly across a wide spectrum of roles, industries, sectors, and levels to ensure our ranges are both competitive and current. But we don’t stop there. We also consider the unique strengths, experiences, and impact each individual brings to the table. Our salary ranges are reviewed annually, and where you land within the range depends on a mix of factors—your background, your skills, and how your contributions align with internal equity. To help start the conversation, the current salary range for this role is $63,400–$87,200 in Toronto, ON. If the role is available in other locations, the range may differ to reflect local market factors. 

Our special culture shines through when we have the opportunity to connect in person. That’s why we’re working in a model where teams are required to be together in the office 4 days per week.

Are you ready to Discover Your Purple?

· Work collaboratively within the Business Transformation team and with key colleagues across the firm including the Technology team and business subject matter experts in documenting functional, data, and technical requirements, and assist the project manager in developing project plans and business cases
· Facilitate workshops with both business and technical colleagues to gather information for the development of technical requirements
· Manage the prioritization of requirements for changes to our core systems
· Oversee data mapping for integration activity between applications
· Collaborate with project managers, developers, and other members of the cross-functional team
· Provide coaching and guidance to junior staff

Doane Grant Thornton
If you’re a bit like us, you’re driven to connect with how others are feeling and thinking. Here we walk in others shoes before taking action. Just imagine being part of a team that puts “we before me”, where flexAbility is a mindset, and where you trust your colleagues to have your back. At Doane Grant Thornton, you’ll work with inspiring leaders who support your development, both personally and professionally. This is a place where your insatiable curiosity enables you to think, see and hear from a variety of perspectives, a place where every day is different and having the courage to grow is part of who you are. And when all this comes together, well that’s when the magic happens!

Want to learn more about who we are and how we live our purple every day? Read our colleagues’ stories at www.discoveryourpurple.ca

Think you’ve got what it takes to be a Senior Business Analyst, Business Transformation? Like the colour purple? Great. Here's a few more boxes we’re also hoping you can tick:
· Minimum 5+ years' experience as a Business Systems Analyst or Business Analyst
· Diploma/Degree in business administration, computer science, information technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
· Ability to communicate with business and technical stakeholders
· Experience with Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
· Experience in Waterfall and Agile-based projects
· Ability to work with Business Process models (BPMN)
· Experience with User Interface and User Experience design, wireframing, and prototyping
· Ability to support multiple projects concurrently, balancing deliverables, and prioritizing across projects
· Strong interpersonal skills
· Resourcefulness and creative problem-solving skills
Preference will be given to candidates with:
· Microsoft D365 experience (Marketing, CRM, Project Operations, Finance and Operations modules)
· Certifications in Business Analysis (CCBA, CBAP, PMI-PBA)
· Experience with applications: Azure DevOps, ServiceNow, Workday, Power BI, Systems Integration

At Doane Grant Thornton we’re focused on making a difference in the lives of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. That’s our purpose. Or, as we like to say, living our purple.

What's in it for you?

Profit sharing, Flex days, RRSP contributions, Firmwide holiday closure, Wellness benefits, Concierge-like benefits, Work from anywhere in Canada in the summer for 4 weeks, and more!

At Doane Grant Thornton, we believe compensation should reflect more than just market data—it should reflect you. We’re serious about compensation.  We benchmark regularly across a wide spectrum of roles, industries, sectors, and levels to ensure our ranges are both competitive and current. But we don’t stop there. We also consider the unique strengths, experiences, and impact each individual brings to the table. Our salary ranges are reviewed annually, and where you land within the range depends on a mix of factors—your background, your skills, and how your contributions align with internal equity. To help start the conversation, the current salary range for this role is $80,800–$111,200 in Toronto. If the role is available in other locations, the range may differ to reflect local market factors.

Our special culture shines through when we have the opportunity to connect in person. That’s why we’re working in a model where teams are required to be together in the office 4 days per week.

Are you ready to Discover Your Purple?

Who we are
You know those big cities that still feel like small towns? Where everyone’s friendly and helps each other out? That’s like Doane Grant Thornton. Except here we’re all professionals and there isn’t a mayor or a general store. What we’re trying to say is that we’re a large and growing professional services firm that still feels like a community. We employ over 3000 people across Canada, and we truly care about our colleagues, our clients and the communities where we work and live. That’s what’s most important to us. We’re building a thriving organization that’s purpose driven and still want to remember what your favourite milkshake flavour is.

As a Senior Analyst, Tax [Transfer Pricing] your responsibilities will include:
•    Demonstrating a solid understanding of transfer pricing concepts and current practice
•    Interacting and communicating effectively with clients and colleagues, including leading or having a major role in routine client calls and meetings
•    Participating in fact gathering, industry research and analysis
•    Analyzing financial statements and data, including large sets of accounting and transactional data
•    Preparing economic analysis, including appropriately selecting and applying a transfer pricing method, and preparing benchmarking analysis with minimal guidance
•    Writing reports and other business communication
•    Developing presentations for clients, colleagues and other teams within the firm
•    Performing all aspects of engagement administration
•    Participating in or leading all aspects of engagement management
•    Supporting the team in the resolution of transfer pricing audits by tax authorities
•    Delegating, overseeing and reviewing work performed by analysts on all of the above
•    Regularly acting as a mentor and training analysts

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Who We Are

At Momentum Financial Services Group, we help people move forward by reimagining how money works for those who need it most. With more than 40 years of experience, we’re the team behind Money Mart—Canada’s largest non-bank branch network—and a leader in financial solutions for underserved communities.

From short-term loans to money transfers and prepaid cards, we power the products, technology, and operations that connect over a million customers a year to the money they need, when they need it.

At MFSG, we come together across teams and departments to create something bigger than ourselves: solutions that remove barriers and give people access to money they might not get anywhere else. Whether you're solving problems, building systems, or shaping strategy, your work fuels real support for real people.

We’ve Got You Covered

  • Compensation Philosophy: Our strategy is simple—we aim to match the market. We regularly review industry standards to ensure our total rewards package is competitive and fair. This commitment helps us attract and retain talented individuals who share our purpose.
  • Discretionary Annual Bonus: Enjoy the opportunity for a discretionary bonus based on individual performance and company success.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Our benefits include health and dental plans with 100% of the premiums covered. We also offer an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental well-being and provide resources for personal challenges.
  • Retirement Plans: Plan for your future with our robust retirement savings options, ensuring you’re set for the long haul.
  • Hybrid Work Environment: Experience the best of both worlds with our hybrid work model, allowing you to balance remote work with in-office. When you're at our corporate head office, enjoy a relaxed and collaborative environment featuring breakout rooms for brainstorming and unwinding, plus a variety of snacks to keep you energized throughout the day.
  • Perks and Rewards: Enjoy reimbursement for tuition assistance and professional development, discounts through Perkopolis and participate in our rewards and recognition programs to celebrate your contributions.

The Job: Business Analyst

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, partnering with the product owner to gathering and documenting user stories from stakeholders, developing data-driven recommendations, and acting as a liaison between business and IT teams to ensure new or improved solutions meet organizational goals; including oversee project implementation, conduct testing, create reports, and foster communication to drive change and increase efficiency within an organization.

How You’ll Make an Impact: 

  • Analyze data to understand performance, identify trends, and provide insights and actionable recommendations for decision-makers.
  • Develop and propose solutions, which can include new software, process changes, or hardware, to align with business goals.   
  • Produce clear and well-structured documentation, such as business requirements documents, use cases, and reports.
  • Assist with project management tasks, including developing project plans, monitoring performance, and managing resources.
  • Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure solutions meet the defined requirements and business needs. 
  • Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate business performance and insights to various audiences. 
  • Support the introduction and management of change within the organization, acting as an agent of change to improve operations. 
  • Collaborate with and influence various stakeholders, including business leaders, users, and technical teams, to support projects and initiatives. 

What You Bring:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science or Engineering preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 3+ years' experience with Business Analysis or Solutions Consulting required. Analytical person who will support delivery of IT projects, defining and writing requirements and specifications across Enterprise Corporate systems project portfolios, deliver organizational performance metrics, manage documentation and build/create presentations and training materials.
  • Supporting business partners to develop roadmaps and business cases.
  • Experience in Financial services lending industry.
  • Working knowledge of Jira, Confluence, Azure DevOps or similar.  
  • Strong communication, analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills to succeed.  
  • Understanding business processes and needs (business acumen), excellent verbal and written communication for stakeholder interaction, critical thinking to identify issues and propose solutions, and the ability to analyze and visualize data using tools like SQL and BI platforms.  
  • Adaptability, facilitation, and stakeholder management are also vital. 

 

Committed to Equal Opportunity: 
 
MFSG is committed to accommodating applicants up to the point of undue hardship during the recruitment, assessment and selection process. If you are selected for an interview, please notify MFSG if you require accommodation in respect of the materials or procedures used at any time during this process. If you require accommodation, MFSG will work with you to determine how to meet your needs.

job_information.title: Analyst - AI Business (82617)
job_information.description:
Career Opportunities: Analyst - AI Business (82617)

Requisition ID 82617 - Posted  - IT – Support Services - Calgary - Alberta - Canada
  Job Description Print Preview

 

Proudly Canadian. Driven by Purpose. Rooted in Care.

 

Join a national team where people, purpose, and community come first. Western Financial Group was named a 2025 Top Insurance Employer by Insurance Business Canada and is home to more than 2,300 team members supporting over one million customers across 200+ locations across Canada.

 

Business Analyst, AI Solutions - Remote in Canada

 

Here is what a typical day looks like

  • Managing the AI solutions request intake process through Freshservice (OneSupport), ensuring all submissions are properly triaged and categorized
  • Conducting discovery sessions with business stakeholders to understand current-state processes, pain points, and desired outcomes
  • Documenting detailed business requirements, process flows, and acceptance criteria for AI and automation solutions
  • Creating user stories and maintaining the product backlog in collaboration with development team leads
  • Performing process mapping and analysis to identify high-value automation and AI opportunities across business units
  • Developing business cases including effort estimates, cost-benefit analysis, and ROI projections for proposed AI solutions
  • Conducting feasibility assessments in collaboration with the AI Architect to evaluate technical viability of proposed solutions
  • Tracking and reporting on realized benefits post-implementation to validate business case assumptions
  • Maintaining the automation opportunity pipeline and supporting portfolio prioritization decisions
  • Serving as the primary point of contact for business stakeholders throughout the AI solution delivery lifecycle
  • Contributing to executive dashboards and reporting on AI program intake, delivery, and value metrics

 

The value you bring

 

  • Proven experience working as a Business Analyst with focus on technology or automation projects
  • Ability to communicate effectively in a corporate environment and qualify technical request from both technical  and non-technical stakeholders
  • Proficiency in process mapping tools (Visio, Lucidchart, Miro)
  • Experience with requirements management and Agile tools (Jira, Azure DevOps, Freshservice)
  • Familiarity with data analysis tools (Excel, Power BI); understanding of AI/ML concepts and automation technologies
  • Analytical thinking, stakeholder management, communication (written and verbal), facilitation, problem solving, attention to detail, business acumen, results focus

 

Role Details

  • Hours: Full-time 37.5  hours per week
  • Location: Remote options available in Canada
  • Compensation Range: $50,000 - $80,000
  • Requisition #: 82617
  • Current Vacancy: Yes

 

Why Western?

Western’s people‑first culture, grounded in our guiding principles of Truthfulness, Fairness, Value, and Loyalty, is recognized across Canada and strengthened by our commitment to wellness, flexibility, and meaningful community impact.


Highlights include:

  • 14 Paid Wellness Days, 3 weeks’ vacation, company‑matching savings programs, and 100% employer‑paid group benefits for eligible employees
  • Over 1,500 volunteer hours supporting 160+ charities in 2024–2025 through the Western Financial Group Communities Foundation.

 

Our Commitment to Inclusion: At Western, we strive to create an accessible, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply, even if your experience doesn’t perfectly match every qualification.  If you need assistance or an accommodation during the hiring process, please contact talent.acquisition@westernfg.ca or visit our Careers page.

 

Our Human‑First Hiring Approach:  We do not use artificial intelligence to screen, assess, or select applicants. All applications are personally reviewed by Western’s Talent Acquisition Consultants. As part of our hiring process, we use standardized, scientifically validated skills assessments (non‑AI), and all results are reviewed by our hiring team.

 

Ready to Apply?

If making a meaningful impact in your community and growing your career in a supportive, purpose‑driven environment excite you, we’d love to hear from you.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Join our team as a Business Analyst, where you’ll bridge the gap between end users and technology by identifying business needs, analyzing processes, and proposing effective solutions. You will collaborate with diverse stakeholders, translate requirements into clear deliverables, and support the development, testing, and implementation of technology solutions. If you’re a strong communicator with exceptional analytical skills and a passion for improving systems and user experiences, we’d love to hear from you.

 

Permanent Full-Time (40 hours)

Monday to Friday 8:00 am – 4:30 pm (flexible); Hybrid

Salary: $75,000 - $90,000 per year

 

In this role, you will:

  • Analyze business functions to determine operational objectives and evaluate output requirements.
  • Develop workflow charts, diagrams, and specifications by studying system capabilities.
  • Improve systems by reviewing current practices and designing effective process or system modifications.
  • Engage stakeholders using best‑practice techniques to gather requirements and validate them through acceptance criteria and testing.
  • Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and implementation teams, supporting solution development, implementation planning, and RFP processes.

 

You have:

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration, or a related discipline, with at least 5 years of progressive Business Analyst experience.
  • Strong ability to analyze, document, and translate business requirements into clear deliverables and actionable objectives.
  • Experience working in Agile environments, with knowledge of standard BA documentation practices.
  • Professional communication, customer service, and interpersonal skills to engage stakeholders at all levels.
  • Strong organizational, analytical, and problem‑solving abilities, with initiative and accuracy in a fast‑paced, deadline‑driven environment.

 

You get:

  • Great benefits (healthcare, health & personal spending accounts, wellness days, Employee & Family Assistance Program)
  • Company provided RRSP
  • Loyalty share program (based on service length)
  • $300.00 per year to spend on company products
  • Employee discount pricing
  • Employee appreciation events & rewards
  • Free onsite parking
  • Bus pass reimbursement
  • Exclusive discounts with various vendors
  • Costco membership

 

Why us?

 

  • We’re much bigger than you think, 30+ natural health brands loved across North America
  • Proudly Canadian owned & operated and a Certified B Corp company

 

Learn more about us here: https://ca.naturalfactors.com/pages/our-nature

 

FGOffice

This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Only electronic applications can be accepted. This position will close when a competitive candidate pool has been identified. We thank you all for your applications and a member of our team will contact you soon. All the best!

All Internal applicants will be given priority for consideration for the first five business days that this position is posted. After that five days, Internal applicants will be considered along with all other applicants; however, are guaranteed at minimum a call from the Talent Acquisition team.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Department

Regular, Full time

Closing Date: March 1, 2026

The Ontario Securities Commission (OSC) is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The mandate of the OSC is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices, to foster fair, efficient and competitive capital markets and confidence in the capital markets, to foster capital formation, and to contribute to the stability of the financial system and the reduction of systemic risk. This mandate is performed through policy, operational, and enforcement activities. The OSC also contributes to national and global securities regulation development.

We offer a diverse, fair, and flexible work environment and take pride in our challenging and rewarding work.

Summary

The Business Analyst will participate in defining and documenting business needs and processes assessing as they relate to the deployment and support of new and existing applications and processes. This involves working with assigned client groups in application deployment, enhancements, support and troubleshooting problems, as well as identifying opportunities for increased effectiveness and efficiency.

Key Duties and Responsibilities

  • Defining and documenting business needs and processes:
    • Use activity diagrams, use cases scenarios, flowcharts, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, interviews, and workflow analysis to create and manage requirements
    • Gather information from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, disseminating high-level information into details and distinguishing user requests from their true needs
    • Identifying, defining and documenting business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements and levels of systems access after consulting with business SMEs
  • Use standard templates to develop requirement specifications (Business Requirement Documents (BRDs), epics, user stories, acceptance criteria)

Change Management

  • Helping in developing a comprehensive change in management strategy 
  • Participating in user acceptance testing and undertaking the functionality testing of new systems
  • Helping develop a training curriculum and conducting formal training sessions covering assigned systems modules

Stakeholder Management

  • Drive and challenge the presumptions of business units on how to successfully execute their plans
  • Help communicate the technical vision and analyzing trade-offs between usability and performance needs by teaming up with developers and subject matter experts
  • Function as a liaison between technology teams, support teams and business units
  • Communicate and collaborate to analyze information needs and functional requirements to deliver use cases, wireframes and visual designs as and when required
  • Deliver work product throughout the Agile life- cycle

Qualifications

  • University education in Information Sciences, Business Administration or equivalent combination of education and experience and experience working with or knowledge of Business Analysis methodology (IIBA or PMI) and application of tools and techniques.
  • 3 to 5 years of professional experience as a Business Analyst within financial services industry proven experience preferred
  • Ability to evaluate environment(s), interpret requirements, conceptualize and develop recommendations to enable stakeholder-acceptable business processes.
  • Well-developed problem-solving and analytical skills to research and identify issues, challenges, root causes and opportunities, and to propose effective solutions for improvement.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills to provide advice and guidance and present information clearly and concisely to all levels within the organization, including executives.
  • Strong client focus including excellent interpersonal and client relationship management skills to build strong relationships with client groups to facilitate, consult and negotiate with internal stakeholders and peers.
  • Ability to work effectively in ambiguous and changing environments and desire to work in a collaborative team environment.
  • Clear and efficient communicator in both technical and non-technical environments; deliver informative and well-organized presentations.

job_information.title: Business Analyst Co-op Student
job_information.description:
Business Unit

Regular, Full time

Closing Date: February 24, 2026

The Ontario Securities Commission (OSC) is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The mandate of the OSC is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices, to foster fair, efficient and competitive capital markets and confidence in the capital markets, to foster capital formation, and to contribute to the stability of the financial system and the reduction of systemic risk. This mandate is performed through policy, operational, and enforcement activities. The OSC also contributes to national and global securities regulation development.

We offer a diverse, fair, and flexible work environment and take pride in our challenging and rewarding work.

As a Co-op Student on our Architecture, you’ll help the organization understand, organize, and manage its data so teams can work more effectively and make better decisions. You’ll support projects that define how data is collected, used, and shared, and you’ll help document processes, standards, and governance practices. This role is perfect for a business student who enjoys organizing information, improving processes, and helping ensure data is reliable and used responsibly. You’ll get hands-on experience with data governance, business architecture, and cross-team collaboration—while learning how organizations build trust in their data.

What You’ll Be Doing

Understanding and Documenting Business Processes

  • Help map out how different teams work today and how they would like things to work in the future.
  • Join meetings and workshops to take notes, observe, and capture important details.
  • Create simple diagrams, summaries, or user stories to help others understand business needs.

Supporting Governance Activities

  • Help prepare materials for governance meetings (e.g., summaries of requests, templates, checklists).
  • Support tracking new business requests and ensuring they follow our internal processes.
  • Help keep governance documents organized and up to date.

Supporting Data Governance Activities

  • Help document data definitions, business terms, and data standards so that teams use consistent language and rules.
  • Assist in identifying areas where data quality or consistency needs improvement.
  • Support the creation of data policies, guidelines, and best practices.
  • Help track data-related requests and ensure they follow our governance process.

Documenting Business Processes and Data Flows

  • Work with business teams to understand where data comes from, how it is used, and what problems need solving.
  • Create simple diagrams, process maps, and summaries to illustrate how data moves through the organization.
  • Participate in interviews, workshops, and meetings to capture business needs related to data.

Collaboration & Communication

  • Work closely with business units, data stewards, and platform teams to collect information and clarify requirements.
  • Help prepare slide decks, summaries, diagrams, or documentation for governance meetings.
  • Join Agile ceremonies to support prioritization and ensure data governance considerations are included.

What You Bring

  • Currently enrolled in a Business, Business Technology Management, Economics, Public Administration, or related program.
  • Curious about how organizations structure their processes and make decisions.
  • Strong communication skills—you can write clearly and summarize ideas well.
  • Good analytical skills and comfortable organizing information.
  • Enjoy working with others and learning from different teams.
  • Organized, detail-oriented, and open to working in a changing environment.
  • Experience with process mapping or basic business analysis is helpful, but we’ll teach you what you need to know.

This opportunity is considered to be a business-critical role supporting the ISDS Department.

Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC.

job_information.title: Principal Business Analyst
job_information.description:
We enable financial institutions to become digital leaders. 

As a professional team of global scale, we work with best clients for great and exciting projects, in an environment where we learn amazing things every day. Each code, each voice, each contribution, each challenge, each success is celebrated here.
We welcome candidates who share our values, have the skills and are passionate to enjoy our journey to build the digital future of finance, together.
 

What you will be doing :

  • Attending to requirements gathering meetings
  • Writing Business Requirement Documents with adequate inputs
  • Mapping of requirements to the modules/features
  • Creating a detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a business
  • Defining business requirements

Skills / Requirements :

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field
  • 13+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
  • Strong knowledge of digital channels is required
  • Proven experience in digital banking, including comprehensive knowledge of mobile and internet banking features and functionalities
  • Thorough understanding of at least one of the Retail Banking Operations or Functions like Card Operations, Digital Banking, Retail On boarding and Account Opening
  • Ability to convert concepts into visual diagrams and process flows using tools such as MS Visio, Balsamiq, or Adobe XD
  • Knowledge of UI/UX standards and experience with design mockups is an asset
  • Experience in writing documentation for software applications or products
  • Ability to prioritize the requirements
  • Ability to consult the solution and development team
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • A high level of English proficiency is required

About VeriPark:

We are a global technology company with more than two decades of expertise in the Financial Services industry.  Our mission is to enable financial institutions to become digital leaders by delivering world class customer journeys in digital and assisted channels. We develop omni-channel delivery, customer engagement (CRM), branch automation and loan origination solutions based on Microsoft technology (Azure, Dynamics 365, Power Platform) for banks and insurance companies worldwide. 
With offices in 15 countries from North Americover Europe and the Middle East to Kuala Lumpur, our 900+ colleagues are serving customers in more than 30 countries worldwide. 
If you like value growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

job_information.title: Sr. Business Analyst
job_information.description:
About the Insurance Council

The Insurance Council of British Columbia is the regulatory organization that licenses and regulates the activities of over 50,000 life and general insurance agents, general insurance salespersons, insurance adjusters, and restricted insurance agents in British Columbia.


Why Work for the Insurance Council?

Work with a great team of people in a rewarding career that makes a difference. We are in a downtown location with plenty of amenities nearby. The Insurance Council has a friendly and collaborative environment with a team who is committed to protecting the public.


  • We offer a comprehensive health and dental plan
  • Work-life balance
  • Hybrid work environment (work from office/primary residence in BC)
  • Professional development
  • Equitable employment opportunities

The Opportunity

The Senior Business Analyst (SBA) plays a critical role in bridging business strategy and technology delivery. This role focuses on a deep understanding of business challenges, regulatory and operational requirements, and translating them into clear, actionable requirements and solution designs for delivery teams. The SBA is a trusted advisor to business leaders, ensuring that technology solutions are driven by business value, practicality, and long-term organizational outcomes.

This role emphasizes business insight, problem-solving, and solution design, rather than hands-on technical implementation.


Duties and Responsibilities

  • Partner with business leaders and stakeholders to understand strategic priorities, operational challenges, and regulatory requirements
  • Analyze complex business problems and identify practical, value-driven solutions aligned with organizational objectives
  • Define future-state business processes, capabilities, and operating models
  • Translate business needs into clear, structured requirements (e.g., business requirements, functional requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria)
  • Ensure proposed solutions are feasible, scalable, and aligned with business priorities and constraints
  • Act as the primary liaison between business stakeholders and technical delivery teams
  • Translate business concepts, policies, and processes into technical items that development teams can understand and implement
  • Work collaboratively with architects, developers, and vendors to ensure business intent is accurately reflected in technical designs
  • Facilitate workshops, interviews, and working sessions to elicit requirements and validate solutions
  • Challenge assumptions and help stakeholders clarify what problem they are truly trying to solve
  • Provide clear, concise recommendations to senior leaders, supported by analysis and business rationale
  • Manage stakeholder expectations by balancing business needs, timelines, risks, and delivery capacity
  • Ensure requirements are traceable to business outcomes and strategic objectives
  • Support business case development, cost-benefit analysis, and impact assessments
  • Validate delivered solutions against business requirements and expected outcomes
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement, simplification, and efficiency


Qualifications and Experience

  • 7+ years of progressive experience in business analysis, solution design, or business consulting roles
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Public Administration, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • IIBA CBAP certification an asset
  • Proven experience translating complex business problems into structured, actionable requirements
  • Strong understanding of business operations, process design, and organizational change
  • Exceptional ability to understand and articulate business needs, risks, and opportunities
  • Ability to design solutions that balance business value, practicality, and sustainability
  • Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
  • Ability to influence without authority and build strong relationships across business and technology teams
  • Skilled facilitator of discussions involving diverse perspectives and competing priorities


Minimum to Midpoint Salary Range: $98,524 - $123,156 per annum.
Upon hire, new employees will be placed in a starting salary between the minimum and P50 (midpoint) of the salary range. The P50 of the range represents an employee that possesses full job knowledge, qualifications, and experience for the position.

job_information.title: AI Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Job Title : Consultant·e en analyse d’affaires IA (Bilingual FR-EN)

Statut : Temps plein, permanent

Rémunération : Entre 85 000 $ et 110 000 $ CAD/an, selon expérience et qualifications.


À propos du poste

Ashling est à l’avant-garde de la révolution de l’automatisation intelligente et de l’intelligence artificielle (IA) ! Nous aidons nos clients à améliorer leur productivité et l’engagement de leurs employés en tirant parti de la puissance de l’IA et de l’automatisation pour déployer des solutions intelligentes (ex. : RPA, agents IA, traitement intelligent de documents, applications low-code). Notre équipe applique les principes Lean Agile pour garantir des résultats durables et une véritable transformation.


Notre organisation en pleine expansion fait des vagues à l’échelle mondiale, s’imposant comme la boutique de référence dans le domaine de l’IA et de l’automatisation. Nous recherchons des personnes animées par l’apprentissage continu et dotées d’un leadership axé sur le service aux autres, passionnées par l’innovation et l’avenir du travail. Si cela vous parle, nous serions ravis de faire votre connaissance !


Lieu :

Nous cherchons des Consultants et des Consultants seniors pour des postes hybrides, à proximité de Montréal ou de Toronto.

Vos Responsabilités:

  • Agir à titre de point de contact principal auprès des clients assignés et assurer la liaison entre les clients et les ressources internes. Participer aux principales activités de gestion de projet tout au long du mandat, incluant les rencontres quotidiennes (stand-ups), les appels de suivi (status calls) et les rencontres de gouvernance
  • Collaborer avec les responsables de processus et les experts en la matière (SMEs) afin de définir les exigences des processus d’affaires actuels, en appui à la conception des solutions d’intelligence artificielle et d’automatisation futures, incluant les solutions agentiques.
  • Travailler en collaboration avec les architectes de solutions et les équipes de développement afin d’assurer la livraison de solutions robustes et durables. Les analystes d’affaires en IA peuvent être appelés à développer des solutions à l’aide de plateformes low-code, bien que les composantes plus complexes soient généralement développées par des équipes spécialisées.
  • Créer et maintenir la documentation du cycle de livraison en collaboration avec l’équipe interne et les clients, selon les besoins. Obtenir les approbations clients nécessaires dans le cadre des étapes de validation (stage-gate).
  • Soutenir les clients en fournissant des réponses, de l’expertise et des recommandations au besoin.
  • Évaluer les processus d’affaires en vue de leur automatisation et de leur potentiel d’application de l’IA, et élaborer les analyses de rentabilité correspondantes.
  • Mettre en place des analyses de réalisation des bénéfices et des tableaux de bord afin de quantifier et de communiquer les retombées d’affaires des solutions implantées.
  • Être responsable du maintien d’un haut taux de satisfaction client (NPS – net promoter score) afin d’assurer la qualité, l’excellence et la valeur livrées.
  • Démontrer une forte motivation à apprendre de nouveaux outils et technologies.
  • Mentorer et soutenir les développeurs dans les aspects liés à l’analyse d’affaires, aux questions de développement technique et aux meilleures pratiques.


Ce que vous mettez à profit:

  • Baccalauréat, de préférence en informatique, en gestion des technologies de l'information ou dans un domaine connexe.
  • Compétences en communication : Excellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite, tant avec les parties prenantes techniques que non techniques. Bilinguisme (français et anglais) - Nécessite d’interagir sur une base régulière avec des collègues anglophones partout au pays.
  • Gestion de projet : Capacité à gérer efficacement les tâches, à établir les priorités et à respecter les échéanciers.
  • Apprentissage continu : Forte volonté d'apprendre et d’adopter de nouveaux outils, technologies et meilleures pratiques en automatisation.
  • Compétences analytiques : Excellentes aptitudes en analyse et en résolution de problèmes, avec un grand souci du détail.
  • Programmation et scripts : Connaissance des langages de script ou de programmation (ex. : Python, JavaScript, Java, C#, VBA) et compréhension des concepts de base du développement logiciel (gestion de versions, cycle de développement logiciel - SDLC, Agile).
  • IA générative et ingénierie des requêtes (Prompt Engineering) : Familiarité avec les outils d’IA générative, incluant les bonnes pratiques de création de requêtes (prompts), la structuration de requêtes efficaces et l’interaction avec des applications de type agent ou assistant (ex. : OpenAI GPT, Claude, Copilot).
  • Outils d’automatisation : Expérience avec des plateformes d’automatisation des flux de travail telles que UiPath, Power Platform, Blue Prism.
  • Analytique et visualisation de données : Expérience avec des outils d’intelligence d’affaires et de visualisation de données (ex. : Power BI, Tableau, Looker) pour la création de tableaux de bord.
  • Notions de bases de données relationnelles : Bonne compréhension de SQL, des commandes CRUD et de l’intégration des bases de données avec les solutions d’automatisation (atout).
  • Intégration d’API : Connaissance des API RESTful et SOAP pour l’intégration des solutions d’automatisation avec des systèmes externes (atout).
  • Environnements infonuagiques : Familiarité avec les environnements cloud (AWS, Azure ou Google Cloud) pour le déploiement et la gestion de solutions (atout).


Qualifications par niveau:

Niveau : Consultant

  • Expérience : 1 à 3 ans en développement de solutions d’automatisation et d’IA.
  • Compétences techniques : Maîtrise de la livraison de bout en bout au sein d’une plateforme d’IA ou d’automatisation; respecte les meilleures pratiques de livraison; compétences intermédiaires en programmation.
  • Compétences d’affaires et de leadership: Participe aux discussions avec les clients; contribue aux sessions de conception internes; identifie et signale les risques et enjeux à l’équipe projet.


Niveau: Consultant senior

  • Expérience: 3 à 5 ans en développement de solutions d’automatisation et d’IA.
  • Compétences techniques: Maîtrise avancée de plusieurs plateformes d’IA et d’automatisation; nécessite peu de soutien pour le développement de solutions complexes
  • Compétences d’affaires et de leadership: Dirige les discussions techniques avec les clients; assure le mentorat des membres de l’équipe; soutient les activités de gestion du changement avec les clients; contribue aux efforts de développement des affaires


Pourquoi se joindre à Ashling Partners :

Chez Ashling Partners, nous nous engageons à offrir à notre équipe un travail porteur de sens, au sein d’un environnement positif, stimulant et valorisant. Tous les membres de l’entreprise font partie de notre « Ohana », un mot hawaïen signifiant « famille », qui représente la famille élargie au-delà des liens de parenté. Ce concept met de l’avant la solidarité, la coopération et le soutien mutuel autour d’une mission et de valeurs communes.

  • Apprentissage continu - Dans le domaine de l’automatisation intelligente, les changements sont rapides. Afin de soutenir cette évolution, Ashling a développé une culture favorisant l’apprentissage continu et le développement constant des compétences.
  • Diversité des idées, des cultures, des parcours et des identités - Nous intégrons les principes de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion dans toutes les sphères de notre organisation afin de stimuler l’innovation, la créativité et soutenir notre croissance à l’échelle mondiale.
  • Innovation constante avec des technologies de pointe - Nous proposons un modèle d’amélioration continue de la performance et l’opportunité de travailler avec les meilleures technologies d’automatisation disponibles sur le marché.
  • Leadership axé sur le service - Nous croyons que le rôle du leader est de servir l’organisation et non l’inverse.
  • Esprit de collaboration - Nous travaillons ensemble comme des pairs, peu importe le rôle formel ou le niveau hiérarchique.
  • Esprit entrepreneurial en gestion - Nous encourageons chacun à proposer des idées et à s’impliquer activement dans leur réalisation.
  • Transparence financière - Chaque membre a accès aux résultats financiers, aux indicateurs de performance et aux objectifs de l’organisation, afin de mieux comprendre son impact sur le succès collectif.
  • Offrir un service de qualité supérieure - Nous ne sommes peut-être pas les moins chers, mais nous livrons la meilleure valeur à nos clients.
  • Prendre des décisions fondées sur les données - Nous sommes une organisation orientée sur les données, tant à l’interne qu’auprès de nos clients.
  • Un environnement de travail agréable - Nous favorisons une culture positive, valorisante et plaisante au quotidien.


Équité, diversité et inclusion :

Ashling valorise la diversité (genre, communautés autochtones, personnes handicapées, communauté 2ELGBTQQIA+) et offre des mesures d’adaptation sur demande.

job_information.title: AI Business Analyst Consultant
job_information.description:
What You Will Do:

The AI Business Analyst is a dual technical and functional role combining traditional business analysis and low-code solutions development skillsets.

  • Serve as primary point of contact with assigned customers and liaise between customers and internal resources. Participate in key project management activities throughout the project, including stand-ups, status calls, and governance meetings.
  • Collaborate with Process Owners and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to define requirements of current-state business processes to support the design of the future-state AI and automation solutions, including Agentic.
  • Work with solution architects and development teams to ensure a robust and sustainable solution is delivered. AI Business Analysts may be responsible for building low-code solutions, although more complex components may be developed by dedicated developer teams.
  • Create and maintain delivery lifecycle documentation with internal team and customer collaboration where required. Drive client approvals for stage-gate compliance where required.
  • Support customers by providing answers, expertise, and insights as needed.
  • Evaluate business processes for automation and AI suitability and build supporting business cases.
  • Build benefit realization analytics and dashboards to quantify and report business impact of solutions.
  • Accountable for high client NPS (net promoter score) to ensure we deliver quality, excellence and value.
  • Demonstrate a strong motivation to learn new programs and technologies.
  • Mentor and support developer peers with both business analysis, technical development questions, and best practices.


What You Will Bring:

  • Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Computer Science, Business/Information Technology, or related field.
  • Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills for interacting with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Project Management: Ability to manage tasks efficiently, prioritize workload, and meet deadlines.
  • Continuous Learning: Eagerness to learn and adopt new tools, technologies, and best practices in automation.
  • Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
  • Scripting and Programming: Familiarity with scripting or coding languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, Java, C#, VBA), and understanding of basic software development concepts (version control, SDLC, Agile).
  • Generative AI and Prompt Engineering: Familiarity with Generative AI tools, including prompting best practices, structuring effective queries, and interacting with agentic or assistant-style applications (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot).
  • Automation Tools: Experience with workflow automation programs such as UiPath, Power Platform, Blue Prism.
  • Analytics and Data Visualization: Experience using business intelligence and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker) to create dashboards.
  • Relational Database Fundamentals: High level understanding of SQL, CRUD commands, and database integrations with automation solutions is an advantage.
  • API Integration: Knowledge of RESTful and SOAP APIs for integrating automation solutions with external systems is an advantage.
  • Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) for deploying and managing solutions is an advantage.


Qualifications by level:


Level: Consultant

Experience: 1–3 years in AI/Automation development

Technical Skills: Proficient in end-to-end delivery within one AI/Automation platform; adheres to delivery best practices, intermediate programming skills

Leadership & Business Skills: Supports client discussions; supports internal design sessions; raises risks and issues internally


Level: Sr. Consultant

Experience: 3–5 years in AI/Automation development

Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in multiple AI/Automation platforms; less support required for complex solutions

Leadership & Business Skills: Leads client discussions on technical solutions; mentors team members; drives change management tasks with clients; supports business development activities



Why Ashling Partners

  • At Ashling Partners, we strive to provide meaningful work in a positive, appreciative and  fun culture for our own team. All firm members are referred to as “Ohana,” the Hawaiian  word for family, with regards to extended family beyond relatives. The concept emphasizes that extended families are bound together by a common belief, attitude or  purpose and members must cooperate and remember one another. 
  • Lifelong Learning - In the intelligent automation space change happens  fast, in order to support that change, Ashling has developed a culture that  enables lifelong learners to continuously develop their skill sets 
  • Diversity of Thought, Culture, Background & Identity – We build  diversity, equity, and inclusion capabilities into all facets of our business to  support innovation, creativity, and our global growth objectives 
  • Consistently Innovate with Cutting Edge Technology – We offer a  continuous model for performance improvement and the opportunity to  work with best of breed automation technology stacks
  • Provide Servant-Based Leadership – We believe the leader’s role is to serve  the organization, not the other way around 
  • Practice Stewardship – We work together as peers, regardless of a person’s  formal role or authority in the organization 
  • Be Entrepreneurial in Management – We empower people to bring ideas  and challenge them with the responsibility to make them successful • Offer Open-Book Finance – We give everyone the opportunity to see the  books, how we are being measured and what our score is, so they can feel  empowered to impact success 
  • Provide the Best Service – We may not be the cheapest, but we will deliver  the best value to our clients 
  • Make Data-Driven Decisions – We are a data-driven organization internally  and externally 
  • Be a fun place to work - We provide a positive, appreciative and fun culture

What Sets Us Apart

  • Quarterly book allotment (any book of your choice, no cap!) 
  • Uncapped training allotment 
  • Unlimited holidays 
  • Unlimited PTO! 
  • Immediate 401K contributions

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Craving a dream job? Join one of Canada's Top Employers. 
 
Purdys Chocolatier is delighted to have been voted by our employees as one of Canada's Best Employers. This esteemed award is a testament to the rich texture of our history and our more than 115 years of dedication to quality, trust,and supportive work environment.

Job type: Full-time, Permanent  

The expected annual pay range: $85,000-$95,000  

Do you love chocolates? As a proud Canadian Chocolatier, we create connection and joy through the power of chocolate and have a great deal of fun doing so. 

We truly value diversity in our workforce and therefore, welcome applicants of all ethnic groups, genders, races, religions, abilities, and backgrounds. 

We’re looking for a permanent, full-time Business Analyst to join our IT team based in the 8330 Chester st. office in Vancouver, BC. This individual will report to the Vice President of IT. 

Job Overview: The Business Analyst supports the IT organization by analyzing business processes, documenting system requirements, and contributing to the delivery of technology solutions that enhance operational efficiency. This role focuses on analysis, configuration, validation, and integration activities across enterprise applications.  

The Business Analyst works collaboratively with business stakeholders, developers, and external vendors to clarify requirements, evaluate solution options, support testing, and ensure solutions are implemented effectively. As an intermediate-level contributor, this role is expected to demonstrate solid analytical skills, strong business-system understanding, and the ability to work independently on moderately complex initiatives while escalating risks or complex issues appropriately.  

You will have the opportunity to work on: 

Solution Identification & Analysis  

  • Analyze current-state processes through interviews, research, and process reviews to identify system and workflow improvement opportunities and define future-state requirements.
  • Collaborate with senior analysts, architects, and stakeholders to align on solution direction and contribute to business cases by outlining benefits, risks, and success criteria. 

Documentation & Requirements Management  

  • Produce and maintain clear, accessible documentation (business requirements, functional specifications, use cases, and workflow diagrams) and translate business objectives into system requirements for technical teams.   Solution Delivery & Support

Solution Delivery & Support  

  • Evaluate solutions for feasibility, business fit, and integration impact, and support configuration, testing, and validation, including test case development and hands-on testing.
  • Collaborate with users during UAT to document, track, and resolve issues, and support deployment and post-launch stabilization.
  • Analyze integrations, perform data mapping, support API troubleshooting, and maintain related integration and troubleshooting documentation.  

You will be a good fit if you have: 

  • A university degree in computer science, business administration, information systems, or related field (or equivalent experience).  
  • 3–5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Business Analyst, or Systems Analyst in an enterprise environment. 
  • Exposure to systems such as ERP, WMS, POS, production, or eCommerce solutions. Experience with INFOR CSI/Syteline or similar ERP systems is an asset. 
  • Familiarity with agile or hybrid development methodologies. 
  • Working knowledge of SaaS platforms and vendor-supported solutions. 
  • The ability to gather and document business requirements and translate them into functional system specifications. 
  • Experience contributing to end-to-end validation, including test planning and execution.  

 Preference is given to those who have: 

  • Exposure to test automation tools or API management platforms.
  • Experience reading SQL queries or stored procedures for analysis and writing simple validation queries. 
  • Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and experience with BI, reporting, or analytics tools. 
  • Familiarity with cloud technologies and system integrations, middleware, or enterprise integration frameworks (e.g., AWS / Azure / ION / Boomi / etc.).   

Get ready to enjoy: 

  • Flexible Work Arrangement Policy 
  • Possibility to work from home two days per week
  • Extended Health & Dental Plan
  • Sickness and Disability Plans
  • RRSP Matching Program
  • Profit Sharing depending on achieving the business goals
  • Purdys Perks (Active Lifestyle Program, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee discount, and much more) 

 Ready to dive deeper? Check out our Instagram, TikTok or Facebook

We appreciate the interest of all applicants, and while we wish we could personally reach out to everyone, we can only contact those selected for an interview. 

We genuinely care about providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please reach out to us via email at resumes@purdys.com. We're here to help!

v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: 3-5 years as a Business/Systems Analyst in an enterprise setting; university degree in CS/BA/IS or related; ERP exposure (INFOR CSI/Syteline) or similar; Agile or hybrid methods; SaaS platforms; data mapping and API familiarity; SQL knowledge a plus.
workplace_counties: Greater Vancouver County, British Columbia, CA

job_information.title: Business Analyst - NL
job_information.description:
WHO WE ARE: 

Mariner innovates always and everywhere, turning novel ideas into practical solutions. From products and services to venture creation, we build better futures powered by people. We partner with people embracing change, leveraging data, cybersecurity, cloud, and change management to drive successful business outcomes that matter to our customers.


Mariners build for change. Like SHIFT Energy, our energy management and decarbonization company. Or East Valley, created to scale social economic impact in our communities through investment and mentorship of emerging change-makers and their companies.


Mariner’s purpose has always been to be a great, everlasting technology company and the core values that guide us every day are:


OUR VALUES

  • We care for our team.
  • We care about the impact we have on our community.
  • We serve by solving complex problems.
  • We grow because growth fuels opportunities.
  • We innovate always and everywhere.
  • We build a business that lasts.


OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE: 

We are seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team full-time to support our planned growth and client contract opportunities. In this role, you will play a key part in Oracle Fusion (Cloud ERP) implementations, working closely with clients, delivery teams, and sales partners to deliver high-quality, value-driven solutions.


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING IN THE ROLE:  

  • Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements, including requirements related to Oracle Fusion modules.
  • Documentation of current and future state process mapping. 
  • Prepare Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements.
  • Support data migration and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) activities in collaboration with project and client teams.
  • Define reporting and alerting requirements within the Oracle Fusion environment.
  • Prepare integration plans for deployment of system changes into existing environments. 
  • Help design, document and maintain system processes.
  • Change and support process management for new technology delivery.
  • Facilitate stakeholder sessions, interviews, and analysis to identify areas for process and systems improvement. 
  • Communicate key insights and findings to client team.


WHAT SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS YOU’LL NEED TO DO THE JOB:   

  • Post-secondary education in business, computer science, or a related field from a recognized institution.
  • 5+ years of progressive corporate experience functioning as an IT Business Analyst/Functional Analyst.
  • Experience supporting Oracle Fusion (Cloud ERP) implementations or enterprise ERP solutions.
  • CBAP certification or willing to obtain.
  • Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis and process mapping and design as part of a business transformation.
  • Experience in working in a formal systems development lifecycle methodology environment involving such artifacts as functional and detail design documents, business use cases, and requirements traceability.
  • Demonstrated skill in building consensus among process stakeholders.
  • Exceptional communication skills and experience in working with business experts at all levels and technical subject matter experts.
  • Experience working in client-based consulting role is highly desirable
  • Experience in Public sector/Government is preferred.


…AND YOU ARE...  

  • Always improving your skills and knowledge: you want to be the best at what you do  
  • Curious and creative; comfortable taking on new problems and challenges  
  • A self-starter with the ability to recommend priorities to the project leader   
  • Comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision  
  • Great problem-solving skills: thorough and reliable  
  • Able to work in a team: share knowledge and assist other team members  
  • A good communicator: able to explain your ideas and recommendations  
  • Well organized and dependable under pressure: you manage your time effectively  
  • Energized by our company values!    


MARINER OFFERS YOU:  

  • A values-driven workplace where people really matter 
  • Flexible work location support for remote work/work from home 
  • Competitive salary, retirement savings program, and rewards program  
  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans and access to e-health care  
  • Paid vacation, maternity/parental leave, paid sick leave and paid Mariner MyLife days  
  • Unlimited training   


WHY MARINER?

We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work! Not only are we passionate about nurturing a thriving technology sector here in Atlantic Canada, but we are also committed to solving technology challenges that will make an impact worldwide. Technology is everlasting, and we take pride in connecting world class talent to world class projects and business solutions.  


If you are an IT Professional, Software Professional, or Management Consultant, that is passionate about career development, data, and problem solving, we want to hear from you! If this sounds like someone you know, share this with them so they do not miss the opportunity to experience Mariner!  


To achieve this, we know we need to be all in on training and development of our team so we can continue to move the needle in the technology sector together. Of course, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our team, but our competitive edge is the development and training that our team experiences every day.  


Be part of our vibrant community that values diversity and embraces inclusion at every level. We are committed to fostering a culture where individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life feel empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. Our collaborative environment celebrates the richness of ideas and experiences, and we believe that by embracing diversity, we can achieve greater innovation and excellence together. Come and help us create a workplace that reflects the beautiful tapestry of our global community.  


Join our growing team!

v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: 5+ years IT Business Analyst experience; Oracle Fusion (Cloud ERP) experience; CBAP certification or willingness to obtain; post-secondary education in business or CS; strong communication and stakeholder management.
v5_processed_job_data.company_tagline: Values-driven technology company.
