job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
WHO WE ARE: 

Mariner innovates always and everywhere, turning novel ideas into practical solutions. From products and services to venture creation, we build better futures powered by people. We partner with people embracing change, leveraging data, cybersecurity, cloud, and change management to drive successful business outcomes that matter to our customers.


Mariners build for change. Like SHIFT Energy, our energy management and decarbonization company. Or East Valley, created to scale social economic impact in our communities through investment and mentorship of emerging change-makers and their companies.


Mariner’s purpose has always been to be a great, everlasting technology company and the core values that guide us every day are:


OUR VALUES

  • We care for our team.
  • We care about the impact we have on our community.
  • We serve by solving complex problems.
  • We grow because growth fuels opportunities.
  • We innovate always and everywhere.
  • We build a business that lasts.

 

OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE: 

We are seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our Mariner Innovations team to help in our planned growth, and contract opportunities for our clients in Atlantic Canada. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING IN THE ROLE:  

  • Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements.
  • Documentation of current and future state process mapping. 
  • Prepare Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements.
  • Collaborate in the development of test plans and test cases.
  • Define reporting and alerting requirements.
  • Prepare integration plans for deployment of system changes into existing environments. 
  • Help design, document and maintain system processes.
  • Change and support process management for new technology delivery.
  • Facilitate stakeholder sessions, interviews, and analysis to identify areas for process and systems improvement. 
  • Communicate key insights and findings to client team.

 

WHAT SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS YOU’LL NEED TO DO THE JOB:   

  • Post-secondary education in business, computer science, or a related field from a recognized institution.
  • 5+ years of progressive corporate experience functioning as an IT Business Analyst/Functional Analyst.
  • This is a hybrid role requiring onsite presence in Moncton on a regular basis.
  • CBAP certification or willing to obtain.
  • Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis and process mapping and design as part of a business transformation.
  • Experience in working in a formal systems development lifecycle methodology environment involving such artifacts as functional and detail design documents, business use cases, and requirements traceability.
  • Demonstrated skill in building consensus among process stakeholders.
  • Exceptional communication skills and experience in working with business experts at all levels and technical subject matter experts.

  

…AND YOU ARE...  

  • Always improving your skills and knowledge: you want to be the best at what you do  
  • Curious and creative; comfortable taking on new problems and challenges  
  • A self-starter with the ability to recommend priorities to the project leader   
  • Comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision  
  • Great problem-solving skills: thorough and reliable  
  • Able to work in a team: share knowledge and assist other team members  
  • A good communicator: able to explain your ideas and recommendations  
  • Well organized and dependable under pressure: you manage your time effectively  
  • Energized by our company values!    

 

MARINER OFFERS YOU:  

  • A values-driven workplace where people really matter 
  • Competitive salary, retirement savings program, and rewards program  
  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans and access to e-health care  
  • Paid vacation, maternity/parental leave, paid sick leave and paid Mariner MyLife days  
  • Unlimited training   

 

WHY MARINER? 

We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work! Not only are we passionate about nurturing a thriving technology sector here in Atlantic Canada, but we are also committed to solving technology challenges that will make an impact worldwide. Technology is everlasting, and we take pride in connecting world class talent to world class projects and business solutions.  


If you are an IT Professional, Software Professional, or Management Consultant, that is passionate about career development, data, and problem solving, we want to hear from you! If this sounds like someone you know, share this with them so they do not miss the opportunity to experience Mariner!  


To achieve this, we know we need to be all in on training and development of our team so we can continue to move the needle in the technology sector together. Of course, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our team, but our competitive edge is the development and training that our team experiences every day.  


Be part of our vibrant community that values diversity and embraces inclusion at every level. We are committed to fostering a culture where individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life feel empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. Our collaborative environment celebrates the richness of ideas and experiences, and we believe that by embracing diversity, we can achieve greater innovation and excellence together. Come and help us create a workplace that reflects the beautiful tapestry of our global community.  

 

Join our growing team!

Mariner innovates always and everywhere, turning novel ideas into practical solutions. From products and services to venture creation, we build better futures powered by people. OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE: 

We are seeking a bilingual Senior Business Analyst with a strong background in Agile and DevOps environments to join our team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring business needs are clearly understood, documented, and delivered in alignment with organizational goals.


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING IN THE ROLE:  

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders, Product Owners, and technical teams to elicit, analyze, and validate business, functional, and non-functional requirements.
  • Act as a trusted liaison between stakeholders and delivery teams, ensuring shared understanding and clear traceability of requirements.
  • Develop comprehensive user stories, use cases, process flows, and models (BPMN/UML) to communicate requirements effectively.
  • Conduct detailed analysis of current-state workflows and design optimized to-be processes aligned with DevOps and Agile delivery practices.
  • Support backlog grooming, sprint planning, and Kanban processes, ensuring alignment between business priorities and delivery capacity.
  • Apply DevOps principles to support automation, continuous integration, and iterative delivery across project lifecycles.

WHAT SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS YOU’LL NEED TO DO THE JOB:   

  • University Degree in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and professional experience.
  • Minimum 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst.
  • Bilingual proficiency in English and French is required.
  • Solid understanding of DevOps principles, lifecycle stages, and automation pipelines.
  • Expertise in creating user stories, use cases, and process models (BPMN/UML).
  • Demonstrated ability to work closely with Product Owners and technical teams to align scope with business value.
  • Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or equivalent certification is preferred.

   …AND YOU ARE...  

  • Always improving your skills and knowledge: you want to be the best at what you do
  • Curious and creative; comfortable taking on new problems and challenges  
  • A self-starter with the ability to recommend priorities to the project leader   
  • Comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision  
  • Great problem-solving skills: thorough and reliable  
  • Able to work in a team: share knowledge and assist other team members  
  • A good communicator: able to explain your ideas and recommendations  
  • Well organized and dependable under pressure: you manage your time effectively  
  • Energized by our company values!    

MARINER OFFERS YOU:  

  • A values-driven workplace where people really matter 
  • Competitive salary, retirement savings program, and rewards program  
  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans and access to e-health care  
  • Paid vacation, maternity/parental leave, paid sick leave and paid Mariner MyLife days  
  • Unlimited training    

WHY MARINER?

We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work! Not only are we passionate about nurturing a thriving technology sector here in Atlantic Canada, but we are also committed to solving technology challenges that will make an impact worldwide. Technology is everlasting, and we take pride in connecting world class talent to world class projects and business solutions.   


If you are an IT Professional, Software Professional, or Management Consultant, that is passionate about career development, data, and problem solving, we want to hear from you! If this sounds like someone you know, share this with them so they do not miss the opportunity to experience Mariner!   


To achieve this, we know we need to be all in on training and development of our team so we can continue to move the needle in the technology sector together. Of course, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our team, but our competitive edge is the development and training that our team experiences every day.  


Be part of our vibrant community that values diversity and embraces inclusion at every level. We are committed to fostering a culture where individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life feel empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. Our collaborative environment celebrates the richness of ideas and experiences, and we believe that by embracing diversity, we can achieve greater innovation and excellence together. Come and help us create a workplace that reflects the beautiful tapestry of our global community.  


Join our growing team!

job_information.title: Lead Consultant-Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Ready to build the future with AI? 
At Genpact, we don’t just keep up with technology—we set the pace. AI and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. Genpact’s AI Gigafactory, our industry-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. From large-scale models to agentic AI, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges. 
If you thrive in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment, love building and deploying cutting-edge AI solutions, and want to push the boundaries of what’s possible, this is your moment. 
Genpact (NYSE: G) is an advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers lasting value for leading enterprises globally. Through our deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead. Powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation, our teams implement data, technology, and AI to create tomorrow, today. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook. 
Inviting applications for the role of Senior Principal Consultant-Business Analyst
Business Analyst with experience in Payments and Finance domains to join its Common Platforms organization. This role will work closely with Payment Platform Product Managers and Architects, Product Business Units, Risk, Compliance, Operations, Finance, Tax, Legal, and Treasury to gather requirements and design solutions to meet Finance and Platform needs
Responsibilities
•    Own the payments and subscription management services product backlog.
•    Ensure coverage across key industry bodies. 
•    Drive scalability and reliability improvements to an international payments system processing hundreds of millions a year (and growing fast!)
•    Experiment with optimizations to both recurring billing patterns and consumer facing payments.
•    Monitor emerging trends, industry developments, regulatory change and security enhancements across the Globe.
•    Establish relationships with global community leaders for proposition development and effective implementation planning.
•    Understand and enhance complete payment orchestrator to reduce the authorization or transactions failure.
•    Take ownership of the payment process end to end, including checkout and recurring billing optimization, fraud reduction, collections, and financial reporting
•    Partner with product managers and cross-functional teams (including risk, legal, engineering, finance, design, marketing,) to identify, document and evaluate product requirements, roadmaps, and proformas.
•    Work closely with user design, project management, and engineering teams in an agile environment to launch products.
•    Work collaboratively across Product & Projects, Sales, Legal, Marketing, Digital, Service & Operations, third party service providers and other business functions to deliver successful outcomes for clients.
•    Effectively manage compliance and risk across the portfolio
•    Deliver regular reporting and analysis across the domestic payables & receivables portfolio to generate actionable insights.
•    Evangelize CyberSource/STRIPE/Adyen/Chase Payments processing capabilities and work closely with Sales and Support to drive product market launches.
Qualifications we seek in you!
Minimum Qualifications
•    B.E/Any Graduation Equivalent

Preferred Qualifications/ Skills
•    Business Analyst with experience in Payments and Finance domains

Why join Genpact? 
•    Lead AI-first transformation – Build and scale AI solutions that redefine industries 
•    Make an impact – Drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter 
•    Accelerate your career—Gain hands-on experience, world-class training, mentorship, and AI certifications to advance your skills 
•    Grow with the best – Learn from top engineers, data scientists, and AI experts in a dynamic, fast-moving workplace 
•    Committed to ethical AI – Work in an environment where governance, transparency, and security are at the core of everything we build 
•    Thrive in a values-driven culture – Our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness - built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion - allow your ideas to fuel progress 
Come join the 140,000+ coders, tech shapers, and growth makers at Genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: Up.  
Let’s build tomorrow together. 

Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.  
Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.

job_information.title: Business Analyst, Technology
job_information.description:
Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

As the Business Analyst you will act as the conduit between Technology and multiple business teams to deliver a best-in-class experience for our guests. You will be an integral part of a Discovery-focused team tasked with advancing our technology roadmap and bringing high-impact projects to life. You will lead our team by eliciting and analyzing requirements for projects, features and guest experience enhancements. Additionally, you will facilitate collaboration between business and technical resources and document business processes and/or systems and their integrations.

Meet your future team:

The Guest Services Technology team at Arc’teryx aims to set the standard in the outdoor industry as premier technology partners and experts. Collaborating with our internal partners, we design and build guest service experiences that enable our agents to deliver industry-leading customer experiences. You will be working on a small but impactful team that interacts with many departments across Arc’teryx, mainly Guest Services, ReBird and Digital Marketing.

The Discovery team is responsible for conducting research & discovery on a variety of projects, many involving or impacting our Salesforce ecosystem –  and then moving into Delivery phases. The wider team is organized into squads that include developers, administrators, quality analysts, business analysts, and product managers. We work closely and collaboratively with many other teams, including Operations, Marketing, Finance and Analytics.



Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX: As the Business Analyst you will act as the conduit between Technology and multiple business teams to deliver a best-in-class experience for our guests. You will be an integral part of a Discovery-focused team tasked with advancing our technology roadmap and bringing high-impact projects to life. You will lead our team by eliciting and analyzing requirements for projects, features and guest experience enhancements. Additionally, you will facilitate collaboration between business and technical resources and document business processes and/or systems and their integrations. Meet your future team: The Guest Services Technology team at Arc’teryx aims to set the standard in the outdoor industry as premier technology partners and experts. Collaborating with our internal partners, we design and build guest service experiences that enable our agents to deliver industry-leading customer experiences. You will be working on a small but impactful team that interacts with many departments across Arc’teryx, mainly Guest Services, ReBird and Digital Marketing. The Discovery team is responsible for conducting research & discovery on a variety of projects, many involving or impacting our Salesforce ecosystem –  and then moving into Delivery phases. The wider team is organized into squads that include developers, administrators, quality analysts, business analysts, and product managers. We work closely and collaboratively with many other teams, including Operations, Marketing, Finance and Analytics.

A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$82,000 - CAD$112,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training. The upper end of the range is typically reserved for candidates with demonstrated expertise that is above job requirements or who bring exceptional directly transferable experience.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include benefits that we offer.


If you were the Business Analyst now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
  • Leading the discovery of multiple Guest Services projects, gathering requirements using effective business analysis techniques
  • Creating and maintaining detailed documentation on a variety of projects and systems
  • Developing empathy for the guest/end-user by having the ability to incorporate Human Centered Design principles and guest journey mapping
  • Consulting with stakeholders and acting as a conduit between stakeholders and development squads
  • Translating business requirements into detailed and actionable specifications and requirements documents, calling out dependencies where relevant
  • Collaborating efficiently and effectively by building strong relationships with cross-functional teams within the overall technology department and across the business
  • Creating understandable visual representations to communicate complex concepts and models for various target audiences, including leadership level
  • Documenting detailed user stories, process flows, systems diagram flows, and acceptance criteria that will be used for business process review, systems architecture, web development, quality assurance and change management
  • Working with stakeholders and development squads to plan, groom and prioritise the product backlog to ensure work focuses on features that align with business priorities
  • Organising and facilitating user acceptance testing with business users
  • Supporting the testing and validation of system changes to ensure they meet business requirements and deliver the desired outcomes
  • Identifying and documenting current and future business process, changes, and improvements to facilitate change management
  • Maintaining process and system documentation as business and systems evolve


    • Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
  • Developing, updating, and embedding your extensive expertise on business areas & technologies in scope within the Business Analysts chapter and the agile squads

job_information.title: Business Analyst, Corporate Services
job_information.description:
Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

As Business Analyst, Corporate Services, you'll bridge business needs with technical solutions across our global corporate technology ecosystem (e.g., P&C - including Payroll and Benefits, Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, and downstream systems). You'll gather requirements, model processes, and support delivery to enable the Product Manager's roadmap and the Application Engineer's technical fabric, ensuring efficiency, compliance, and measurable value in a multicultural environment. Using tools like Jira for tracking, you'll drive process improvements that streamline operations.

This role is based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.
 
Meet Your Future Team:

You'll join a tight-knit, high-impact Corporate Systems squad (Product Manager, Application Engineer, and you as BA) that owns systems supporting ARC’TERYX’s global P&C (including Payroll and Benefits), Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, and corporate operations. We define business cases, prioritize projects, map dependencies, and deliver solutions that advance our technology roadmap - making complex back-office processes effortless.




Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX: As Business Analyst, Corporate Services, you'll bridge business needs with technical solutions across our global corporate technology ecosystem (e.g., P&C - including Payroll and Benefits, Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, and downstream systems). A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$82,000 - CAD$112,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training. The upper end of the range is typically reserved for candidates with demonstrated expertise that is above job requirements or who bring exceptional directly transferable experience.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include benefits that we offer.


If you were the Business Analyst, Corporate Systems now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing
  • Gathering and documenting business requirements from P&C, Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, and regional stakeholders, translating them into user stories and functional specs to support the PM's roadmap
  • Analyzing and optimizing business processes across corporate systems to meet needs, collaborating with the Application Engineer on data flows and connectivity (e.g., employee lifecycle, Legal/Asset Protection/Facilities handoffs)

  • Coordinating and executing testing phases to ensure flawless enhancements and releases

  • Creating and maintaining detailed documentation, including process models, functional specs, and user guides, for clarity and compliance
  • Advising on corporate systems best practices and ensuring adherence to organizational and security standards
  • Supporting change management by preparing training materials and facilitating user adoption across teams


    • Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
  • Partnering with the squad and business units to deliver cross-functional enhancements across P&C, Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, and corporate systems
  • Contributing to the evolution of our corporate systems roadmap, aligning with strategic business priorities
  • Solving complex P&C, Legal, Asset Protection, and Facilities challenges through innovative solutions
  • Streamlining processes by automating repetitive tasks and reducing inefficiencies (e.g., onboarding - facilities access, and asset protection)
  • Collaborating with global teams on multicultural projects, enhancing system accessibility for diverse stakeholders
  • Building self-service capabilities and canonical data models (e.g., Employee, Asset, Facility) to support the Application Engineer's event-driven architecture shift
  • Establishing support processes, runbooks, and SLAs in collaboration with the team (e.g., incident response for Asset Protection alerts)


    • Are you our next Business Analyst, Corporate Services?
  • You have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field
  • You have 3+ years of business analysis experience in enterprise environments, ideally with corporate systems (P&C, Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, integrations)
  • You have strong understanding of P&C (including Payroll and Benefits), Legal, Asset Protection, Facilities, and corporate processes
  • You have experience with enterprise integrations and data models from a business perspective
  • You are skilled in analytical thinking, breaking down complex problems into actionable solutions

  • You have basic project management skills and are comfortable managing timelines and deliverables
  • You’re adaptable, thriving in both independent and collaborative, team-oriented settings
  • You have a continuous improvement mindset, eager to learn and drive organizational growth

We are looking for a BI Business Analyst to join our team and play a key role in shaping and delivering our data initiatives. You will be responsible for understanding business needs, translating them into actionable BI requirements, and enabling the development of high-quality data solutions. Acting as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams, you will contribute to designing, documenting, and implementing BI capabilities that support strategic and operational decision-making.

What You Will Do

  • Analyze and document business processes, data needs, and BI requirements.

  • Produce functional and technical deliverables, including business requirements, process reviews, data mappings, ETL rules, test cases, and detailed functional specifications.

  • Lead workshops with stakeholders to collect needs, clarify requirements, and ensure alignment.

  • Work closely with IT teams to define technical specifications and support solution design.

  • Propose data-driven solutions to business challenges.

  • Model and formalize business processes.

  • Support data analysis activities to enhance BI solutions.

  • Manage the full lifecycle of requests—from requirements to delivery.

  • Prioritize the functional backlog in collaboration with the Product Owner or Manager.

  • Collaborate with technical teams on incident resolution and operational support.

  • Contribute to BI planning, roadmap discussions, and process improvements.

Your Profile

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent.

  • 5 to 10 years of experience in Business Intelligence.

  • 3 to 6 years as a Business Analyst, ideally on large-scale BI or data transformation projects.

Technical Skills

  • Strong knowledge of data warehouse modeling, ETL concepts, and Data Lake environments.

  • Hands-on experience with Microsoft technologies: SQL Server, SSIS, Power BI, Azure Data Factory.

  • Proven experience in Master Data Management (MDM) with tools such as Informatica, Profisee, or equivalent.

  • Knowledge of AWS SDLF, Snowflake, and modern cloud data architectures.

  • Familiarity with DevOps practices and Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Soft Skills

  • Strong analytical thinking, autonomy, and initiative.

  • Excellent communication skills in French and English (bilingualism required).

  • Ability to facilitate workshops, engage stakeholders, and translate needs into actionable requirements.

  • Team-oriented, solution-driven, with strong interpersonal and pedagogical abilities.

Why Join Us?

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

  • Participate in a major data transformation program with strong growth opportunities.

  • Contribute to building modern, scalable BI and data solutions.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Location:

Mississauga, Ontario – Hybrid (4 days/week in office)

Company:

Mattamy Asset Management

Department:

IT Enterprise Services

Employment Type:

Full-Time

Reports to:

Director, Homebuilding Technologies

 

At Mattamy Asset Management (MAM), everyone has an important role to play in our shared success. Developing thoughtfully planned communities is complex work and our diverse teams come together to deliver on that mission in every aspect. We are thoughtful planners, precise project managers and practiced subject matter experts. And in each area of our evolving business, we are trusted to drive results. Here, your opinion will be invited, and your contributions will count. You’ll be surrounded by caring people who encourage you to be exactly who you are. You’ll grow in your area of expertise, learning alongside committed colleagues. With a relentless focus on industry leadership and a deep commitment to sustainability, we’ve got big plans for the future – and for you.

 

Learn more about what makes working at Mattamy special and our award-winning culture.

 

What we offer

The Business Analyst, reporting to the Director of Homebuilding Technologies, will support business applications across US and Canadian operations. As part of the IT Enterprise Services team, they will analyze, implement and support application solutions aligned with business processes. This role involves collaborating with internal stakeholders and external IT partners to deliver efficient, high-quality and cost-effective application services throughout the solution delivery lifecycle.

 

What you’ll do

  • Lead process improvement discussions ensuring the process and solution align to the business need
  • Gather and document requirements representing stakeholder needs, with as-is & to be process flows
  • Ensure expected business value aligns to requirements and proposed solution
  • Own accuracy and completeness of platform / project documents
  • Manage scope ensuring impact of changes are contained and agreed upon based on value expected
  • Perform configuration activities within platform to support defined objectives
  • Troubleshoot issues, ID root cause and action the resolution steps to resolve
  • Create and propose component designs and recommendations to meet needs within solution or platform
  • Work with business and delivery teams to prioritize requirements.
  • Review delivery team output to ensure requirements are correctly interpreted.
  • define and execute test cases.
  • Identify and assist in prioritizing opportunities to streamline business processes.

 

 What you bring

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years in an analyst role focused on documenting requirements and mapping them to product / platform / solution
  • Experience working in an agile team and familiarity with principles of agile delivery
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills with ability to create and execute associated action plans
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical information in a condensed manner to various stakeholders verbally and in writing.
  • Experience creating documentation such as business case documentation or business requirements summaries.
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, planning and time management skills.
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities simultaneously. 

 

Bonus Points

  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365, JD Edwards & construction management solutions such as Procore or BuildPro

 

Compensation

The expected base salary range for this position is $57,500 - $87,500. Actual pay may vary depending on your job-related knowledge, competencies, and skills. We recognize that exceptional situations may fall outside this range, and we encourage all interested candidates to apply.

You are also eligible to participate in Mattamy’s annual bonus program which gives you the opportunity to increase your total compensation if business and individual goals are achieved.

 

We encourage applicants who meet most of the role requirements to hit that submit button and apply! It’s okay if you don’t have 100% of the requirements. If you’re the right candidate, we’ll help you learn and grow.

 

Who we are

Mattamy Asset Management (MAM) is the parent company of Mattamy Homes Canada and Mattamy Homes U.S., which together make up the largest family-owned homebuilding platform in North America.

 

Be yourself. We want it that way.

At Mattamy, we're passionate a​b​​out creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone ​can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important to the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues, and communities. From how we build our teams to cultivating our leaders, we're on a journey toward a welcoming, barrier-free culture for everyone. ​​​​

 

Mattamy Asset Management is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

job_information.title: Business Analyst Consultant - Calgary (future opportunities - 2026)
job_information.description:
Company Description:

Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.

Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst with a proven track record in IT projects and a deep understanding of the utilities or oil & gas industry. As a Business Analyst at Sia, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. You will work closely with clients to understand their strategic goals, analyze business challenges, and deliver innovative and actionable insights.

**Please note the following:

  • While our offices are located in Alberta, you may be asked to work East Coast hours should our client have that requirement.
  • Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and the position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found

Key Responsibilities 

  • Facilitates and creates business process maps 
  • Analyze process models of the current state (As-Is) and compare them to the future states (To-be) and determine the necessary changes for arriving at the end state in addition to identification of change impacts to roles in the processes
  • Identify, document and analyze business rules that govern the implementation of business processes 
  • Assist on fit/gap analysis of solutions
  • Participate in planning initiatives, feasibility studies, cost/benefit analyses, new deliverables
  • Examine processes holistically to understand the impact of changing them on people, strategy, existing software applications and general business operations 
  • Monitor and measure the effectiveness of processes to ensure consistent value delivery 
  • Participate in quality reviews to ensure traceability of the designs to the requirements 
  • Assist in review and / or creation of training materials
  • Support change management activities
  • Use Business Analysis industry tools and techniques, to document information needs and functional requirements
  • Perform subject matter research and business analysis
  • Research, analyze, identify system gaps, recommend, and participate in the deployment of solutions
  • Create/review Business Requirement Documents (BRD) and translation of BRD to functional specifications and traceability matrices
  • Participate in testing - test and execute processes to ensure that the right results are achieved 
  • Facilitate User Acceptance Testing
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering or information technology or equivalent education plus experience 
  • 5-10 years experience working as a Business Analyst or PM/Scrum Master on IT projects
  • Experience working specifically with Microsoft technologies will be considered an asset
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies (understanding the roles and responsibilities of various team members). Any formal SCRUM or AGILE certifications will be considered an asset
  • Strong presentation and facilitation skills. Ability to interact with key business stakeholders as well as technical team members
  • Experience and knowledge of project management principles and methodologies
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
  • Motivated by an entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable with ambiguity
  • Confident, self-aware collaborator open to receiving and providing, effective feedback
  • Business Analyst Certification is considered an asset
  • Change Management Certification is considered an asset
Additional Information:

WHAT DO WE OFFER? 

This is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing team to serve some of the most exciting and highly respected companies in the world. You will have the opportunity to provide clients with pioneer mind-set thinking, customized solutions, and you will often have the satisfaction of seeing the impact of your work on their business. We are committed to a healthy work-life integration.

BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary with a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses
  • Healthcare that includes dental, vision, life insurance, and RRSP contributions
  • Career advocacy program that supports achieving personal development goals through coaching, collaboration, and real-time feedback
  • Robust learning and development platform through the Sia Institute, Working Groups and Training

  • Your team will consist of highly educated, specialised and entrepreneurial consultants within a company which is a successful player in the global consulting market
  • Working in an  environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world

DEIB

Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) are part of Sia’s DNA. We’re confident that promoting DEIB creates an environment in which everyone can reach their full potential.

Sia is a next-generation management consulting firm and pioneer of Consulting 4.0. Our continued success and expansion are primarily due to the quality of our team members. Our consultants work closely with the C-suite at our clients to accelerate and de-risk business growth while improving their customer and employee experience. 

Job Description:

Job Description

As a Business Analyst at Sia, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. You will work closely with clients to understand their strategic goals, analyze business challenges, and deliver innovative and actionable insights.

**Please note the following:

  • Support change management activities
  • Use Business Analysis industry tools and techniques, to document information needs and functional requirements

  • Facilitate User Acceptance Testing

job_information.description:
Company Description:

Sia est un groupe international de conseil en management de nouvelle génération. Fondé en 1999, nous sommes nés à l’ère du numérique. Aujourd’hui, nos services en stratégie et management sont augmentés par la data science, enrichis par la créativité et guidés par la responsabilité. Nous aidons nos clients à initier, naviguer et tirer profit des transformations. Nous croyons que l’optimisme est un accélérateur de performance, permettant de réduire les risques et de maximiser les opportunités. Grâce à une expertise couvrant de nombreux secteurs et services, nos 3 000 consultants accompagnent nos clients dans le monde entier depuis 48 bureaux répartis dans 19 pays. Notre expertise produit des résultats concrets. Notre optimisme change la donne.

Job Description:

En tant que Consultant(e) - Analyste d’affaires, vous serez amené(e) à travailler sur:

  • La participation à la collecte des besoins d’affaires : identification des besoins et rédaction des récits d'utilisateur; 
  • La participation à la priorisation des récits d’utilisateur; 
  • La validation de la conception et/ou les preuves de concept proposées;

  • La coordination des  liens avec les autres experts TI internes et externes;
  • La documentation des contraintes d’affaires;
  • Fournir une estimation des efforts pour chacun des livrables attendus;
  • L’évaluation des impacts systèmes et dépendances;
Qualifications:

Issu(e) d'une formation universitaire en ingénierie ou en administration, vous justifiez nécessairement 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine des TI.

Vous maîtrisez la méthodologie Agile ainsi que la capacité à synthétiser, vulgariser et expliquer des concepts, des problématiques, des enjeux et de faire des liens entre différentes informations. 

Vous possédez une capacité d’analyse et de savoir-faire technique. 

Vous disposez d’une habilité à organiser et animer des groupes de travail.

Français, anglais professionnel courant indispensable.

Additional Information:

Poste basé à Montréal (Vieux-Port). Station de métro Square-Victoria.
 

Vous souhaitez rejoindre un environnement professionnel motivant où vous partagerez les valeurs que sont la culture du résultat, la qualité et la satisfaction client ? Rejoignez-nous !

job_information.title: Junior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
We are TRADER, a Canadian leader in digital automotive solutions. Our flagship brands — AutoTrader.ca, AutoSync, Dealertrack Canada and CMS — help Canadians buy, sell, and finance vehicles with confidence. As part of AutoScout24 group, Europe’s largest online car marketplace, we’re shaping the future of automotive retail in Canada and beyond.
Learn more at tradercorporation.com.
 
This role will be within the AutoSync team. AutoSync supports over 3,500 dealerships nationwide, delivering cutting-edge software tools to simplify operations, boost marketing, and drive sales.
 

We are seeking an innovative and driven Junior Business Analyst representative that has a desire to have a lasting impact on the company's data systems and processes. 
 
Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Reporting:

  • Support data collection, cleaning, and validation.
  • Analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Excel, Google Sheets, Power BI, or Tableau.

Process Improvement:

  • Document current (“as-is”) processes and help identify inefficiencies.
  • Contribute to the design of improved (“to-be”) workflows.
  • Assist in recommending solutions to optimize operations, reduce costs, and enhance customer experience.

 Data Accuracy:

  • Ensuring and maintaining data accuracy.
  • Develop scripts to automate various tasks through the use of Python.
  • Establish data pipelines through web scraping.
  • Process Big Data to provide analytical insight.
  • Collaborating with other teams as needed to create solutions to streamline processes.

Requirements Gathering & Documentation:

  • Assist in collecting and documenting business requirements from stakeholders.
  • Participate in workshops, interviews, and meetings to understand operational needs.
  • Help prepare requirement specifications, user stories, and process maps.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Advanced understanding of analytics tools (Excel, SQL, BI tools).
  • Familiarity with process modeling (e.g., BPMN, flowcharts).
  • Understanding of Agile/Scrum concepts is a plus.
  • Intermediate experience with requirements documentation and data analysis.
  • Working knowledge of Python and various Python libraries.
  • Understanding of object-oriented software design.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams.
  • Curiosity and willingness to learn.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, IT, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Internships or coursework related to business analysis, operations, or data analytics are advantageous.

The base salary range for this position is CAD $54k - $58k.

This range reflects the expected compensation at the time of posting. The final offer may vary and can be higher based on relevant skills, experience, location, and market conditions. Based on the role the total rewards package may also include benefits, bonus, and other employee offerings.

 

What’s in it for you…
  • Gym discounts
  • Employee and Family Assistance program
  • Virtual wellness events
  • Conferences & training budget
  • Regular internal training programs
  • Financial planning with 3% matching Pension 
  • Competitive salary
  • Annual bonus structure 

 

Use of Artificial Intelligence in Hiring: We use artificial intelligence (“AI”) in our hiring process, including to screen, assess, or select applicants for this position.

Vacancy Status: This job posting is for an existing vacancy.

job_information.title: Business Analyst (FTE Only)
job_information.description:
Overview:

Adastra is looking for a Business Analyst who turns complex enterprise data into clear, actionable solutions. You’ll map data flows, define requirements, and collaborate with business and technical teams to make sure reporting and analytics truly deliver value. If you enjoy solving complex problems with data and shaping how teams make decisions, this role puts you at the center of it all.

 

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid 2-Day) 

Status: Full-Time 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Elicit, gather, and document business and technical requirements for data-driven projects
  • Produce functional and non-functional business requirements, solution specifications, and workflow/process documentation
  • Analyze enterprise data and identify sources to support reporting, analytics, and data warehouse initiatives
  • Create and maintain Source-to-Target Mapping (STM) documents for data warehouse / data mart projects
  • Document the flow and transformation of data from source systems to Data Warehouse/Data Marts and from Data Warehouse/Data Marts to downstream applications
  • Collaborate with business sponsors, technology teams, and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure delivered solutions meet business intent and provide value
  • Perform data profiling and analysis using SQL to validate data, derive complex business logic, and support reporting/analytics needs
  • Assist with user acceptance testing (UAT), data validation, and other quality assurance activities
  • Coordinate with multiple teams, manage priorities, and handle ambiguous requirements effectively

Qualifications, Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
  • 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in Data Warehouse / Data Mart environments
  • Hands-on experience eliciting business requirements and producing functional/non-functional specifications
  • Strong SQL skills, with the ability to write complex queries for data extraction and analysis
  • Experience creating and maintaining Source-to-Target Mapping (STM) documents
  • Familiarity with enterprise applications and data management processes
  • Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and ability to translate ambiguous requirements into actionable outcomes
  • Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement, and documentation skills
  • Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams with both business and technical groups
  • Strong organization, coordination, and time management skills

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with call center or customer data environments
  • Familiarity with data governance, compliance, or security standards in analytics projects
  • Experience with BI tools beyond Power BI, such as Tableau or Looker
  • Exposure to Agile project delivery and tools like Jira or Confluence
  • Understanding of business system architecture and enterprise application integrations
  • Ability to perform data modeling or advanced analytics to support reporting and decision-making

About Adastra

For more than 25 years, Adastra Corporation has been hyper-focused on data and the infrastructures to support it.  We are an international consulting company working work with businesses and IT Leaders to extract value through data and analytic solutions in the domains of Cloud, Data Management, Analytics, AI and ML, Governance, Hyper Automation, and Enterprise Application Development.  Our team of experts, combined with our worldclass data management platform, helps provide trusted insights, establish frameworks, enforce best practices,  and streamline processes for around-the-clock global coverage.  Adastra has a proven track record of helping organizations of all sizes – from SMEs to Fortune 1000s – achieve their data transformation goals, whether that be accelerating innovation, improving operational excellence, or creating unforgettable customer experiences.

 

What We Offer

  • Opportunity for advancement and career progression
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits plan
  • Successful referral program
  • The opportunity to work with one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies
  • Satisfaction of working for a reputable company 
  • A flexible, dynamic, and diverse workplace

Equal Opportunity Employer

In our commitment to promote fair and equitable treatment of all employees and applicants, Adastra Corporation provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of age, sex, disability, race, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other ground as described in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In addition, accommodation will be provided during the hiring process. Adastra Corporation’s implementation and support of employment initiatives, encourage diversified labour force participation and equal access to opportunities based on merit and performance.

 

There has been an increased instance of fraudulent job offers coming from people posing as Adastra HR employees. Please note that Adastra will never request fees as part of our recruiting process and any emails sent to you that are not from ‘@adastragrp.com’ or ‘@talent.icims.com’ are fraudulent. All employment offers are sent via DocuSign and if you receive an employment offer from a suspicious email and not via DocuSign, it is fraudulent.

 

Contact careers@adastragrp.com to inquire about jobs at Adastra, to report a suspicious request for money or personal information from external websites or suspicious employment offers.

job_information.title: Data Product Analyst
job_information.description:
Overview:

The Data Product Analyst serves as a critical bridge between business stakeholders, analytics teams, and data management groups. This role combines strong data analysis capabilities with core business analysis skills to ensure that data is effectively leveraged to inform strategic decision making, improve processes, and influence solution design. In addition to championing data stewardship, the Data Product Analyst plays a key role in eliciting requirements, documenting business processes, and facilitating alignment across technical and business teams.

 

Location: Across Canada & USA

Status: Contract, Remote 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Act as the Data Subject Matter Expert to stakeholders with an understanding of data across the end‑to‑end data supply chain
  • Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights
  • Translate analytical findings into clear, business‑friendly insights that support decision‑making
  • Elicit, document, and manage business, functional, and non‑functional requirements through techniques such as interviews, workshops, process analysis, and user story creation
  • Conduct stakeholder analysis to understand needs, roles, dependencies, and expectations across teams
  • Support prioritization by assessing business value, impacts, complexity, and risk
  • Ensure traceability of requirements from intake through development, testing, and deployment
  • Collaborate with data engineering analysts, architects, and engineers to ensure solutions reflect business context and use cases
  • Define testing acceptance criteria, support user validation, and provide structured feedback for continuous improvement
  • Monitor and enhance data quality through profiling, validation, remediation, and alignment with organizational priorities

Qualifications, Skills, & Experience: 

  • Bachelor's degree in information systems, business analysis, or related fields
  • 2–5 years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, product analytics, or similar roles
  • Proven ability to work effectively in cross‑functional environments and support the delivery of data products that serve multiple stakeholders
  • Skilled at requirements elicitation, process mapping, and translating business needs into technical specifications
  • Skilled in crafting user stories, acceptance criteria, and high‑quality product and data documentation to support scalable, repeatable workflows
  • Strong understanding of data stewardship principles, including data quality, lineage, metadata management, and responsible data use and the ability to adapt analytical and stewardship skills across a wide range of NFL use cases
  • Comfortable connecting data across multiple NFL systems and enriching datasets to enable new insights for football, fan, and business stakeholders
  • Excellent communication, with the ability to tailor messages for both technical teams (engineering, data science) and business stakeholders (club personnel, league departments)
  • Champions a consumer-first mindset, consistently grounding product, data and insights decisions with a deep understanding of consumer behaviors and needs
  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to influence without authority and drive alignment across cross‑functional teams
  • Skilled at navigating ambiguity, asking the right clarifying questions, and moving teams toward clarity and action
  • Naturally curious, with a passion for exploring new data sources, uncovering insights, and improving data quality
  • Strong critical thinking and structured problem‑solving, especially when interpreting incomplete, messy, or evolving datasets
  • Strong analytical toolkit leveraging SQL, Python, and data querying tools to explore, transform, and validate complex datasets that span across multiple product disciplines
  • Working knowledge of data modeling, ETL/ELT pipelines, and cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks, AWS) to support reliable data products

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
JOB SUMMARY

The Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing and optimizing inventory management processes within the Specialty Pharmacy department. This role leverages data-driven insights to improve ERP system accuracy, streamline workflows, and support strategic decision-making. The position requires close collaboration with internal stakeholders – including finance, procurement, and pharmacy operations – to identify opportunities for efficiency, cost savings, and risk mitigation. Additional roles in special projects and close inventory monitoring will be required. Success in this role depends on strong analytical capabilities, proficiency with digital systems, and the ability to translate business requirements into actionable solutions that enhance operational performance.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

•                     Conduct detailed analysis of inventory data to identify trends, variances, and process improvement opportunities that align with business objectives.

•                     Translate business requirements into system enhancements and workflow optimizations for ERP and pharmacy dispensing platforms.

•                     Accurately manages purchase/sales of  inventory from various distributers/suppliers into the ERP

•                     Develop and maintain inventory forecasting models using historical data, market trends, and seasonal patterns to support strategic planning.

•                     Support Pharmacy Managers to identify and implement cost effective measures

•                     Prepare and present actionable insights and recommendations to leadership for cost optimization and operational efficiency.

•                     Collaborate with cross-functional teams – including procurement, finance, supply chain, and pharmacy operations – to define requirements and implement solutions.

•                     Monitor and validate data integrity across ERP and dispensing systems, ensuring compliance with established standards.

•                     Evaluates multi-SKU products for order accuracy and provides support to pharmacy purchasing teams

•                     Design and generate KPI dashboards and performance reports to track inventory accuracy, operational metrics, and compliance indicators.

•                     Identify and escalate risks impacting inventory performance or business objectives to appropriate stakeholders.

•                     Supports an effective, ongoing cycle count and full annual inventory count program with the Risk Mitigation Manager, Finance and Pharmacy Operations

•                     Support implementation of automation tools and inventory control systems to streamline processes and reduce manual intervention.

•                     Validates open orders and ensures timely review by Pharmacy Operations

•                     Support generation of inventory, KPI, and compliance metricreports for review by the Risk Mitigation Manager on a regular basis and as required

•                     Performs and documents accurate inventory adjustments as per validated process

•                     Participate in continuous improvement initiatives, leveraging data analytics to enhance inventory management strategies.

•                     Facilitate regular stakeholder meetings to share insights, resolve issues, and align on process improvements.

•                     Ensure adherence to corporate policies, quality assurance standards, and confidentiality requirements.

•                     Participates in proactive Health & Safety activities while performing all duties.  Is responsible to notify immediate Supervisor of any Health & Safety risks or concerns.

•                     Regularly meet with Pharmacy Management team as required to share information, solve problems, improve efficiencies, and develop policies and procedures to ensure optimal inventory operations

•                     Works with Manager, National Pharmacy Operations regarding any performance management issues or concerns

•                    Performs other duties as assigned to support business objectives


QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience

•                     Minimum college diploma in Business Operations or equivalent experience

•                     Experience in healthcare or pharmaceutical industry is preferred

•                     Working knowledge of ERP’s such as Microsoft Navision is required

•                     Experience with pharmacy dispensing software preferred

•                     Familiarity with pharmacy automation and robotics

•                     Minimum 3-5 years of experience as an analyst or in a comparable role with a strong focus on data analytics and inventory management.

•                     Flexible and adaptable to fulfill business needs

•                     Driven to improve processes and innovate for efficiency

•                     Strong computer skills in MS Office

•                     Advanced Excel skills are required

Language Skills

•                     Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

•                     Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to employees of the organization.

Other Skills and Abilities

•                     Ability to organize workload for efficient use of time

•                     Ability to function independently and be self-motivated 

•                     Ability to collaborate and achieve mutual goals

•                     Strong attention to detail with the ability to handle competing priorities

•                     Excellent problem-solving skills and resilience

job_information.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_information.description:
JOB SUMMARY 
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst for the Specialty Reporting Services team will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The team member will have the ability to develop complex and appealing visualizations using a variety of BI Tools based on tightly established client turnaround times.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Implementation of new reporting processes and procedures as required such as moving to automated reporting methods
• Analyze reports for trends and variances across the programs and communicate findings
• Design and prepare monthly, bimonthly or quarterly business reports including metrics/volumes and significant case summaries to clients using a variety of tools, including; Excel, Power BI, SSRS, PowerPoint
• Convert data to usable information to drive growth, individual contract KPI’s and increased productivity
• Act as the subject matter expert for specific Bayshore Specialty Rx Ltd data sets and act as a liaison with internal management and clients as required
• Test and debug reporting and analysis using standard tools including but not limited to Excel, Access, CRM and other database management tools/systems
• Interpret data and develop actionable recommendations for business leaders
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
• Ability to respond to customer inquiries and reporting needs efficiently as well as adapt to rapidly evolving client requirements
• Knowledge of SQL queries to acquire data from primary and secondary data sources is desirable
• Formulating and communicating meaningful and actionable process plans
• Participate in ongoing internal and/or external continuing education activities
• Adhere to Bayshore Policies and Procedure
• Participate in quality activities and continuous improvement initiatives in keeping with the company’s Quality Management System
• Participates in proactive Health & Safety activities while performing all duties. Is responsible to notify immediate Supervisor of any health and safety risks or concerns. Responsible for completing Accident Reports for all direct reports who injure themselves on the job, within 24 hours of the incident.
• Maintains confidentiality of client and corporate information and discusses same only with appropriate Bayshore personnel.
 


QUALIFICATIONS 
EDUCATION 
• Bachelor’s degree in information technology, statistics or data analysis

EXPERIENCE 
• Expert level Power BI, Excel, and Dashboarding Skills
• Minimum 2 years of experience working with complex data sets
• Minimum 2 years of experience in analyzing and presenting results to stakeholders and clients
• Minimum 2 years of experience with SQL and VBA is an asset
• Data mining and in-depth knowledge of Data Science techniques is an assent
• Experience working with pharmaceutical data is an asset

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES 
• Strong written and verbal communication skills

v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: Bachelor’s degree in IT, statistics or data analysis; expert Power BI and Excel; 2+ years data analysis; SQL/VBA a plus; pharma data experience a plus.
v5_processed_job_data.company_tagline: A health services data analytics and information technology provider.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst (Remote Canada)
job_information.description:
OneVest is a fast-growing technology company on a mission to Power the World’s Wealth by revolutionizing how financial institutions deliver wealth management services. We are an innovative team that thrives on creativity, collaboration, and the pursuit of excellence. We’ve been listed as one of Forbes's best start-up employers, and named on the WealthTech100 list for 2024. OneVest is backed by notable investors including Salesforce Ventures, Allianz Life Ventures, TIAA Ventures, OMERS Ventures, Fin Capital, Deloitte Ventures, and more. If you’re passionate about finance, technology, and making a real impact, this is the perfect opportunity to be part of something big.

Location: This role is open to candidates across Canada

We are seeking a full-time Senior Business Analyst to be part of our Implementation team. As the Senior Business Analyst, you will help our enterprise customers implement OneVest products and services. You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand customer’s business objectives, gather requirements, conduct analysis, and define, develop, and deliver optimum solutions. This role is a great fit for those looking to get involved in implementation and build a career in project delivery.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Engage in project mobilization: Participate in internal hand-off sessions with Presales and Solutions Architects as well as procure customer environments. 
  • Participate in Discovery sessions: Capture and validate standard and non-standard client implementation requirements pertaining to configurations for workflows, user views, role permissions, administration settings, and data integration requirements for customer use cases. 
  • Solution Analysis: Collaborate with Solutions Architects, Implementation Managers, Solution Engineers, and Product Managers to analyze requirements and develop solutions to implement them.
  • Process Engineering: Create a process engineering plan in collaboration with customer resources to align customer processes to OV products.
  • Data Analysis and Mapping: Analyze customer data by manipulating CSV, JSON, and/or spreadsheets mapping it to existing data elements in the OneVest data dictionary and in collaboration with Solution Engineers and Product Managers add new entries to the data dictionary/database as appropriate.
  • Create Customer Organization structures: Discover and set up organization structures, user roles, permissions, page configurations, and collaborate with Solutions Engineers to build workflows.
  • Drive high quality customer outcomes: Perform functional testing, validation of configurations, and provide support for internal quality assurance, as well as customer’s user acceptance testing.
  • Provide customer demos: Demo configurations and integrations to customers eliciting feedback to improve the end-user experience prior to hand-off to customers for user acceptance testing.
  • Support project management: Collaborate with the Implementation Manager in ongoing planning, risk mitigation, issue resolution, escalations, and delivering simultaneously for multiple customer projects.
  • Provide subject matter expertise: Act as an SME for customers to assist in navigating their implementation from project kick-off through to launch.
  • Participate in change management: Identify and document change requests as part of the change management process
  • Participate in training: Lead end-user training and train the trainer sessions.
  • Transition Live Customers: Collaborate with internal teams (Product & Technology, Implementation, Revenue) to improve the seamless transition of the customer from implementation to business as usual
  • Deliver customer documentation: Working with internal teams (Product and Implementation), contribute to development of customer-facing content; training documentation, knowledge base, and FAQs.
  • Facilitate continuous improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement of internal processes, procedures, and templates to ensure a seamless customer experience.
  • Personal time management: Manage & prioritize multiple fast-paced projects at any given time.
  • Mentor: Mentor Business Analysts to help them learn the Wealth Management industry and grow their analytical skills.

Must Haves:

  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Operations, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar.
  • 7+ years experience as a Business Analyst in Fintech, Consulting in Financial Services, or Wealth Management, or similar.
  • Knowledge of how a Wealth Management firm operates from the front to back office.
  • Experience in technical scope documentation and solution configuration for B2B customers with track record of scope and change control.
  • Proficiency in metadata and data dictionary management with CSV, JSON and spreadsheets using Excel/Google Sheets and/or similar data treatment tools.
  • Ability to manage large datasets, spreadsheets and understand querying this data.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to negotiate scope/out of scope features with customers.

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience as a Business Analyst specifically at Addepar, InvestCloud, Envestnet, Broadridge, Orion, FNZ, SS&C, or similar.
  • Understanding of Project Management principles and SaaS delivery.
  • Experience participating in Agile deliveries and utilizing tooling such as Asana, Jira, or SalesForce.
  • Implementations of financial technology products that are configurable to customer’s requirements.
  • Fluent in French.

What It’s Like To Work With Us:

  • Culture: It’s fun, rewarding, fast-paced - and we build cool stuff, too! 
  • Vacation: 4 weeks of vacation in addition to a company wide shutdown between Christmas and New Year
  • Flexibility: A flexible & hybrid working environment
  • Health & Wellness: Comprehensive Group Health, Dental and Vision Benefit Plan right from the start
  • Equity: Employee Stock Option Purchase Plan 

Sound like a good fit? Apply today!
Don’t meet every single requirement? We encourage you to apply anyways. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we would still like to review your resume. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

OneVest is dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including those with visible and non-visible disabilities. If you require accommodations at any stage of the recruitment and selection process, please reach out to recruiting@onevest.com and we’ll be happy to support you.

AI Use In Our Hiring Process:

OneVest does not currently use AI to screen, assess, or select candidates as part of the recruitment process.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Who We Are

Simon Fraser University is a leading research university, advancing an inclusive and sustainable future. Our purpose – the essence of SFU – is to create and connect knowledge, learning and community for deeper understanding and meaningful impact. We are committed to fostering excellence, innovation, belonging and community in all that we do.

SFU IT Services empowers the university to thrive and innovate through the effective use of data and technology, and is focused on improving the digital experience for our students, faculty, researchers and staff. Join our growing team as we build new solutions and services to support SFU’s academic and research mission.

About the Role

The Business Analyst (BA) participates in all phases of analysis involving medium complexity business requirements for medium to large software solutions involving cross-functional clients. The BA analyzes business needs and documents business processes; facilitates the development of recommendations to streamline processes; and develops functional specifications for software implementation, development, and integration.

Full Job Description

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Business Administration and 2 years of related experience in areas such as business analysis, working with enterprise level applications in a large, complex, technically focused environment, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. 

  • Good knowledge of requirements elicitation, quality assurance, and change management best practices.
  • Good knowledge of facilitating business process re-engineering and improvement.
  • Good knowledge of the Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN).
  • Strong leadership and mentorship skills.
  • Strong analytical reasoning, problem solving, time management, and organizational skills.
     

What We Offer

At SFU, our goal is to ensure our people are valued and supported by promoting a healthy work-life balance, professional growth and development, as well as a safe and respectful workplace. We offer temporary employees who belong in the Administrative & Professional Staff Association (APSA):

  • An additional 7% pay in lieu of benefits & 8% vacation pay
  • Employer paid extended health & dental plans
  • Professional development funds (minimum contract period of 1 year)
  • Hybrid-work program for eligible positions

Additional Information

The assignment end date is March 31, 2027.

Please include your cover letter and resume in one attachment.

SFU is an equity employer and strongly encourages applications from all qualified individuals including women, Indigenous Peoples, visible minorities, people of all sexual orientations and gender identities, persons with disabilities, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of the university.

We are committed to ensuring that the application and interview process is accessible to all applicants. If you require any assistance or accommodations, please contact pei_reception@sfu.ca.

job_information.title: Financial Analyst
job_information.description:
Who We Are

Simon Fraser University is a leading research university, advancing an inclusive and sustainable future. Our purpose – the essence of SFU – is to create and connect knowledge, learning and community for deeper understanding and meaningful impact. We are committed to fostering excellence, innovation, belonging and community in all that we do.

About the Role

Reports to the Director of Finance in the VPRI Office with a strong team to support the Research Offices. We have a great hybrid arrangement primarily working in the office 2-3 days a week. We value work-life balance and although we have busier times in the year, we are mindful of employee work culture.

The Financial Analyst manages the annual budget planning process and internal/external financial reporting; and the operating and specific purpose budgets and funds within various units in the Vice-President, Research and Innovation (VPRI) portfolio. The Financial Analyst provides financial administrative advice, consultation, assistance, and problem solving to the unit Directors and supports the development and claims process for major institutional infrastructure awards.

We’re looking for a highly self-motivated individual who thrives in a dynamic environment and enjoys working on monthly recurring tasks as well as a variety of ad hoc projects. The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and adaptable, with strong analytical and communication skills.

The ideal candidate welcomes working collaboratively with the team members. The candidate should also be very self-motivated as it is a hybrid work arrangement.

Full Job Description 

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration with a professional accounting designation (CPA), and five years of related work experience, including experience in financial management within a corporate or university environment, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

  • Excellent financial, budget management, accounting, and administrative skills.
  • Excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to exercise tact and diplomacy.
  • Ability to provide consultative advice and to collaborate with others.
  • Ability to exercise mature judgement and initiative.

What We Offer

At SFU, our goal is to ensure our people are valued and supported by promoting a healthy work-life balance, professional growth and development, as well as a safe and respectful workplace. We offer temporary employees who belong in the Administrative & Professional Staff Association (APSA):

  • Employer paid extended health & dental plans
  • Professional development funds (minimum contract period of 1 year)
