job_information.title: Credit Analyst - Business Banking
job_information.description:
Application Deadline:

02/12/2026

Address:

3225 St-Martin Ouest Blvd

Job Family Group:

Commercial Sales & Service

Performs ongoing comprehensive client credit analysis for an assigned number of client portfolios to assess the business entity’s overall financial health and credit risk using discretionary authority within prescribed limits. Applies lending expertise to a lending product portfolio or part of the lending process (e.g. underwriting, funding, monitoring). Makes credit decisions or provides timely advice to the business banking relationship manager for action in compliance with internal controls and audit, regulatory, and Bank policies and procedures.

  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
  • Coordinates the management of databases; ensures alignment and integration of data in adherence with data governance standards.
  • Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation, and sustainment of initiatives.
  • Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and identifies appropriate distribution channels.
  • Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
  • Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service.
  • May specialize as either a funding specialist or a credit analyst.
  • As a funding specialist, facilitates the funding process acting as a final and independent control point for legal documentation and ensures that the security/legal documentation reflects what was approved; all terms and conditions noted in the credit application have been met; proper execution/perfection of all documents prior to funding/releasing funds; assesses significance of any security or conditions shortfalls, credit and fraud risks.
  • Analyzes lending applications to identify, correct, and make credit decisions or advise of deficiencies and/or exceptions in accordance with sound credit granting principles; recommends remedies to maintain acceptable asset and credit quality.
  • Analyzes lending applications to confirm security valuations and completes and approves credit applications for authorization in compliance with the Bank’s business banking lending policy.
  • Develops risk profiles, credit structuring of lending proposals, and completes credit investigations.
  • Responds to inquiries and resolves issues raised through audits and quality checks to adequately document lending decisions.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
  • Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhance analysis, and/or streamline reporting.
  • Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
  • Monitors and tracks performance and addresses any issues.
  • Follows security and safeguarding procedures and applies due diligence in accordance with Bank’s policies and ethical standards for the prevention of loss due to fraud, robbery, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation.
  • Adheres to business banking lending processes, policies, procedures, legal, regulatory, audit, and ethical requirements.
  • Maintains the confidentiality of customer and Bank information in compliance with Bank policies and procedures.
  • Identifies risks and takes appropriate actions, including all documentation and other regulatory requirements to maintain operational integrity.
  • Liaises between clients and various departments across the organization to discuss issues and procedures, and provide product support and expertise.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

job_information.description:
Application Deadline:

02/27/2026

6605 Hurontario Street

Commercial Sales & Service

Performs ongoing comprehensive client credit analysis for an assigned number of client portfolios to assess the business entity’s overall financial health and credit risk using discretionary authority within prescribed limits. Applies lending expertise to a lending product portfolio or part of the lending process (e.g. underwriting, funding, monitoring). Makes credit decisions or provides timely advice to the business banking relationship manager for action in compliance with internal controls and audit, regulatory, and Bank policies and procedures.

  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
  • Coordinates the management of databases; ensures alignment and integration of data in adherence with data governance standards.
  • Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation, and sustainment of initiatives.
  • Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and identifies appropriate distribution channels.
  • Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
  • Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service.
  • May specialize as either a funding specialist or a credit analyst.
  • As a funding specialist, facilitates the funding process acting as a final and independent control point for legal documentation and ensures that the security/legal documentation reflects what was approved; all terms and conditions noted in the credit application have been met; proper execution/perfection of all documents prior to funding/releasing funds; assesses significance of any security or conditions shortfalls, credit and fraud risks.
  • Analyzes lending applications to identify, correct, and make credit decisions or advise of deficiencies and/or exceptions in accordance with sound credit granting principles; recommends remedies to maintain acceptable asset and credit quality.
  • Analyzes lending applications to confirm security valuations and completes and approves credit applications for authorization in compliance with the Bank’s business banking lending policy.
  • Develops risk profiles, credit structuring of lending proposals, and completes credit investigations.
  • Responds to inquiries and resolves issues raised through audits and quality checks to adequately document lending decisions.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
  • Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhance analysis, and/or streamline reporting.
  • Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
  • Monitors and tracks performance and addresses any issues.
  • Follows security and safeguarding procedures and applies due diligence in accordance with Bank’s policies and ethical standards for the prevention of loss due to fraud, robbery, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation.
  • Adheres to business banking lending processes, policies, procedures, legal, regulatory, audit, and ethical requirements.
  • Maintains the confidentiality of customer and Bank information in compliance with Bank policies and procedures.
  • Identifies risks and takes appropriate actions, including all documentation and other regulatory requirements to maintain operational integrity.
  • Liaises between clients and various departments across the organization to discuss issues and procedures, and provide product support and expertise.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

  • Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

  • Strong knowledge of credit qualification and adjudication standards, policies, and procedures.
  • Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth.

job_information.title: Senior Analyst, Business Banking Lending Acquisition
job_information.job_title_raw: Senior Analyst, Business Banking Lending Acquisition
job_information.description:
Application Deadline:

02/26/2026

Address:

33 Dundas Street West

Job Family Group:

Audit, Risk & Compliance

Join a pioneering team shaping the future of Canadian Retail Credit Strategies.

We’re building next-generation, end-to-end credit solutions that span the entire lifecycle—from acquisition and account management to collections—anchored in a holistic Lending Decision Strategy and aligned with Canadian Personal & Business Banking (P&BB) priorities.


Our approach combines cutting-edge decisioning software, advanced decision trees, and innovative credit models to deliver smarter, faster, and more customer-centric outcomes. This is your opportunity to influence credit cycles using modern modeling techniques and best-in-class decisioning applications, all within a high-performance, customer-focused environment.


If you’re passionate about leveraging data, technology, and strategy to transform lending decisions and drive meaningful impact across Canadian P&BB, this is the team for you.

The Senior Analyst, Business Banking Lending Acquisition supports the design, refinement, and execution of credit acquisition strategies across Business Banking lending products. This role blends analytical capability, credit‑risk understanding, and hands‑on execution to help drive high‑quality credit growth, improve adjudication consistency, and enhance the performance of acquisition funnels.

Working collaboratively with Product, Credit Risk, Adjudication, Analytics, Technology, and Distribution teams, the Senior Analyst helps develop scalable acquisition strategies that are data‑driven, well‑governed, and aligned to Business Banking’s growth aspirations and risk appetite. Responsibilities include supporting decision logic development, structured testing, reporting, and ongoing optimization across digital, branch, and advisor‑led channels.

Key Responsibilities

Acquisition Strategy Support & Optimization

  • Support the development and refinement of end‑to‑end acquisition strategies across Business Banking lending channels.

  • Assist with enhancements to segmentation, decisioning logic, adjudication pathways, routing rules, and referral structures in decision engines and rule‑based platforms.

  • Ensure strategy changes support objectives related to growth, profitability, client experience, and credit‑risk appetite.

Adjudication Strategy Execution

  • Support the calibration and implementation of adjudication strategies across digital, branch/advisor, centralized underwriting, and specialized credit teams.

  • Help ensure adjudication logic balances efficiency, decision quality, and risk integrity, while supporting channel‑specific needs.

Model Use & Risk Signal Integration

  • Integrate risk models, credit scores, behavioural indicators, and analytical signals into acquisition decision pathways.

  • Assist in interpreting model outputs and validating alignment with model‑governance requirements.

Analytical Insights & Funnel Performance Monitoring

  • Conduct analysis to identify opportunities to improve funnel performance, including approval rates, refer/decline patterns, booking quality, and early‑life risk.

  • Provide insights into client behaviour, product mix shifts, and emerging trends that inform strategy optimization.

Champion–Challenger Testing

  • Support the design and execution of structured test‑and‑learn experiments across new acquisition treatments, adjudication rules, and segmentation pathways.

  • Track test outcomes and contribute recommendations for scaling effective strategies.

Technology, Deployment & Execution Partnership

  • Translate acquisition strategy logic into deployable decision rules, partnering with Technology, Analytics, and Underwriting.

  • Participate in UAT, system validation, and change‑management routines to ensure strategy changes are accurate and operationally sound.

  • Maintain documentation for rulesets, logic changes, and deployment requirements.

Governance, Policy & Regulatory Alignment

  • Ensure acquisition strategies comply with credit policy, regulatory standards, adjudication expectations, and model‑governance requirements.

  • Support governance processes such as documentation, validation, audit responses, and control assessments.

Cross‑Functional Collaboration

  • Work collaboratively with Product, Risk, Adjudication, Distribution, Operations, and Analytics partners.

  • Provide clear analytical summaries and recommendations that support strategy decisions and partner alignment.

Qualifications & Experience

Required

  • 3+ years of experience in Business Banking lending, credit strategy, adjudication, credit risk, or analytics.

  • Strong foundational understanding of business credit risk, financial analysis, and small‑business lending fundamentals.

  • Experience interpreting credit risk models, behavioural indicators, financial ratios, and segmentation tools.

  • Familiarity with decision engines, rule‑based systems, or decision‑tree platforms (e.g., FICO, SAS, ML scoring tools).

  • Demonstrated analytical and problem‑solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations.

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills across cross‑functional partners.

Preferred

  • Experience with funnel analytics, MIS/reporting, or production decisioning platforms.

  • Familiarity with model governance, adjudication standards, and regulatory considerations in Business Banking.

#FutureOfRetailLending

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Are you driven by how technology and business processes enable organizational performance and innovation? Are you motivated by building strong relationships and leading change, this role provides the opportunity to directly influence and improve business processes. Success in this role is driven by a commitment to continuous improvement, professional growth, and a learning mindset. 

Responsibilities will include eliciting and documenting the actual needs of stakeholders—which frequently involves investigating and clarifying their expressed desires—to determine underlying business requirements.   

This position requires full-time on-site presence.    

All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance, and U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). 

Responsibilities

  • ⁠⁠⁠⁠As part of the JD Irving IT Team, you will enable the JD Irving group of businesses to achieve their business goals by leveraging technology  

  • Understanding key business data and quality  

  • Performing requirements elicitation and documentation  

  • Building use cases (definition and development) and developing test cases  

  • Documenting business processes  

  • Understanding capability of analytics tools and enabling business to act from analytical insight  

  • Managing integrity, confidentiality, and security of all datasets  

  • Understanding the risk tolerance/profile of the business  

  • Collaborating with design and architecture  

  • Translating business process models to technical realization  

Qualifications

  • Education required: A university degree, college diploma or a related discipline   

  • 3+ years’ work experience in a business environment, preferably IT   

  • ITIL V4 foundation certification or commitment to achieve it  

  • Customer focused: motivated by inspiring others to do things differently  

  • Technically inclined, process oriented and driven by a natural curiosity  

  • Happy in an environment where you can work independently as well as collaboratively  

  • A continuous learner: acquiring new skills and software applications is second nature  

  • Able to navigate in a fast-paced work environment where solutions are not always clearly defined  

  • A practiced communicator with strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills  

  • Strong facilitation skills, including leading trainings and structured group sessions 

Extras:  

  • Experience working in ServiceNow 

  • Business Process Modeling  

  • Entry Certification in Business Analysis (ECBA)  

  • ADKAR or experience with end-user experience testing 

About Company

The belief that what people experience matters more than technology is part of our foundational core. We also believe that our ability as a team grows exponentially when we share success. These centering values – some of our non-negotiables - guide our decisions and inform how we show up daily. Join a team that aims to simplify the path forward and inspire commitment. 

With over 380 employees centralized in Saint John, Fredericton, Dieppe and Halifax, we offer the opportunity to create real value by helping people and businesses work smarter.  JDI IT supports the entire J.D. Irving Limited group of companies which means we offer opportunities and experiences across a wide breadth of IT areas, businesses and industries. As a member of the JDI IT team, you will be a key player in enabling the business to win by overcoming obstacles and “getting it done”! 

We believe in the power of diverse teams and invest in continuous professional growth. We are seeking naturally curious change makers looking to join a collaborative and motivated team. Come help JDI IT Raise the Bar!  

Company

Founded in 1882, J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI) has operations in Canada and the United States and are a team of 20,000 dedicated employees.  At J.D. Irving, Limited, you are part of a dynamic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about delivering results. With a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our various operating divisions.
We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates, and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary, or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.
Worried you do not meet all the requirements? Studies have shown that many applicants apply only to job opportunities when they feel they meet 100% of the criteria. We promote an inclusive environment where everyone is appreciated, recognized, and empowered to contribute fully. If you are interested in this position but are worried you did not meet all the requirements, we would encourage you to still apply.

job_information.title: Business Analyst, Retail
job_information.description:
Are you passionate about using technology to solve challenging problems? Join us as a Business Analyst to help revolutionize the home improvement retail industry with cutting-edge technology to elevate human experience and enhance business operations!

JDI IT is on the lookout for dynamic and ambitious Business Analysts to help digitally transform J.D. Irving’s Retail division. This is your chance to work with Atlantic Canada’s leader in Home Improvement – Kent Building Supplies, business-to-business supplier – Chandler Sales, award-winning pre-engineered structural systems manufacturer – Atlas Structural Systems, and Plasticraft Digital & Specialty Printing.

As a Business Analyst, you'll dive right in, take ownership, and apply critical thinking to push the status quo. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to understand and document business needs. Collaborating with the JDI IT team and Retail business leads, you’ll lead the delivery of solutions that improve home improvement experiences for Atlantic Canadians. Ultimately, your work will bring about meaningful positive change in the lives of Atlantic Canadians by enhancing their home improvement experiences and making their lives easier and more enjoyable.

If you're self-driven, a go-getter, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you to shine. The company is committed to investing in coaching and development and this team will be set up for success from day one. If you're passionate about growth and thrive in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply and be part of a team that’s shaping the future through innovation and excellence.

This role requires on-site presence.

Responsibilities

  • As part of the JD Irving IT Team, you will be supporting the JDI Retail Division 
  • Modernizing processes through leveraging of technologies 
  • Documenting business processes using Business Process Modeling and Notation
  • Understanding customer demand versus IT supply 
  • Performing requirements elicitation & documentation 
  • Building use cases (definition and development) and developing test cases 
  • Understanding capability of analytics tools and enabling business to act from analytical insight 
  • Understanding key business data
  • Understanding the risk tolerance/ profile of the business 
  • Collaborating with other JDI IT teams such as Design and Architecture, Networking, IT Security, End User Computing, etc. 
  • Collaborating with JDI IT’s partners in consulting and implementation
  • Assessing opportunities to use Artificial Intelligence for improving personal and business processes

Qualifications

  • A University Degree in a related discipline
  • At least 3 years work experience in a business environment
  • Preferably experience in an IT work environment 
  • Expert experience in Microsoft Technologies, particularly in M365, D365, and Azure Dev Ops (ADO)
  • Experience with securely integrating external and internal systems

Bonus:

  • Lean Six Sigma Methodologies 
  • Agile Product Owner 
  • Business Process Modeling
  • Entry Certification in Business Analysis (ECBA)
  • Microsoft D365 Finance and Operations, Microsoft MPOS, Microsoft 365, Visio, Warehouse Management System, Inventory Management, Planning and Optimization, Supply Chain Management

About Company

The belief that what people experience matters more than technology is part of our foundational core. We also believe that our ability as a team grows exponentially when we share success. These centering values – some of our non-negotiables - guide our decisions and inform how we show up daily. Join a team that aims to simplify the path forward and inspire commitment. 

With over 380 employees centralized in Saint John, Fredericton, Dieppe and Halifax, we offer the opportunity to create real value by helping people and businesses work smarter.  JDI IT supports the entire J.D. Irving Limited group of companies which means we offer opportunities and experiences across a wide breadth of IT areas, businesses and industries. As a member of the JDI IT team, you will be a key player in enabling the business to win by overcoming obstacles and “getting it done”! 

We believe in the power of diverse teams and invest in continuous professional growth. We are seeking naturally curious change makers looking to join a collaborative and motivated team. Come help JDI IT Raise the Bar!  

Company

Founded in 1882, J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI) has operations in Canada and the United States and are a team of 20,000 dedicated employees.  At J.D. Irving, Limited, you are part of a dynamic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about delivering results. With a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our various operating divisions.
We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates, and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary, or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.
Worried you do not meet all the requirements? Studies have shown that many applicants apply only to job opportunities when they feel they meet 100% of the criteria. We promote an inclusive environment where everyone is appreciated, recognized, and empowered to contribute fully. If you are interested in this position but are worried you did not meet all the requirements, we would encourage you to still apply.
We appreciate your interest in our company however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
At Kruger Packaging, we foster a culture of collaboration, integrity, and continuous improvement. We value our employees as key drivers of success and offer opportunities for growth in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment.

Project Overview

Kruger Packaging is making changes to its business processes and systems. Two major projects will occur simultaneously: an in-depth analysis of the current end-to-end business processes across operations to determine the most effective future process, and the implementation of a new CRM solution, which requires reviewing existing processes and applying an ideal solution to support the business.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly experienced and results-driven Senior Business Analyst to lead the review, modeling, and optimization of our end-to-end business processes within a manufacturing environment. This role is pivotal in driving operational excellence and will also play a key role in the successful implementation of supporting systems.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business process analysis, manufacturing operations, and enterprise system implementations, with a proven ability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions. We are looking for a rigorous, versatile, and autonomous professional who thrives equally well in structured analysis and in agile environments.

The candidate must demonstrate excellent communication skills across all levels of the organization and be willing and able to travel to various sites, including those located in the United States. Travel requirements are estimated to range from a minimum of 10% and up to 40%, depending on project phases.

Key Responsibilities

Manufacturing Process Analysis & Optimization (70%)

  • Analyze, design, and implement improved processes across production, procurement, maintenance, quality, customer service, finance...
  • Identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities for automation or standardization.
  • Lead cross-functional teams to develop future-state process models and drive change management initiatives.
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement throughout the packaging division.

CRM Implementation Support (15%)

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners to support the rollout of the new CRM system.
  • Ensure manufacturing processes are aligned with CRM capabilities and business requirements.
  • Participate in system configuration, testing, training, and go-live support.

Cross-Departmental Collaboration (5%)

  • Facilitate workshops and meetings with teams from various departments to gather requirements and validate process improvements.
  • Act as a liaison between manufacturing, IT, and commercial teams to ensure successful project delivery.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all organizational levels, from shop floor to senior leadership.

Documentation & Reporting (10%)

  • Create and maintain process maps, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and improvement charters.
  • Provide regular updates to leadership on project progress, risks, and outcomes.
  • Track and report key performance indicators (KPIs) related to process optimization and CRM adoption.

 

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, or related field.

Minimum 7–10 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a strong focus on manufacturing environments.

Proven experience leading cross-functional process optimization initiatives.

Proven experience with business process modeling tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, BPMN).

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Experience with ERP systems (e.g., Dynamics 365, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM or similar CRM platforms is an asset.

Bilingual (English/French) is mandatory.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Willingness and ability to travel to various company sites, including locations in the United States. (The candidate must be legally authorized to travel to the United States.)

v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: Extensive experience in business process analysis within manufacturing; strong cross-functional collaboration; ERP/CRM integration experience; bilingual English/French; willing to travel.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst, Data & Insights
job_information.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Senior Business Analyst, Data and Insights plays a pivotal role in advancing the organization’s analytics and digital intelligence agenda across business units. This position is responsible for identifying, shaping, and supporting business needs related to reporting, data platforms, advanced analytics, and AI/ML initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives and Kruger’s enterprise data architecture.
Collaborating with teams across Finance, Operations, Sales, Supply Chain, and Innovation, the analyst drives user adoption, solution design, and the delivery of trusted insights through platforms such as SAP BW, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Business Data Commons (BDC), Databricks, and Power BI.
This role is critical to shaping Kruger’s data-driven culture and will support the enablement and transition toward S/4HANA, enterprise data lake, and emerging GenAI technologies.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Data and Analytics Demand Shaping

Partner with business stakeholders to identify and prioritize analytics use cases and reporting needs.

Lead discovery sessions and manage intake for dashboards, KPIs, data models, and insight solutions.

Act as the primary IT liaison for advanced analytics initiatives involving SAP and enterprise data platforms.
Solution Delivery and Design

Translate business requirements into detailed functional and data specifications.

Collaborate with Data Engineering and Architecture teams to support integration, modeling, and visualization.

Serve as product owner or analyst lead for the delivery of dashboards in Power BI, SAC, or Databricks.

Support the development of semantic layers, data marts, and governed self-serve reporting assets.
Platform Expertise and System Integration

Provide functional expertise in SAP BW/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Power BI, and BDC models.

Support solution integration with ERP systems (SAP ECC, JDE), operational platforms, and enterprise data lakes (e.g., Databricks).

Participate in data validation, User Acceptance Testing, and ongoing performance tuning for data-driven solutions.
Data Governance and Quality

Promote data stewardship and ownership practices across functions.

Help define and monitor data quality metrics, lineage, and cataloging efforts in partnership with the Data Governance team.

Contribute to metadata standards, reporting definitions, and harmonization of KPIs.
Enablement and Change Management

Train business users on dashboards, insights tools, and analytics best practices.

Support citizen data analysts and functional power users in adoption of new tools and capabilities.

Contribute to communication plans and user adoption strategies for enterprise insight programs.
Innovation and AI Readiness

Collaborate with IT and innovation teams to identify opportunities to embed AI/ML models and GenAI-powered analytics.

Contribute to proof-of-concepts (POCs) and pilots in areas such as predictive forecasting, anomaly detection, or intelligent automation.


QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering, Finance, or related field.
Post-graduate certification or coursework in Analytics, Data Engineering, or AI/ML is an asset.


EXPERIENCE

Minimum 10 years of experience in business analytics, BI, or data platform roles.

Hands-on expertise with SAP BW, SAC, and Power BI is required.

Exposure to BDC or similar semantic layer environments, as well as platforms such as Databricks, Azure Synapse, or Snowflake platforms.

Strong experience working across Finance, Operations, Supply Chain, or Commercial analytics domains.

Familiarity with S/4HANA data structures or roadmap planning is a plus.


SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Excellent stakeholder engagement, documentation, and communication skills.

Able to navigate complex enterprise environments and work across divisions.

Strong data storytelling, visualization, and user enablement skills.

Comfortable with agile delivery models, product ownership, and iterative development.

LANGUAGES

·       Bilingual - French / English (advanced level)

Knowledge of English is required for this specific position as Kruger deals with partners across North America and the successful candidate will be required to communicate frequently with them. Kruger has taken all reasonable steps to avoid imposing English language requirements, including assessing the actual language needs associated with the duties to be performed, ensuring that the language skills already required of other employees were insufficient for the performance of those duties, and limiting as much as possible the number of positions with duties requiring English language skills.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst/ QA, Sanctions
job_information.description:
Work Location:

Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Hours:

37.5

Line of Business:

TD Securities

Pay Details:

$81,600 - $115,200 CAD

TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs.

As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.

Job Description:

  • Lead the end-to-end delivery lifecycle. Owning business analysis and quality assurance activities from requirements elicitation through testing, implementation and post-implementation support.

  • Identify, analyze, document, validate and manage functional and non-functional requirements by collaborating with business, compliance, technology, and external partners/vendors to achieve consensus and alignment

  • Analyze and document current state and future state business processes, assess system impacts and ensure requirements and acceptance criteria clearly reflect changes needed to meet business, customer and regulatory needs.

  • Ensure requirement traceability across the delivery life cycle from business requirements through design, testing and implementation including change and impact management

  • Act as the primary contact between business and technology, ensuring clarity of requirements, dependencies, constraint, risk and delivery expectation.

  • Provide subject matter experts and thought leadership, leverage domain, product and system knowledge to drive business value, innovation, scalability and continuous improvement.

  • Define, review, and support acceptance criteria, test strategy, test plan and test cases, ensuring requirements are testable, measurable and aligned with regulatory, and control framework.

  • Lead and oversee all phases of testing (system, integration, UAT, performance development verification), ensure adherence to testing standards, audit requirements and gating criteria.

  • Coordinate and manage delivery and testing resource, environments, tools and vendors to meet project milestones, timelines and quality expectations.

  • Manage test execution, defects triage, resolution, and reporting, including prioritization of testing activities based on risk, complexity and business impact.

  • Manage creation, review and sign-off of testing documentation (e.g. test strategies, plans, test cases, dashboards, defect logs, test phase closure reports) for assigned area / projects and ensure all test artifacts adhere to testing standards and audit requirements

  • Identify, document, and actively manage delivery, testing, operational risk, escalation issues proactively and recommending mitigation strategies to ensure timely and unimpeded progress.

  • Support change management, operational readiness, implementation, and post implementation activities, ensuring solutions are ready for business adoption.

  • Ensure all deliverables comply with regulatory obligations, internal controls, risk appetite, testing standard, and best practices.

  • Communicate delivery status, dependencies, and outcome clearly and consistently to stakeholder and senior leadership.

  • Mentor and coach team members contribute to knowledge sharing, promote best practices, and support collaborative, inclusive, and high-performance team environment.

  • Identify opportunities to improve delivery efficiency, testing effectiveness, automation and overall solution quality.

  • Adhere to the TD Code of Conduct

  • Promote an inclusive, fair, and equitable work environment

Skill Sets:

  • Senior Business Analyst with strong expertise in business analysis, quality assurance, and end‑to‑end delivery lifecycle management.

  • Skilled in translating complex business needs into clear, actionable, and testable requirements, ensuring alignment across business, technology, compliance, and external partners.

  • Proven ability to lead full solution delivery, from requirements definition through testing, implementation, and post‑implementation support, while maintaining a focus on risk, regulatory compliance, and operational readiness.

  • Advanced proficiency in test strategy, test planning, multi‑phase testing, defect management, and quality governance to ensure solutions meet audit and performance standards.

  • Experienced in coordinating cross‑functional teams, vendors, delivery environments, tools, and project milestones to achieve high‑quality, timely outcomes.

  • Strong communicator, adept at articulating requirements, risks, dependencies, timelines, and delivery status to stakeholders and senior leadership.

  • Continuously identifies and drives opportunities for process optimization, testing efficiency, automation, and overall solution quality improvements.

  • Substantial knowledge of SWIFT messages, ISO20022, MX and MT formats

  • Deep understanding of payment systems and methods such as Canada Lynx, US CHIPS, and Fedwire, etc.

  • Proficient in MS Office, Agile methodology with Product Owner mindset, Shift Left testing methodologies and best practices utilizing collaborative tools like Jira, JTMF, and Confluence

Experience and/ or education

  • Undergraduate degree or Technical Certificate

  • 5-7+ years related business analysis and QA experience

  • Business Analysis Accreditation is an asset

  • Preference given to candidates who have experience working in Agile

Who We Are:

TD Securities offers a wide range of capital markets products and services to corporate, government, and institutional clients who choose us for our innovation, execution, and experience. With more than 6,500 professionals operating out of 40 cities across the globe, we strive to make every interaction, product and experience remarkably human and refreshingly simple.  Our services include underwriting and distributing new issues, providing trusted advice and industry-leading insight, extending access to global markets, and delivering integrated transaction banking solutions. In 2023, we acquired Cowen Inc., offering our clients access to a premier U.S. equities business and highly-diverse equity research franchise, while growing our strong, diversified investment bank. 

Together, we are reimagining what banking can be for our clients, colleagues and communities. 

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more

Additional Information:
We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Please be advised that this job opportunity is subject to provincial regulation for employment purposes. It is imperative to acknowledge that each province or territory within the jurisdiction of Canada may have its own set of regulations, requirements.


Colleague Development

If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. 

If you’re passionate about helping clients and building deep, lasting relationships, TD offers diverse career paths where you can grow your expertise and make a meaningful impact.  

We're committed to your success and foster a respectful workplace where diverse perspectives are valued, everyone has fair opportunities to grow, and you can unlock your full potential to achieve your career goals. Here at TD, we hire and develop the best.

Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.

Interview Process 
We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.


Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Toronto, Ontario, Canada

TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Job Description:

The Business Analyst for Rating supports rate change implementations in the Insbridge rating engine, supporting Guidewire PolicyCenter for Property and Casualty insurance.

Responsibilities:

- Liaising with Actuarial Pricing to elicit, understand and analyse rate change requirements; including priority, complexity, dependencies and other business and system impacts. 

- Work with Business Systems Analysts to communicate and clarify requirements to ensure understanding of all details. 

- Engage and coordinate work effort with Guidewire analysts and other technology teams on cross-functional projects. 

- Effectively manage timelines to deliver changes according to project schedules and regulatory deadlines. 

- Support testing and quality control of all changes, including execution of automated testing and building test cases for manual testing. 

- Thoroughly document business requirements, issues, test plans and test results. 

- Identify risks and recommend appropriate solutions and mitigation strategies. 

- Implement recurrent data updates including VICC, premium capping, postal code/GeoData. 

- Respond to ad hoc inquiries and conduct investigations into rating issues and questions as required.

Requirements:

- Superior analytical abilities

- Excellent math skills; Mathematics or Actuarial Science degree would be an asset.

- Expertise in Excel

- Excellent communication skills

- 3-5 years previous Business Analyst experience

- Good understanding of personal lines insurance products and pricing

- Experience with insurance policy management systems or rating engines preferred

- Understanding of Agile methodology and previous experience working in an Agile environment preferred

Who We Are:

As part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada's largest financial institutions, at TD Insurance, we care for Canadian families, making it easy to get the best advice, protection, and support in their moments of need, always.

This role is eligible for a discretionary variable compensation award that considers business and individual performance.

TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs.

As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.

Job Description:

Job Responsibilities:

  • Support and manage the design, maintenance, and support of TD's third party Inventory
  • Coordinate with the business partners across the bank to source third party data for inclusion in the third party inventory
  • Construction and design of third party inventory based on numerous third party data sources
  • Maintain Data quality across all Third Party Risk Applications
  • Act as subject matter expertise on Third Party Risk Applications with focus on Product enhancements and improvements
  • Support Product Audits, access management, reporting and alerts
  • Contribute to risk and control design assessments for an assigned business application, business portfolio, and overall enterprise, as well as risk mitigation and remediation plans and remediation strategy.
  • Follow technology, processes, and governance practices to monitor, detect, prevent, and react to both current and emerging technology and security threats to TD.
  • Provide risk reporting and defining metrics to measure control effectiveness for your own area.
  • Adhere to policies, procedures, technology control standards and regulatory guidelines.
  • Contribute to internal activity and process review, flag windows for improvement.
  • Be able to consult, and utilize the knowledge gained, to triage and/or perform Integrations
  • Be able to juggle a few different tasks effectively, within delivery deadlines.
  • Demonstrated ability to participate in projects of moderate complexity.

Job Requirements:

  • Undergraduate Degree.
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience.
  • Firm commitment to staying informed and abreast of emerging issues, industry trends etc.
  • Sound to advanced knowledge of business, technology controls, security and risk issues.
  • Be a resource/SME to the Team as well as to internal customers
  • MS Excel proficiency
  • BI Reporting experience will be an asset

Who We Are:

TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we strive to make every interaction, product, and experience remarkably human and refreshingly simple for over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to foster deeper relationships, ensure disciplined execution, and build a simpler, faster banking experience. TD is deeply committed to being a leader in client experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are client facing. Together, we are reimagining what banking can be for our clients, colleagues and communities.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more

Additional Information:
We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Please be advised that this job opportunity is subject to provincial regulation for employment purposes. It is imperative to acknowledge that each province or territory within the jurisdiction of Canada may have its own set of regulations, requirements.


Colleague Development

If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities.

If you’re passionate about helping clients and building deep, lasting relationships, TD offers diverse career paths where you can grow your expertise and make a meaningful impact.  

We're committed to your success and foster a respectful workplace where diverse perspectives are valued, everyone has fair opportunities to grow, and you can unlock your full potential to achieve your career goals. Here at TD, we hire and develop the best.

Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.

Interview Process 
We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.


Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Language Requirement (Quebec only):

Sans Objet

v5_processed_job_data.requirements_summary: 1 to 5 years of experience as an analyst, project manager or related role. Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office, experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau is an asset.

job_information.description:
Location: Waterloo,Ontario,Canada

This is an opportunity in the exciting and fast-growing transportation technology industry.  Public transit is being transformed from a system of static, scheduled fixed-routes, to a dynamic on-demand network, and you’ll be one of the pioneers shaping this transformation. You’ll join a robust and rapidly growing client success team.

As a Business Data Analyst, you’ll be responsible for working directly with clients in face-to-face virtual or in-person meetings, analyzing client operations data, working with project managers on project implementations,  running service simulations, assessing key performance indicators, proactively driving client operational improvements, and providing technical systems support for multiple clients. You will develop a deep understanding of urban mobility challenges faced by transit operators.  You will become an expert on RideCo’s technology platform and data-driven design and operation of transportation services.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

  • Program and client management: Plan and launch client projects as per the project timeline. Support communication and coordination between project stakeholders including transit planners, senior management, marketing, and operations staff. Work closely with the client through the entire project lifecycle and post-launch operations, prioritizing requests and fostering a strong relationship focused on desired customer outcomes and world-class customer experience.
  • Implement transportation services: Work together with project managers, solutions engineers, and client stakeholders to develop and implement transportation solutions that fit the needs of the customer. Translate client requirements into technical solutions leveraging the RideCo platform. Utilize a keen eye for detail to manipulate service parameters to meet the precise needs and goals of the client. 
  • Support new service launches: Setup, test, and tune system parameters, run simulations, oversee training, soft launch, monitor KPIs on launch week and make ongoing system changes as needed.
  • Data analysis and performance reporting: Perform ad-hoc data analysis tasks to compare service performance against goals, evaluate trends, and proactively identify areas for improvement. Collaborate with data engineers to design performance analysis reports spanning rider user-experience, driver user-experience, marketing, operating efficiency, and unit economics. Review the performance reports with stakeholders and the client operations team on weekly face-to-face client meetings to generate insights and actions. Collaborate with project managers to develop end to end executive  business review presentations for senior stakeholders.
  • Run simulations and optimize service design: Perform simulations to analyze performance and operational KPIs. Iterate on the service model by tuning and optimizing dozens of parameters such as dynamic routing engine settings, vehicle count and mix, supply positioning, service frequency, location and density of potential stops, and demand models. Collaborate with the client, operations managers, and other key stakeholders throughout this process. Support the client in setting targets and KPIs for the service prior to launch.
  • Provide technical support: Provide ongoing technical systems and analytics support to operations managers. Advise them on using the system’s dashboards and interpreting the data. Perform system configuration changes based on feedback from operations staff, drivers, and passengers.
  • Drive continuous improvement: Collaboratively develop weekly/monthly actions to drive continuous improvements, and to achieve the service’s objectives (e.g. user experience, ridership, operating efficiency, financials, etc.).
  • Improve internal processes and tooling: Identify ways to further automate and systematize our internal processes. Collaboratively champion internal process/tooling improvements.
  • Support product improvements: Expand your knowledge of the transportation industry, understand clients’ pain points and identify gaps/opportunities in the product. Share your insights with the product team and assist the product management team in designing new features/improvements to RideCo’s platform.
  • Educate and document: Continuously expand the collective knowledgebase of the company through multi-disciplinary learning, knowledge sharing through live demos, and updating/creating documentation on our knowledge management system.

  • Client Support: Answer technical support tickets from clients in a timely manner, providing exceptional customer service to client queries and issues. Perform adhoc administrative tasks when required.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Education: Undergraduate degree in Management Engineering / Applied Mathematics / Statistics / Finance / Business / Planning, or related discipline.
  • Experience in data analysis and project management.
  • 1 to 5 years of experience as an analyst, project manager or related role.
  • Data wizard: Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office and Google tools. Experience working with business intelligence tools such as Tableau is an asset... Previous experience in a geospatial analysis program such as GIS is an asset.
  • Top-notch communicator: Strong written/oral communication and presentation skills, especially when dealing with clients and executive stakeholders and internal senior management Experience preparing reports and presentations for senior management.
  • Teamwork: Constant collaboration within the technical services team and cross-functionally with product team, data engineering, sales and marketing team. We help each other help our customers.
  • Location: Based in Waterloo, Ontario
  • Willing to travel: approximately 15%, as needed. (Canada and United States) - Must be able to travel to the US within 3 months of hire date. Valid Passport/US B1B2 Visa required. 

Compensation and Benefits:

  • Base Salary: $70K - $90K + performance-based bonus + stock options
  • Work-Life Balance & Additional Perks: Flex-time work schedules, vacation time, bi-weekly catered lunches, social events, casual dress code
  • Benefits Plan: Medical, dental, prescription, life/health spending accounts and more
  • Work Environment: Located in KW's most desirable work space in the heart of Uptown Waterloo. This role requires in-office attendance at least 3 days a week.
  • Commuter Program: Complimentary rides to and from work within the Waterloo region

Who we are: 

http://www.rideco.com

RideCo powers on-demand transit. Public transit agencies and fleet operators use RideCo's cloud-based software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses and vans. RideCo is growing rapidly, and it is the most adopted cloud-based on-demand transit software among the ten largest cities in the United States.  Our marquee clients include Philadelphia’s SEPTA, Los Angeles Metro, San Antonio Metro, and Houston Metro.  

RideCo’s software powers a diverse range of use cases, including paratransit, residential/ suburban travel; first-mile-last-mile connections for transit hubs; and corporate employee transportation.  The success of these services is supported by the industry's best customer service, including a 95% plus customer retention rate.  We are investing to scale up and capture the growing demand for on-demand shared rides solutions.

RideCo is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We hire the best talent and strive to build a meritocratic culture.  In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please mention this in your application. #Li-Hybrid
Apply to this job

job_information.title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
job_information.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What you'll be doing

As a member of CIBC’s team, the Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for formulating system scope and objectives, validating developed requirements, testing, training, and implementing applications and providing end-user support. The role performs technical depth and breadth tasks, validating and documenting business requirements for assigned projects to maximize operational efficiency and ensure project control procedures and policies are executed. The Senior Business Systems Analyst determines project methods and approaches, providing business support relative to developing, analyzing, and identifying process changes or system enhancements. The role uses judgment and autonomy on daily tasks, providing operational support for projects after implementation, including problem resolution and recommendations to ensure ongoing success. The role proactively addresses problems within the scope of responsibility and identifies areas for possible improvements.

At CIBC, we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed during your interview.

How you'll succeed

  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.

  • Solution Design - Build client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate solution design documents around areas such as scope clarification, solution requirements, and quality assurance.

  • Leading and Mentoring - Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of Business Systems Analyst experience (i.e., writing user stories, creating and updating systems Use Cases, etc.). It will be considered a strong asset if you have experience with SAP.

  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least five years in a BSC role leading projects and designing solutions.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile because it’s the right thing to do.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

#LI-TA

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, defined benefit pension plan*, an employee share purchase plan, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

*Subject to plan and program terms and conditions

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • CIBC is committed to clarity in our hiring process. All roles posted are opportunities we’re actively recruiting for, unless stated otherwise.

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

  • We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills test (such as simulation, coding, French proficiency).

  • We use artificial intelligence tools during the recruitment process. Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us.

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 5th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Analytical Thinking, Application Testing, Business Requirements, Business Systems Analysis, IT Process Improvement, Operational Efficiency, Operations Support

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst, Market Risk Solutions
job_information.job_title_raw: Senior Business Analyst, Market Risk Solutions
job_information.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What you'll be doing

As a Senior Business Analyst on the Capital Markets Risk Management (CMRM) team, you'll assist the Director, Market Risk Solutions by providing subject matter expertise in developing robust and sustainable solutions for market risk capture within our market risk systems. You'll build and maintain strong working relationships across a matrix organization, collaborating closely with both CMRM groups (Trade Floor Risk Managers, Data, Governance, Reporting, Quantitative Solutions) and non-CMRM stakeholders (Risk Technology, Front Office and FO Technology, Model Vetting, Finance, Audit). Your expertise will help ensure our market risk processes are methodologically sound and operationally efficient, supporting the ongoing evolution of risk measurement at CIBC. You'll play a key role in driving projects forward, engaging stakeholders, and contributing to the strategic direction of market risk initiatives.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you'll succeed

  • Develop and apply domain expertise - Leverage your quantitative background and knowledge of Capital Markets products, pricing principles, market risk metrics, models (including sensitivities, Value at Risk (VaR), stress testing, backtesting), regulations, and regulatory capital calculations such as Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB) and Basel III Credit Valuation Adjustment (CVA). Stay curious and committed to expanding your expertise as market risk measurement evolves.

  • Conduct business analysis - Identify and engage relevant stakeholders for market risk initiatives. Perform thorough analysis, document current and future states, propose solutions, build consensus, contribute to business process definition, plan and execute testing, and present results to stakeholders.

  • Deliver projects effectively - Manage a portfolio of Market Risk projects and change requests, proactively addressing technical and business challenges. Collaborate with stakeholders within and outside of CMRM to ensure timely testing, sign-off, and delivery within Agile and Waterfall project frameworks.

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate a minimum 3-5 years of experience in Business Analysis or related role.

  • You’re analytical. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You pay attention to detail. You notice things that others might overlook. Your critical thinking skills inform your decision making.

  • You’re innovative. You’re digitally savvy and experienced with relational databases. You’re comfortable manipulating large datasets using languages and tools such as SQL, VBA, Python, PowerShell, or R. You adapt easily to new technologies, including AI and machine learning trends.

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results within your department and across the broader CMRM team.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your authentic self to work and live our values—trust, teamwork, and accountability.

job_information.title: Analyst, Global Markets, Alternate Solutions Group - Spanish Native Proficiency
job_information.job_title_raw: Analyst, Global Markets, Alternate Solutions Group - Spanish Native Proficiency
job_information.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing
 

CIBC’s Global Markets business focuses on delivering expert financial and economic analysis and savvy deal-making capabilities to clients in Canada and around the world. The Global Markets team supports fixed income, foreign exchange, commodities, derivatives, equities, and growth markets and is focused on building a strong, innovative relationship-oriented bank.
 

Within CIBC Global Markets, the ASG team specializes in developing innovative, technology-driven capital markets solutions. This unique group combines the agility and innovative spirit of a FinTech startup with the financial strength and governance protocols of a major financial institution. ASG is recognized as a global leader in providing disruptive technological solutions across various product areas, including Cross Border Payments, Dynamic Currency Conversion, and Foreign Cash white labeling. Our diverse client base includes some of the largest banks in the world, corporations, and CIBC’s retail clients.


We are looking for energetic individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit to help build our cross-border FX business. As a Analyst (Spanish native proficiency), you will work in a fast-paced environment as part of a dynamic, hard-working, execution-focused product team. In this position, you will support our FX cross-border business, including Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) on ATMs, Point of Sale (POS) and eCommerce. The analyst will work in our Latin America (LATAM) providing analytical and operational support to our clients in the region. DCC is a service enabled on ATMs and POS terminals that allows foreign cardholders to pay for their purchases in their home currency. This optional service provides foreign cardholders with the transparency of knowing exactly how much they will be charged. Since its inception, the DCC product team has established partnerships with over 30 financial institutions to enable this white label solution on over 100,000 ATMs worldwide. 


At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, you’ll be on-site full-time.


How You'll Succeed

  • Leveraging Analytical Skills - Identify, analyze, and interpret patterns in complex data sets and make recommendations for growth opportunities and business initiatives. Continuously monitor, track and evaluate client performance, including routine reporting. Conduct extensive quantitative research to identify and analyze industry trends and opportunities.

  • Supporting our Client Relationships - Work with associates and directors to investigate, analyze and resolve issues impacting our clients. Regularly meet with customers (in English and Spanish) to review product performance, technical projects, and value-added initiatives.

  • Supporting our Sales Pipeline - Work closely with the distribution team to support the sales cycle by creating customer-facing presentations, analysis, and ad hoc product expertise.

  • Enhancing our Product and Processes - Seek concrete and practical ways to improve our product and overall value proposition to our clients. Understand and review our processes, identify areas for improvement, and propose and implement solutions to increase productivity.


Who You Are

  • Educational Background: You hold a bachelor’s degree in Business, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics).

  • Professional Experience: You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced, high-performance environment, ideally within consulting, capital markets, fintech, or product management. Experience in payments, foreign exchange, or financial technology is highly desirable.

  • Analytical and Technical Skills: You are highly analytical and data-driven, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Power BI. You have a proven ability to analyze complex data sets, perform detailed quantitative analyses, and translate insights into actionable strategies. Strong mathematical and critical thinking skills are essential.

  • Strategic Communication and Presentation: You possess exceptional communication and presentation skills in both English and Spanish (native proficiency), Portuguese is an asset. You are comfortable presenting data-driven insights and strategic recommendations to senior executives in both languages. You also have experience creating polished, client-facing materials, including RFPs, pitch decks, and presentations, using Microsoft PowerPoint.

  • Product Management Mindset: You are client-focused and results-oriented, with a strong ability to prioritize competing demands and deliver innovative solutions. You have experience working cross-functionally with stakeholders in technology, operations, and business teams to drive product success.

  • Collaborative and Autonomous: You thrive in a collaborative environment and are motivated by collective success. You can work independently with minimal supervision while maintaining a strong team-oriented approach.

  • Entrepreneurial Drive: You are motivated by the challenge of building and scaling a new business in a fast-paced, competitive environment. You excel at setting and achieving ambitious goals and are comfortable navigating ambiguity and making informed decisions with limited information.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 


#LI-TA

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, defined benefit pension plan*, an employee share purchase plan, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

*Subject to plan and program terms and conditions

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • CIBC is committed to clarity in our hiring process. All roles posted are opportunities we’re actively recruiting for, unless stated otherwise.

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

  • We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills test (such as simulation, coding, French proficiency).

  • We use artificial intelligence tools during the recruitment process. Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us.

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St., 4th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Business, Business Direction, Client Service, Communication, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Data Analysis, Equity Derivatives, Global Market, Interest Rate Derivatives, Market Analysis, Market Trading
