job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
New Flyer is North America's heavy-duty transit bus leader with various locations in North America.  Offering the most advanced product line under the Xcelsior® and Xcelsior CHARGE™ brands. It also offers infrastructure development through New Flyer Infrastructure Solutions™, a service dedicated to providing safe, sustainable, and reliable charging and mobility solutions. Further information is available at www.newflyer.com.

POSITION SUMMARY

Reporting to the Production Manager, the Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing, facilitating, coordinating, and supporting operational KPI improvements

 

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

•           Tracks, analyzes, reports, and maintains the Andon system and Production KPI’s

•           Prepares, updates, and reports on Cell metrics and other Production KPI’s

•           Reports and improves critical issues and trends regarding line stoppers

•           Prepares and updates Winnipeg Opex monthly articles and communication boards

•           Analyzes and provides support to Production Leadership regarding waste reduction

•           Ensures standardization of manufacturing best practices

•           Works with Manufacturing leadership and supporting departments for improvement initiatives relating to manufacturing and internal processes

 

WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:

•         University or college degree in Business or Engineering. A combination of education and experience may be considered.

•         At least 3 years’ experience working in a manufacturing environment 

•         Advanced Microsoft Excel, SharePoint and Power BI skills required

•         Exceptional interpersonal, problem-solving and facilitation skills with an ability to work with all levels of the organization

•         Lean greenbelt certification or equivalent training would be considered an asset

 

Up to 5% of travel is required in this position.

 

WHY JOIN OUR TEAM:

•         Competitive wages and a comprehensive benefits package

•         A continuous learning environment

•         Ability to advance your career with a growing company

•         NFI Group has been named a Manitoba Top Employer for 2020 and this is the tenth since the competition was established in 2007

•         Employee social committee organizes numerous events throughout the year, including summer barbecues, holiday festivities, sporting events and tournaments, and much more

•         Ongoing employee development through a variety of in-house training initiatives along with tuition subsidies for courses at outside institutions

 

OUR WHY:

We exist to move people. Our mission is to design and deliver exceptional transportation solutions that are safe, accessible, e­fficient and reliable.

 

NFI Group is a leading independent global bus manufacturer providing a comprehensive suite of mass transportation solutions.  News and information are available at www.nfigroup.com, www.newflyer.com, www.mcicoach.com, www.arbocsv.com, www.alexander-dennis.com, www.carfaircomposites.com and www.nfi.parts.

job_information.title: Supply Chain Analyst - Term
job_information.description:
New Flyer is North America's heavy-duty transit bus leader and offers the most advanced product line under the Xcelsior® and Xcelsior CHARGE® brands. It also offers infrastructure development through NFI Infrastructure Solutions™, a service dedicated to providing safe, sustainable, and reliable charging and mobility solutions. Further information is available at www.newflyer.com.

 

POSITION SUMMARY

As a member of the Strategic Sourcing team, the Supply Chain Analyst will play a critical role in ensuring the organization's adherence to trade regulations, tariffs, and duty requirements. This position involves active collaboration with suppliers to gather, track, and verify required documentation, including USMCA and K32 certificates, as well as detailed material composition and origin data for purchased items. The analyst will support Sourcing Business Management team in cleaning and organizing data into appropriate tracking systems, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of compliance records.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

·         Engage in active collaboration with suppliers to monitor, track, and prioritize requests for information

·         Request, collect, verify, and organize USMCA Certificates received from suppliers, ensuring data accuracy in the documentation received and the in database

·         Gather and maintain detailed material composition and origin data on purchased items

·         Support Business Analysts with data cleansing and organizing information into appropriate tracking systems

·         Keep informed about evolving legislation related to tariffs, duties, and trade regulations

·         Conduct and prepare analyses as needed or as directed by Sourcing Leadership

Requirements

WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:

·         Post-secondary education in business, management, or a related field (completed or in progress)

·         Experience with customs or compliance functions is an asset

·         Experience working with manufacturing bills of materials (BOM) strongly preferred

·         Intermediate to advanced proficiency in MS Excel and other MS Office application

·         Experience with ERP systems and data management

·         Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills

·         Ability to thrive in a fast- paced, team-oriented environment

Benefits

Benefits

OUR WHY: We exist to move people. Our mission is to design, deliver, and support market-leading bus and motor coach solutions that are safe, accessible, efficient, and reliable.

NFI Group | We Move People - YouTube

Leveraging 450 years of combined experience, NFI is leading the electrification of mass mobility around the world. With zero-emission buses and coaches, infrastructure, and technology, NFI meets today’s urban demands for scalable smart mobility solutions. Together, NFI is enabling more livable cities through connected, clean, and sustainable transportation. News and information is available at www.nfigroup.com, www.newflyer.com, www.mcicoach.com, nfi.parts, www.alexander-dennis.com, arbocsv.com, and carfaircomposites.com.

 

WHY JOIN US:

  • Be a part of a team leading the world’s electrification of mass mobility
  • Competitive Wages and comprehensive benefit package with Immediate benefit eligibility    
  • Paid holidays and vacation
  • Passionate about creating a better product, a better workplace, and a better world
  • Inclusive workplace culture that values and empowers team members.
  • On-the-job training in a continuous learning environment (we’ve invested 10.9 million in 2023)
  • Advancement opportunities within our family of companies

New Flyer is an equal opportunity employer.  We celebrate diversity, ensure equitable experiences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment reflective of the communities we operate. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the candidates’ request.

job_information.title: Business Systems Analyst
job_information.description:
Since our inception in 2017, PURPLE has been on a mission to redefine denim culture. Blending industrial design, streetwear, and luxury fashion, we've curated a collection of men’s denim and luxury basics that transcend trends. At PURPLE, we take pride in challenging conventions through design that is grounded in a contemporary spirit and timeless quality.


Job Responsibilities:


We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst who’s curious, hands-on, and excited to learn. You will be responsible for analyzing and improving our IT systems, working closely with the business to ensure our systems effectively support retail operations. You will play a key role in ensuring seamless integration and optimization of technology to improve business processes, customer experience, and overall operational efficiency.


Job Responsibilities:

  • Partner with cross-functional teams (retail operations, merchandising, marketing, and operations) to gather and document business requirements, and support system updates, and continuous improvements.
  • Ensure all existing functionality, integrations, and reconciliations are preserved and maintained.
  • Work hands-on with the configuration, integration, testing, and rollout of retail systems such as POS, inventory, ERP, and related tools.
  • Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) and validate that system changes meet business needs
  • Troubleshoot system issues and coordinate with different stakeholders or vendors to resolve them
  • Monitor system performance and help identify opportunities for small enhancements or improvements
  • Document workflows, system processes, and updates to support consistency and knowledge sharing
  • Support reporting and data accuracy by validating system outputs and helping maintain standard reports
  • Provide first-level user support, answer basic system questions, and help with training materials
  • Support system-related projects by helping track tasks, document requirements, and assist with implementation activities
  • Perform additional duties as assigned.



Skills & Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience in a business systems analyst role, preferably in the retail or fashion industry.
  • Experience with Netsuite ERP and retail eCommerce systems (e.g. Shopify) is a must.
  • Experience documenting requirements and supporting system testing
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work on the technical side, not just business requirements
  • A strong willingness to learn, take ownership, and figure things out in a startup environment


If you are excited about the opportunity, please submit your resume and any other relevant info (i.e. website, portfolio, LinkedIn, etc.).


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer; all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications and business needs.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
About Us

Established in 1982, Bulk Barn is Canada's largest bulk food retailer with close to 300 stores and growing! The key to our success is progressive thinking, detailed/ methodical planning and flawless execution by passionate people across our organization. We strive to foster a balanced and flexible culture that benefits both our customers and employees.

Our Values:

  • High Standards
  • Passionate
  • Committed
  • Exciting and Fun
  • Supportive
  • Customer Oriented

What We Offer

In addition to a competitive compensation program and employer-paid benefits, we also include:

  • 32-hour flexible work-week program currently being tested
  • Use of top-tier on-site fitness facility at our Corporate Head Office free of charge to employees

ABOUT THE ROLE

This role is responsible to partner with Project Managers to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget and contribute positively to Company efficiency and productivity.  The Business Analyst is responsible to gather and analyze business needs and assist in the identification of solutions and provide system support with a specific focus on ERP solutions. This job requisition is for an existing vacancy.

 

Duties and Responsibilities

 
Project/Task Management

  • Develop a Requirements Management Plan and disseminates the plan to all stakeholders.
  • Define measurable criteria for ideal, adequate and unacceptable system performance levels based on data gathered from stakeholders.
  • Prioritize features and functions of the product or upgrade.
  • Monitor vendor and user requested enhancements and/or patches to ensure alignment and appropriate approvals are in place.
  • Examine and document existing business models, flow of data, and communicate the findings in order to clarify details to support technical development, including application solutions alternatives.
  • Conduct stakeholder follow-up to ensure that needs have been met by the completed project.
  • Assess stakeholders needs and translate them into clear and concise objectives.
  • Evaluates and recommends solutions relevant to projects based on knowledge of the Company and its systems as well as new technology available.
  • Perform quality assurance processes to confirm that required business needs are met by the technical solution and process.
  • Works with key project stakeholders to formulate and communicate the business plan, to gather initial requirements, understand project concept, objectives and approach, and to scope the assigned project.
  • Provide system support including identification of the problem, documenting, working with development teams to resolve issues and implementing into permanent fix.

Communication

  • Act as a liaison between the various business functional areas (including retail store locations) and the Information Technology team and third party vendors to translate business requirements into functional requirements.
  • Communicates any technical/architectural complexities to project stakeholders and development team.

Process Improvement

  • Identifies key opportunities for improved and/or expanded utilization of existing business applications and processes to provide recommendations to senior management which may input to the strategic planning process.

Problem Solving.

  • Work with the project team in identifying and resolving project problems and current system problems in a timely manner.
  • Investigate and work with the technical teams (internal and external) to resolve application and technical issues.

Customer Focus

  • Review the information provided to ensure a complete understanding of what the internal customer is requesting.
  • Conduct a post mortem to ensure internal customer satisfaction and bridge any performance gaps.
  • Provide quality customer service by managing relationships and communications to ensure customer expectations are met in a timely manner.
  • Deliver to the internal customer a product or service that meets their needs provide the appropriate training and support, as required.

Analytical Skills

  • Develop an understanding of how present and future business needs will impact the solution and conducts cost/benefit and risk analysis to support recommendations.
  • Analyze and develop a good understanding of current processes to ensure that the context and implications of change are understood by the customer and the project team.
  • Analyze, identify and assess business opportunities and address key business challenges.
  • Design, develop and implement performance metrics to support customer measurement, analysis, and reporting and measure the effectiveness of predictive modeling efforts.

Quality

  • Complete user testing to ensure functionality meets internal customer specifications and documents and resolves program defects.
  • Ensure software quality, as directed by Director, Information Technology.

Teamwork

  • Assists the Project Manager by managing client expectations through careful and proactive communications regarding requirements and changes. 
  • Implements improvements through effective teamwork and engagement of others.
  • Participate in project close out and lesson learned activities.
  • Assist Project Managers with new projects providing input into the project scope, schedule, risks, effort and cost.
  • Educate stakeholders about requirements, technology and tools of the new project.

Accountability

  • Ensure that product or service recommendations comply with Company Operating Budget and the needs of the business.
  • Ensure the implementation and follow up of projects with business units to assure ongoing support and assimilation into the business.
  • Ensure all business requirements meet IT and Company Operating Standards.
  • Promotes and works to maintain workplace wellness, health and safety, through active compliance with all workplace health and safety policies and procedures.

 

Any other duties as required.

 

Education & Skills

  • Undergraduate Degree in Business or Computer Sciences
  • Certificate in technical training and facilitation, an asset
  • 3-5 years experience supporting Microsoft Dynamics BC Systems
  • Query (SQL) experience is an asset
  • 3-5 years’ experience documenting technical requirements
  • 3-5 years’ experience developing business and internal customer presentations
  • 5 - 8 years’ experience working with IT/IS teams
  • 3-5 years’ experience participating and or leading team meetings
  • 5 - 8 years’ experience with data management
  • 3-5 years’ experience working with tight project deadlines, vendor and internal customer contracts and budget constraints
  • 3 – 5 years’ experience using project quality assurance management tools
  • Retail operations experience is an asset.

Bulk Barn Foods Limited is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. Accommodation is available in accordance with the AODA, if requested. 

Thank you for your interest. Only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone calls please.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Enercare Inc. is one of Canada’s largest home and commercial services companies servicing over one million customers across Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta, British Columbia, Quebec and New Brunswick.  Enercare is the Experts atHome, operating under several brands including Enercare,  HydroSolution, and Pioneer Plumbing & Heating.  

A proudly Canadian-owned company, we are the Experts at what we do and deeply care about our customers.  We value a diverse, collaborative culture, and take pride in our commitment to health and safety, and knowing our work serves and supports our communities every day. No matter your role, we invest in making sure you have opportunities to grow, learn, and become the Expert you want to be.

If you are ready to become one of our Experts, we would love to hear from you.

Role:                Business Analyst
Status:             Full Time, Regular

Reports to:      Senior Manager, Business Markets Strategy and Analytics

Department:    Builder Division

Location:         Markham
Compensation: $69,136 - $110,618

Please note that the compensation range listed includes base salary and potential incentive pay. Incentives such as bonuses are not guaranteed and depend on individual performance and company results. Actual compensation within the range will be determined based on skills, experience, and qualifications.

 

Overview
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Business & Data Analyst to join our team. This role is ideal for someone early in their analytics career who is eager to learn and contribute to data-driven decision-making, reporting, and process improvement initiatives. You will support senior analysts and business stakeholders by collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data to uncover insights and drive operational efficiency.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in gathering, validating, and organizing data from various sources including Azure SQL databases and Excel
  • Conduct basic data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in business operations
  • Ensure data accuracy and completeness in reports and dashboards
  • Develop and maintain SQL databases to supporting reporting requirements
  • Lead the development of dashboards and KPI scorecards using Power BI
  • Create visually engaging and user-friendly reports to communicate insights to business users
  • Help maintain and update existing reporting tools and templates
  • Assist in preparing financial and operational reports, including cost analysis and forecasting
  • Contribute to the development of simple financial models under guidance
  • Participate in evaluating business needs and identifying opportunities for data-driven improvements
  • Support preparation of month end deliverables to Finance and understanding the key business drivers to explain variances and anomalies
  • Document current workflows and identify inefficiencies through data and stakeholder input
  • Support small-scale process improvement initiatives and automation efforts
  • Apply design-thinking and user-focused approaches to improve data usability and accessibility
  • Work closely with business teams to understand reporting and data needs
  • Communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Learn from senior team members and participate in training and mentorship opportunities

 

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in Business, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • 3-5 years hands on experience using Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack with primary focus on Power BI
  • Working knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases, warehouses and data lakes in Azure SQL DB
  • Integration environment, incl. utilization in Logic Apps, Function Apps, Functions, and API Management.
  • Knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) is a must.
  • Experience in modelling and data visualization; working with different data schemas and BI implementation methodologies.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, formulas, charts, graphs)
  • Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking
  • Good communication and collaboration skills
  • Eagerness to learn and grow in a fast-paced, data-driven environment

 

Enercare is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship, marital status, disability, pregnancy, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law. Enercare’s recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities in accordance with applicable provincial accessibility laws and regulations.  All accommodations will take into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

Our company leverages artificial intelligence (AI) tools as part of the candidate screening process to help review applications efficiently and fairly. These tools may assist in evaluating qualifications against job requirements. All decisions regarding hiring are ultimately made by our recruitment team. All roles posted are opportunities we’re actively recruiting for, unless stated otherwise.

job_information.description:
Enercare Inc. is one of Canada’s largest home and commercial services companies servicing over one million customers across Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta, British Columbia, Quebec and New Brunswick.  Enercare is the Experts at Home, operating under several brands including Enercare, HydroSolution, and Pioneer Plumbing & Heating. 

A proudly Canadian-owned company, we are the Experts at what we do and deeply care about our customers.  We value a diverse, collaborative culture, and take pride in our commitment to health and safety, and knowing our work serves and supports our communities every day. No matter your role, we invest in making sure you have opportunities to grow, learn, and become the Expert you want to be.

If you are ready to become one of our Experts, we would love to hear from you.

 

Role: Business Process Analyst

Status: Contract (12-months)
New or Replacement: Replacement Position

Reports to: Senior Manager, Business Process and Continuous Improvement

Division: Enercare Home Services

Location: Birchmount Office (Markham)
Compensation: $69,136 - $110,618

Please note that the compensation range listed includes base salary and potential incentive pay. Incentives such as bonuses are not guaranteed and depend on individual performance and company results. Actual compensation within the range will be determined based on skills, experience, and qualifications.


Summary:

A business process analyst examines, improves and streamlines business processes within an organization. They are responsible for identifying inefficiencies, bottlenecks and areas for improvement in the existing business processes. This involves thoroughly analyzing the current processes and identifying opportunities for optimization.

 

Once the areas for improvement are identified, a business process analyst works with various teams within the organization to develop and implement new processes, procedures and technologies that would improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the organization. They collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure all teams are aligned on the proposed changes.

 

The responsibilities of business process analysts also involve conducting process audits and performance assessments to ensure the processes are effective. They also provide training and support to the team members with regard to the new technologies.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing current business processes, workflows and procedures to identify areas for improvement.
  • Developing and implementing optimised processes and procedures to enhance efficiency, productivity and customer satisfaction.
  • Able to learn and map based on developed expertise vs constantly relying on the SMEs.
  • Ensure that analysis for all processes include people, systems and customer flows.
  • Understand how to drive discussions with a decision based model
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to design and execute process improvement initiatives aligned with organizational goals.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives, processes, and requirements, and translate them into clear and concise user stories, use cases, and functional specifications
  • Conduct gap analysis to identify discrepancies between current state and desired future state; recommend process improvements using methodologies grounded in friction reduction, waste/lean efficiency or process optimization workflows, and work with stakeholders to develop solutions to address business needs and requirements
  • Present process improvement points of view to stakeholders for decision alignment.
  • Monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of implemented process changes, measuring key performance indicators and making necessary adjustments for continuous improvement.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies and process improvement methodologies.
  • Conduct a thorough data analysis and process mapping to identify obstacles, inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement.
  • Develop and implement relevant processes and technologies to optimise the organisation’s internal operations.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of new business processes and systems
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process changes, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruption to operations.
  • Communicate with shareholders and stakeholders to ensure alignment on proposed changes.
  • Monitor process audits and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented process changes, gathering feedback and making necessary adjustments.
  • Create process documentation and guidelines, including standard operating procedures and workflow diagrams.
  • Provide training and support to team members on new processes and best practices.

Requirements:

  • BBA or equivalent post-secondary education
  • 3+ years of experience in business process analysis and mapping or a related role supporting a contact centre/customer service environment.
  • Proven ability 2+ years in process re-engineering, process mapping and customer journey mapping.
  • PMP certification
  • Utility Experience
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in process mapping and analysis tools and software (e.g., Visio, Excel, SQL, Tableau).
  • Experience with process modeling and improvement methodologies (e.g., Six Sigma, Lean).
  • Self-starter with strong interpersonal and conflict resolution skills
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills
  • Ability to quickly form relationships and interact effectively in a complex environment
  • Strong desire to understand operations and root causes of issues
  • Strong ability to multi task and work under tight timelines
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills
  • Strong presentation skills
  • Ability to understand financial impacts and back-end billing environments
  • Ability to prioritize deliverables and work with various people in all levels, including customers, to achieve personal and team objectives
  • Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities
  • Strong analytical experience
  • Able to manage the demands, requirements and organization of a project
  • Extensive experience handling multiple billing systems and exceptions management
  • Superior working knowledge of Microsoft Applications such as Excel and Access
  • Power BI, Advanced Excel



Enercare is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship, marital status, disability, pregnancy, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law. Enercare’s recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities in accordance with applicable provincial accessibility laws and regulations.  All accommodations will take into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

Our company leverages artificial intelligence (AI) tools as part of the candidate screening process to help review applications efficiently and fairly. These tools may assist in evaluating qualifications against job requirements. All decisions regarding hiring are ultimately made by our recruitment team.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst - Health Insurance (Fully Remote)
job_information.job_title_raw: Senior Business Analyst - Health Insurance (Fully Remote)
job_information.description:
Top 3 Reasons To Join Us

  • Competitive Salary
  • 100% Remote
  • Working on the latest tech for the Insurtech Market Leader

About Us

At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone.

  • We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C
  • We’re the winner of the Insurtech of the Year in all of Asia and other awards globally
  • We work with insurance enterprise clients such as AXA, Bupa, MSIG, Dai-ichi, Bank of China Group Insurance, and many more
  • We're an international, diverse team of over 120 people with 30 nationalities and team members working remotely from all over the world
  • We are fully funded and backed by reputable VC funds and strategic institutional investors
  • We have a global presence in Asia, EMEA and the Americas
  • We’ve grown our annualized revenue by over 30x since January 2021
  • We’re constantly working towards making CoverGo a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world

What You Will Do:

  • Work with clients and technical resources to identify their business problems and develop the right approach and analytical solution
  • Plan and design simple to semi-complex business processes and system modifications
  • Make recommendations to improve and support business activities
  • Gather business requirements through a variety of techniques such as work sessions and interviews then analyze and document client complex business requirements and processes; communicate these requirements to appropriate parties
  • Create complex test case scenarios to be used in testing; monitor/oversee the testing of business applications to verify that all client requirements are incorporated into the system design
  • Develop business requirements documents/user stories to support the required modifications
  • May plan, allocate and monitor work of other business analysts
  • Understand simple to complex systems and related data to surface actionable insights, demonstrate sound judgment and decision-making skills
  • Assist in providing time estimates for project related tasks
  • Aid in updating process and procedural documentation
  • Develop basic understanding of technical development cycle of mobile application or web portals
  • Support QA, UAT and Release phases of the project via defect analysis, change maintenance, etc.
  • Any other task that may be assigned

What We Need:

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as Business Analyst
  • A degree in Business, IT or any relevant field
  • Previous experience working in the health insurance industry is required (insurtech experience is preferred)
  • Health Insurance-related domain certification from INS/LOMA or III is an added advantage
  • Knowledge of business analysis concepts of defining requirements, translating to technical solutions, and Agile approach to prioritizing work to epics, sprints
  • Business analysis skills including facilitation, process documentation, requirements gathering and user acceptance testing
  • Good organizational/time management skills to prioritize work and meet deadlines within defined timeframes
  • Experience in an Agile and/or Scrum environment is a must
  • Basic knowledge in generating process documentation, and document system functionality, data integration, and workflow
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Technical writing skills are a plus
  • Must be based in Canada
  • Must be working to work CET hours (Central European Time) or adjusted EST hours

Why You'll Love Working Here

  • Fully Remote
  • Flexible Leave
  • International Environment
  • Competitive renumeration package
  • Performance Bonus
  • Stock Options after 6 months
  • Company activities and events
  • Learning and development plan
  • Remote work allowance

CoverGo Company Video

By submitting your application, you confirm that you have read, understood, and accepted the content of CoverGo’s Privacy Notice and you consent to the processing of your data as part of this application.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
AFL is a global leader in fiber optics, providing integrated solutions in engineering, construction, installation, and repair services for broadband networks. Known for its innovation, AFL began in 1984 with a single product and has grown into a billion-dollar company serving telecom, oil and gas, and utilities markets worldwide.

AFL is committed to environmental responsibility, employee well-being, and community engagement through grants, service projects, and sustainability initiatives. Backed by Fujikura Ltd, a $6 billion company with over 128 years of innovation, AFL offers a culture of collaboration, growth, and stability with operations across Canada, the U.S., Mexico, Europe, Asia, and Australia.

AFL is seeking a sharp Business Analyst with analytical firepower, crystal-clear communication, and problem-solving grit to transform raw data into strategic wins. You'll bridge business needs and technical delivery—mastering Power BI, data modeling, and Microsoft automation to empower PMO, Finance, and cross-functional teams with timely, actionable insights.

Reporting to the Manager of Data and Analytics, the Business Analyst will maintain and improve existing BI solutions while contributing to new initiatives that support accurate and timely reporting for internal and external stakeholders. The Business Data Analyst will work closely with cross‑functional teams and executives, leveraging strong communication and analytical skills to translate business needs into scalable, reliable data solutions.

What you will do:

  • Support full lifecycle report development, including requirements gathering, data modeling, ETL, visualization, and deployment.
  • Design and maintain datasets, data models, and data extractions for reporting across Engineering, Project Management, Construction, Supply Chain, and other business units.
  • Build and maintain Power BI datasets, reports, and dashboards using data modeling best practices.
  • Use Power Automate to streamline data refreshes, automate business processes, and optimize reporting workflows.
  • Connect to and manage data sources including SharePoint Lists and libraries, SQL databases, REST APIs, etc.
  • Identify data quality issues in source systems, collaborate with stakeholders to resolve them, and recommend improvements.
  • Partner with cross‑functional teams to translate business needs into technical specifications and reporting solutions.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation covering reports, datasets, ETL pipelines, data models, automations, and business processes to support long‑term sustainability and team knowledge retention.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives focused on system optimization, automation, and reporting efficiency, including the adoption and integration of AI‑driven tools.
  • Follow and promote AFL’s environmental, health, and safety policies.

What you bring:

  • Hands‑on experience developing Power BI solutions (Desktop & Service) in a production or enterprise environment.
  • Experience in DAX, data modeling, and BI development workflows.
  • Experience using SharePoint as a data source (Lists, document libraries, folder connectors).
  • Experience or demonstrated interest in learning Microsoft Power Platform tools (Power Automate, Power Apps).
  • Strong analytical and problem‑solving skills with attention to data accuracy, including the ability to normalize inconsistent client data for analytics‑ready ingestion.
  • Excellent communication skills for gathering business requirements and explaining technical concepts to non‑technical audiences.
  • Self‑driven, curious, and eager to learn new tools and technologies.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently or collaboratively in a fast‑paced environment.

Nice To Have:

  • Experience with SQL for querying and basic data transformations.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft cloud technologies (Azure, Power Platform administration, etc.).
  • Background or domain experience in Telecommunications or Construction.
  • Experience with automation or ETL tooling beyond the Microsoft Power Platform.

Working Conditions

  • Hybrid office environment
  • General hours of Monday through Friday 8:00am to 5:00pm
  • Some travel may be required

Why AFL? AFL is a global leader in the telecommunications industry, providing cutting-edge network technology and solutions to customers around the world. At AFL, we’re committed to diversity and inclusion, recognizing that our team members’ unique contributions help us provide superior service and create better solutions. We provide best-in-class training to ensure you have everything you need to succeed and grow.

Additional Perks:

  • Competitive pay system
  • Annual merit increases
  • Excellent training and professional development opportunities
  • A supportive and diverse team environment
  • Opportunity to work in a dynamic, rapidly changing industry.

Ready to Join Us? If you’re passionate about customer service, technology, and telecommunications, we want to hear from you! AFL offers you the chance to grow your career with a leader in the field while being part of a team that values innovation, safety, and continuous learning.

We welcome diversity and encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply!

We provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. If you need accommodations during the application process, contact NS-Recruitment@AFLglobal.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, not discriminating based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

job_information.title: Business Analyst - Charles River Production Support (Toronto, ON, CA, M5H1B6)
job_information.job_title_raw: Business Analyst - Charles River Production Support (Toronto, ON, CA, M5H1B6)
job_information.description:
Requisition ID: 247851

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst in Scotiabank’s Global Wealth Engineering division.

 

Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

 

  • Provide day‑to‑day production support for Charles River and related technologies, ensuring stability and timely resolution of system issues.
  • Perform detailed root cause analysis (RCA) on production incidents and recommend remediation or preventive measures.
  • Work closely with portfolio managers, traders, compliance, operations and support teams to enhance system functionalities within Charles River.
  • Collaborate with IT and vendors on system enhancements, upgrades, and troubleshooting issues.
  • Maintain and communicate application changes and issues to key stakeholders
  • Analyze trade workflows, compliance rules, and operational processes to identify areas for efficiency improvements.
  • Work closely with portfolio managers, traders, compliance, operations, and support teams to understand issues and validate fixes.
  • Maintain and communicate updates on system issues, resolutions, and change impacts to key stakeholders.
  • Assist in user acceptance testing (UAT), production validations, and post‑deployment support.

 

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have:

 

  • Experience with Charles River Investment Management System(CRIMS), Charles River Everywhere(CRE) or similar Trading and Portfolio Management systems is strongly preferred
  • 3–4+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst within wealth management, asset management, or similar financial domains.
  • Strong understanding of investment workflows, order management, and trade lifecycle processes.
  • Familiarity with Wealth Management systems such as Client Accounting/Book of Record, Portfolio Performance, Transaction History, etc.
  • Experience working in Agile environments and writing user stories.
  • Experience with complex investment systems

Analysis and Problem Solving

  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills with proven experience performing systems and business root‑cause analysis.
  • Ability to interpret system behavior, logs, data flows, and configuration details to diagnose issues.

Technical Skills

  • Intermediate to advanced SQL skills for investigating data issues across systems.
  • Ability to work with multiple investment systems to gather data and validate findings.
  • Familiarity with interfaces, upstream/downstream system dependencies, and file/message flows.

Stakeholder Support & Communication

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to translate technical issues into clear business language.
  • Comfortable engaging directly with technical teams, business users, and vendor support teams.

 

What's in it for you?

 

  • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
  • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.  
  • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance. 
  • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
  • Dynamic Ecosystem - Free tea & coffee, universal washrooms, and lots of space for team collaboration.
  • Community Engagement - We offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons.

 

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto 

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. job_information.title: Business Integration Analyst (Toronto, ON, CA, M1L4S2)
job_information.job_title_raw: Business Integration Analyst (Toronto, ON, CA, M1L4S2)
job_information.description:
Requisition ID: 250606 

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 

As a Business Systems Analyst within Commercial Lending, you will play a critical role in enabling profitable growth, improving client experience, and strengthening risk management across our commercial lending portfolio. This role is designed for professionals with strong business acumen who are motivated by understanding how lending strategies, credit processes, and technology investments drive revenue, efficiency, and client outcomes in a large financial institution.

 

Working closely with Commercial Banking leaders, Credit, Risk, Operations, and Technology partners, you will translate business strategy into practical solutions that enhance how we originate, adjudicate, price, fund, and manage commercial loans. You will have a direct line of sight to how your work supports relationship managers, improves speed to yes for clients, and enables scalable growth across the Commercial Lending platform.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

 

  • Partner with Commercial Banking, Credit, Risk, and Operations leaders to understand business strategy, revenue objectives, and client needs, and translate them into clear, actionable requirements.
  • Analyze end-to-end commercial lending processes (origination, credit adjudication, pricing, documentation, funding, and servicing) to identify opportunities to improve client experience, reduce turnaround time, and enhance risk controls.
  • Assess the business impact of proposed changes, including efficiency gains, cost reduction, revenue enablement, and risk mitigation, and clearly articulate value to senior stakeholders.
  • Lead discovery sessions with relationship managers, credit officers, and operational teams to capture business requirements, pain points, and improvement opportunities.
  • Document business requirements, use cases, and user stories that clearly reflect commercial lending workflows and decision-making.
  • Collaborate with Technology and Delivery teams to ensure solutions align with business priorities, regulatory expectations, and operational realities.
  • Support testing, validation, and implementation activities to ensure delivered solutions meet business needs and are ready for adoption by front-line teams.
  • Develop change management and communication materials to support successful rollout and adoption across Commercial Banking teams.
  • Act as a trusted advisor to the business by proactively identifying opportunities to simplify processes, improve data quality, and enable better management reporting.

 

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:

 

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, with demonstrated exposure to business-facing stakeholders.
  • Strong business mindset with the ability to understand how processes, systems, and data drive financial performance, client experience, and risk outcomes.
  • Experience working in Commercial Banking, Commercial Lending, Credit, or Risk Management environments is strongly preferred.
  • Ability to analyze complex business problems, synthesize insights, and recommend practical, value-driven solutions.
  • Comfort engaging with senior business leaders and front-line teams, and translating between business and technical perspectives.
  • Strong analytical skills, including experience using data to support business cases, performance measurement, and decision-making (advanced Excel required).
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex ideas clearly in written, verbal, and visual formats.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, delivery-oriented environment.
  • Familiarity with Agile and traditional delivery methodologies, with the ability to adapt approaches based on business needs.
  • Experience with commercial lending platforms or workflow tools is considered a strong asset.

 

What's in it for you?

 

  • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
  • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.  
  • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance. 
  • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
  • Dynamic Ecosystem - Free tea & coffee, universal washrooms, and lots of space for team collaboration.
  • Community Engagement - No matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs.

 

 

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto 

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

job_information.title: Technical Business Analyst (Toronto, ON, CA, M5H1B6)
job_information.job_title_raw: Technical Business Analyst (Toronto, ON, CA, M5H1B6)
job_information.description:
Requisition ID: 235638

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 

The Global Wealth Engineering Technology team is seeking an exceptionally skilled and technically adept Senior Technical Business Systems Analyst to drive system architecture, integration, and optimization efforts within our organization. As a Senior BSA, you will be responsible for deep technical evaluations, advanced system designs, and ensuring seamless interoperability between complex enterprise platforms. The ideal candidate has extensive experience with enterprise architecture, cloud technologies, APIs, databases, and automation frameworks, and is adept at translating technical insights into business-focused solutions.

 

Is this role right for you? Key responsibilities will include:
 

  • System Analysis & Design: Conduct deep-dive analyses of business and technical requirements, ensuring scalable and efficient system designs.
  • Technical Expertise: Develop, refine, and implement complex technical solutions using advanced methodologies and tools.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with executives, business users, and IT teams to align technical solutions with organizational objectives.
  • Process Optimization: Identify inefficiencies and recommend automation or process enhancements to improve system performance.
  • Data Analysis & Reporting: Utilize advanced analytics to extract insights, forecast trends, and support business strategies.
  • Risk Management & Compliance: Ensure adherence to industry standards, regulatory requirements, and cybersecurity best practices.
  • Leadership & Mentorship: Guide junior analysts and technical staff, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
  • Enterprise Architecture & System Analysis: Assess and refine complex multi-tier architectures, including cloud-based and on-premise solutions, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance.
  • Technical Solution Design: Define system workflows, API interactions, and database structures, focusing on scalability, security, and performance optimization.
  • System Integration & Interoperability: Develop strategies for integrating disparate enterprise systems, leveraging middleware, APIs, and messaging protocols such as REST, SOAP.
  • Database & Data Management: Design and optimize relational and non-relational databases (SQL, NoSQL) and implement robust ETL processes for efficient data transformation.
  • Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure clear understanding of production issues.
  • Analyze and classify incoming incidents (INCs) to identify patterns, recurring issues, and potential system problems.
  • Manage the full lifecycle of incidents from logging to resolution and closure, ensuring compliance with SLAs.
  • Monitor and triage incidents using ServiceNow, ensuring timely updates and escalations as needed.
  • Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to drive root cause analysis and permanent fixes.
  • Maintain documentation of known errors, workarounds, and resolution procedures.

 

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:
 

  • Technical Proficiency: Extensive experience with enterprise systems, databases, cloud technologies, and integration frameworks.
  • Programming & Scripting: Strong command of [Specify Languages – e.g., Python, SQL, Java].
  • Business Acumen: Deep understanding of business processes, financial modeling, and strategic planning.
  • Analytical Thinking: Ability to assess complex problems, propose innovative solutions, and implement with precision.
  • Communication & Documentation: Exceptional ability to translate technical concepts into business-friendly insights.
  • Project Management: Expertise in Agile, Scrum, and other software development methodologies.
  • Strong understanding of incident management processes and ITIL framework.
  • Proficiency in ServiceNow or similar ITSM tools for monitoring, reporting, and workflow management.
  • Experience in classifying and categorizing incidents into system problems, enhancements, or user errors.
  • Ability to interpret and enforce Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and ensure compliance.
  • Excellent business communication skills—both written and verbal—for stakeholder updates and reporting.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to identify trends and propose improvements to reduce incident volume

 

What's in it for you?

 

  • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employees to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
  • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove, and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
  • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
  • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days, and benefits will start on day one.
  • Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!

 

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto

job_information.job_title_raw: Business System Analyst (Toronto, ON, CA, M1L4S2)
job_information.description:
Requisition ID: 244276

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Business Systems Analyst (BSA) to join our Business Banking Technology team.


Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

 

  • Manage relationships with Business stakeholders. 
  • Champion end-to-end requirement cycle 
  • Elicit and document requirements (User Stories) 
  • Analyze business processes. 
  • Translate those requirements into functional specifications for technical teams to develop and implement. 
  • Work with the business stakeholders and technology team in the discovery phase of the project and support with the preparation of the business case and providing detailed cost estimates to Business. 
  • Lead from the front and support technical teams to make sure that the development and testing timelines are aligned with the dates that are committed to business for requirement delivery. 

 

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:
 

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst 
  • Experience working with a large back or a major financial service company. 
  • Experience working in application systems that support credit advancement/ lending/ loans/ credit adjudication/customer onboarding. 
  • Experience with SQL and ability to run database queries to extract data from MS SQL or Oracle databases. 
  • Ability to write complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze the data.  
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with business process modeling and requirements-gathering techniques.
  • Familiarity with SDLC and Agile development methodologies.
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or Business, or Information Systems is a plus.
  • Experience in commercial banking applications is an asset.
  • Knowledge of commercial banking products is an asset.

 

What's in it for you?

 

  • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
  • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.  
  • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance. 
  • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
  • Dynamic Ecosystem - Free tea & coffee, universal washrooms, and lots of space for team collaboration.
  • Community Engagement - No matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs.

 

 

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto

job_information.description:
Who We Are  

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6,500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.   Further information is available at www.bgis.com

 

SUMMARY

The Business Analyst is responsible for the creation and preparation of financial and business models and reports, which are used to identify and develop value-creation opportunities in the delivery of projects to assist decision-makers in making well-informed business decisions.

 

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

For the assigned projects/business cases:

  • Responsible for gathering project, building, and strategic data to assist in creating and reviewing a Business Case submission to the client for all construction and repair projects exceeding $250,000, which outlines the strategic advantages of the investment concerning their long-term office plan. Collaborate with the Project Manager, Consultant, Property Manager, Heritage Conservation Manager, Capital Planning Manager, Energy Managers, and the Planning & Costing team. Multiple revisions of the business case will be necessary for Project Approval and Expenditure Authority. 
  • Collaborates with project managers to integrate the technical details, options, and costs provided by the project team in partnership with their consultants while incorporating the strategic elements from a business and financial analysis perspective into the Business Case.
  • Ensures the ongoing alignment of cost-benefit analyses with the strategic programs and plans for real estate. 
  • Develops financial models to assess the viability of options in project delivery using established techniques such as financial forecasting and net present value (NPV), to assist decision-makers in selecting options. 
  • For each Business Case, assist the project team in reviewing and developing the business needs, asset condition, prioritized requirements, project scope, assumptions, constraints, viable options, life cycle cost, construction cost, risks, policies and standards, justification and recommendation, and schedule.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Data Collection and Analysis

  • Generates and compiles data from various internal and external sources using different business intelligence tools and information management systems.
  • Compiles, maintains and analyzes a substantial amount of real estate portfolio data to meet diverse reporting, benchmarking, and analytical needs.

Reporting

  • Prepares various reports, including performance and scorecard reports, to aid business communication and decision-making.
  • Develops and maintains reporting and analytics dashboards using data analytics software, such as Power BI, to visualize strategic data as needed.
  • Creates and shares essential process metrics and information with internal customers.

Training

  • Train team members to correctly operate business and project management tools, processes, and procedures.

 

EDUCATION, JOB-RELATED YEARS OF EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bilingual (French/English) 
  • Excellent writing skills in both French and English. 
  • Strong understanding of the building construction process. 
  • Good knowledge of financial analysis and decision-making. 
  • Minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience, along with a university degree or professional certification (e.g., P. Eng, OAA, OAQ, PMP, CMA, CGA, AACE, or equivalent courses). 
  • Ability to manage large volumes of information and accurately handle extensive datasets. 
  • Exceptional attention to detail. 
  • Well-informed and experienced in the Project Management process related to Corporate Real Estate and construction projects; some experience with actual project delivery is an asset. 
  • Strong skills in data analysis and financial interpretation. 
  • Proficient in relational databases, reporting tools, and MS Office, including MS Access and MS Excel, with a proven ability to quickly learn new information management systems such as Power BI. 
  • Advanced MS Excel skills, including Macros, pivot tables, and lookup tables. 
  • Strong communication skills. 
  • Self-starter.

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

  • The above-listed credentials are an asset.

At BGIS, we believe that diversity and inclusion are key business drivers, such that we never lose sight of their importance as they are woven into the fabric of our organization. We are committed to maintaining a barrier-free recruitment process by providing equal employment opportunities through recruiting and retaining individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize that promoting diversity is an essential component of our continuing pursuit of organizational success!

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
SUMMARY

 

The Business Analyst is a commercially focused role responsible for developing, analyzing, and supporting pricing strategies that enable new business acquisition, contract expansions, and portfolio profitability. The role blends pricing analytics, market intelligence, and financial modeling to support competitive, data-driven commercial decisions.

Acting as a strategic partner to Business Development, Operations, and Finance, the Business Analyst evaluates cost structures, margin targets, service assumptions, and market conditions to support pricing proposals and business cases. The role also contributes to cross-functional initiatives to optimize pricing, commercial, and analytical processes, improving efficiency, data quality, and decision-making across the business.

This role will also support the accounting function and provide transactional support for the accounting cycle understanding the impact of transactions on financial results and provide analysis and input for planning, forecasting, reporting, and audit requirements.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

 

Pricing Strategy & Commercial Analysis

  • Provide analytical support for strategic, tactical, and operational pricing initiatives for new business and contract expansions.
  • Develop pricing models that assess cost drivers, margin requirements, volume assumptions, and risk factors.
  • Support solution design by evaluating commercial trade-offs between price, service levels, and profitability.
  • Provide recommendations to improve win rates while protecting margin and long-term financial performance.

New Business & Growth Support

  • Partner closely with Business Development and Operations to support bids, proposals, and expansion opportunities.
  • Prepare pricing inputs, commercial assumptions, and financial support for business cases and investment decisions.
  • Analyze historical performance, cost variances, and make-good results to refine pricing strategies.

Financial Analysis, Forecasting & Reporting (Enabling Capability)

  • Prepare financial analyses to support pricing decisions, including margin analysis, sensitivity analysis, financial reporting and scenario modeling.
  • Support forecasting activities by integrating pricing assumptions and commercial drivers.
  • Prepare internal management reports related to revenue, margin performance, and pricing effectiveness.
  • Support accounting cycle and month end reporting and variance analysis to forecast and plan
  • Drive actionable insights through monthly variance analysis

Accounting, Controls, Policy, & Governance Support

  • Provide intermediate analytical and transactional support related to pricing, revenue, contract performance and accounting cycle
  • Maintain documentation to support audit requirements and internal controls related to pricing and financial data.
  • Understand GAAP requirements relevant to the accounting cycle

Process Optimization & Continuous Improvement

  • Work on cross-functional initiatives to optimize pricing, commercial, and analytical processes.
  • Identify inefficiencies, data gaps, and manual workarounds within pricing and financial workflows, and recommend scalable improvements.
  • Support the design and enhancement of pricing tools, templates, and governance frameworks to improve consistency and turnaround times.
  • Partner with Finance, Operations, Business Development, and Systems teams to implement process improvements and document updated workflows.

Systems, Data & Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Use financial and pricing systems, Excel models, and analytical tools to support commercial decision-making.
  • Understand and document data flows between operational, pricing, and financial systems.
  • Translate complex pricing and financial outputs into clear insights for non-finance stakeholders.
  • Prepare summaries, variance explanations, and recommendation memos for leadership review.

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

  • Strong understanding of pricing strategies, margin analysis, and commercial decision-making.
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to model scenarios and evaluate trade-offs.
  • Solid financial acumen, including cost structures, forecasting, and profitability analysis.
  • Ability to interpret market and competitive data and translate insights into actionable pricing recommendations.
  • Ability to identify process improvement opportunities and support initiatives that enhance efficiency, data integrity, and commercial outcomes.
  • Effective communication skills, particularly in explaining pricing logic and financial impacts to non-finance stakeholders.
  • High proficiency in Excel and intermediate knowledge of financial and pricing systems.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage competing priorities.
  • Post-secondary education in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
  • 3–5 years of experience in pricing analysis, commercial finance, business analysis, or related roles.
  • Experience in facilities management, commercial services, or contract-based services environments is considered an asset.

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

  • None required. 

This is a regular, full-time position with a salary range of $60,505 - $75,633 per annum. The starting salary will be based on the successful candidate’s competencies, including but not limited to experience, education and performance related to this role. 

BGIS is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome you to apply for a position with us! If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact us at askHR. Upon request for accommodation, we will consult with the applicant in question and provide, or arrange for the provision of, a suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Who We Are  

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.   Further information is available at www.bgis.com

 

SUMMARY

The Business Analyst role will lead / support the identification and development of Innovation Scenarios for the Account in direct support of all LOB across the Client Account.  This role will support in the development and implementation of Innovation Scenarios of behalf of the Account Leadership, with a strong focus on continuous improvement of key business process, systems and tools implementation.

 

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Generates and compiles data from multiple data sources using various business intelligence tools and information management systems.
  • Compiles, maintains and analyzes large volume of real estate portfolio data to support various reporting, benchmarking and analytical requirements in pursuit of Innovation Scenarios.
  • Prepares various reports including but not limited to performance reports and scorecard reports to assist with business communication and decision making.
  • Performs calculations and analysis to fulfill requirements including but not limited to performance reporting, occupancy cost allocation and chargeback, budget to spend variance reporting.
  • Supports the development of a measurement system and/or tool to assess awareness, understanding, buy-in and support of change management activities.
  • Interface with relevant concerned parties to understand business process related issues and to facilitate innovative solutions to traditional problems. Liaises with information technology system administrators (Computer Maintenance Management System, Annual Building Inspection, and Oracle Financials) to resolve field issues, as required.
  • Train field personnel and system users in the correct operation of business tools, processes and procedures.
  • Perform ad hoc audits and reporting of key business issues pertaining to client operations.
  • Develop and distribute key process metrics and information to internal customers.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

  • 1-3 years relevant work experience with a university degree or professional certification (e.g. P. Eng, CMA, CGA or equivalent courses).
  • Ability to handle a large volume of information and accurate management of large datasets along. 
  • Very strong attention to detail.
  • Strong data analysis and interpretation skills.
  • Computer proficiency in relational databases, reporting tools, MS Office including MS Access and MS Excel, with ability to learn new information management systems quickly.
  • Bilingualism in French and English an asset.

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

  • None required.

Upon request for accommodation, we will consult with the applicant in question and provide, or arrange for the provision of, a suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.

job_information.job_title_raw: Senior Business Analyst (Toronto, CAN-ON, CA, M5X 1E3)
job_information.description:
Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. With over 230,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world. For additional information, visit us at www.wipro.com.

Job Description

  • Engage with stakeholders to understand business objectives and translate them into functional and technical requirements
  • Conduct workshops, interviews, and documentation sessions to capture detailed requirements
  • Analyze existing business processes and identify areas for improvement
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications, and Use Cases
  • Work closely with development and QA teams to ensure requirements are accurately implemented
  • Validate solutions against business needs and perform gap analysis
  • Act as a liaison between business users and technical teams
  • Communicate project progress, risks, and issues effectively to stakeholders
  • Perform data analysis to support decision-making and provide actionable insights
  • Create dashboards and reports for business performance tracking
Mandatory Skills: Java-J2EE .

 

Experience: 3-5 Years .

 

The expected compensation for this role ranges from CAD 57000 to CAD 90000 .

 

Reinvent your world. We are building a modern Wipro. We are an end-to-end digital transformation partner with the boldest ambitions. To realize them, we need people inspired by reinvention. Of yourself, your career, and your skills. We want to see the constant evolution of our business and our industry. It has always been in our DNA - as the world around us changes, so do we. Join a business powered by purpose and a place that empowers you to design your own reinvention.

 

Wipro is committed to creating an accessible, supportive, and inclusive workplace. Reasonable accommodation will be provided to all applicants including persons with disabilities, throughout the recruitment and selection process. Accommodations must be communicated in advance of the application, where possible, and will be reviewed on an individual basis. Wipro provides equal opportunities to all and values diversity.
