job_information.job_title_raw: Salesforce Senior Business Analyst (Toronto, CAN-ON, CA, M5X 1E3)
job_information.description:
Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. With over 230,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world. For additional information, visit us at www.wipro.com. 

Job Description

 

  • Work with Business and technology partners to Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, considering non-functional requirements.
  • Research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
  • Document in the form of epics, stories, wireframes, business rules, and acceptance criteria. Ensuring stories are "ready" for upcoming sprints.
  • Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
  • Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
  • Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
  • Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
  • Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
  • Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in WIPRO services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
  • Support a positive work environment that promotes services to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest
  • Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency
  • Illustrate the five key guiding principles: Adopt an enterprise-wide approach, ensure secure and stable operations, automate and modernize systems, focus on delivery outcomes and foster speed.

 

Job Requirements:

 

 

  • Bachelor’s degree with more than 5-8 years relevant experience as a Salesforce Business Analyst professional
  • Commitment to applying advanced to expert knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise, including design, development, testing and project management.
  • Advanced to expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
  • Ability to work independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coach or guide team.
  • Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant.
  • This is a Hybrid role in Toronto 3-4 days/week

 

The expected compensation for this role ranges from $85,000.00  to $125,000.00.

job_information.title: Business Analyst
job_information.description:
At Raymond James, we develop, we collaborate, we decide, we deliver, and we improve together. 

The Technology Division at Raymond James is dedicated to providing cutting-edge solutions that enhance efficiency and connectivity for financial advisors and their clients.
This commitment to technology excellence supports Raymond James' mission to deliver superior financial services and maintain a competitive edge in the industry.

 

Business Analyst

 

How does the role impact the organization?

As a key member of the Raymond James Ltd. Project Management Office, you will collaborate with business and IT stakeholders, as well as third parties, to define and document business requirements for project implementations. Your work will directly influence the development of innovative solutions for our advisors and customers and enhance the administration and financial performance of the organization.

What will your role be responsible for?

  • Collaborate with Business, Product Owners, and technical leads to understand the business case and primary objectives of new projects.
  • Accurately capture business and technology requirements.
  • Translate user requirements into Business Analysis artifacts such as BRDs, use cases, user stories, process flow diagrams, integration diagrams, mapping documents, screen mock-ups, UI designs, and user manuals.
  • Perform gap analysis and translate findings into business process and/or system requirements.
  • Evaluate potential software solutions to ensure they meet business requirements and enterprise infrastructure and security standards.
  • Identify and advocate for process improvements to enhance business efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Support the QA team with test strategy, plan documentation, test scripts, and defect management, and participate in acceptance tests if required.
  • Perform impact analyses of changes and participate in change management.
  • Build trust and share knowledge to foster a positive and collaborative work environment.
  • Communicate with and influence project stakeholders
  • Explain complex technical ideas in a simple, understandable format.
  • Work effectively in virtual teams, handle multiple projects simultaneously, and meet tight deadlines.
  • Manage functional and technical requests, bug investigations, and discretionary work efforts using tools like JIRA, Confluence, and ServiceNow.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a broader technology group.

What can you expect from us?

Our most important investment is in people.  Upon eligibility, Raymond James Ltd offers flexible workstyles, a competitive compensation and benefits package. Our benefits range from Health Benefits, RRSP Matching Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, Volunteer Days, Discretionary Bonuses, Tuition Reimbursement and many more! We also support internal promotion and community involvement.


Expertise You Bring:

  • Minium of 3-5 years of experience
  • Proficiency in business analytics, problem solving, and process improvement.
  • Experience in eliciting, documenting, prioritizing, and defining business needs and requirements in complex scenarios.
  • Financial services industry experience or knowledge of fundamental investment concepts, practices, and procedures in the securities industry.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and a willingness to learn new applications.
  • Ability to work within deadlines in a high-volume, demanding environment while maintaining a high level of service and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and communicate effectively with a broad range of audiences.
  • Experience with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and familiarity with BABOK methodology and Business Analysis Best Practices.
  • Superior communication skills, both oral and written.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Ability to self-manage, govern time, and multitask effectively.
  • Technical or university degree in technology or business.
  • Minimum of five years as a successful business analyst supporting multiple systems.
  • Experience with agile and waterfall projects.
  • A proactive and dynamic attitude with initiative and eagerness to learn.

Is This Role Right for You? Are you adept at analyzing and synthesizing information, simplifying complex concepts, and creating visuals that help people understand issues? Then the role of Business Analyst with our team is for you! You will be responsible for analysis mandates within major projects in the financial services sector. Join a purpose-driven, winning team committed to results in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

We encourage our associates at all levels to:

  • Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same
  • Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes
  • Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind
  • Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter
  • Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm

Salary Range: $80,000-95,000 annually, in addition to competitive performance bonuses/incentives.

Actual compensation will be determined based on skills, experience, internal equity, and other job requirements.

This posting is for an existing vacancy.

At Raymond James – we honor, value, respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic self, our organization, clients and communities thrive, it is part of our people-first culture. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. 

Here at Raymond James we demonstrate our commitment to ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates. To request accommodations, candidates are instructed to contact Human Resources via email at recruitment@raymondjames.ca. By reaching out to this email address, candidates can communicate their specific requirements and discuss the necessary accommodations they may need to participate fully in the recruitment process.

We may use automated or AI-enabled tools to support parts of our recruitment and screening process, including screening, assessing or selecting applicants where applicable. These tools help us review applications efficiently, but they do not replace human decision-making.

job_information.title: Business System Analyst, Liquidity
job_information.description:
Ontario region pay information

The salary range for this position in Ontario is $80,000 to $130,000. The determination of an applicant’s base salary within this range is based on the individual’s location, skills and competencies, and unique qualifications.

Notice on the use of artificial intelligence in our recruitment process 

To ensure our hiring process is transparent, we want to inform all applicants that we utilize Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies, including those integrated into our recruitment vendors' platforms. We are committed to an equitable process where applicants are evaluated based on job-related knowledge, skills, and abilities. AI technologies do not replace human judgment in the candidate selection process. All final hiring decisions are made by our hiring managers and recruitment teams.

Your role, your impact

As a Business System Analyst, Liquidity, you will work closely with senior stakeholders, software developers, and business users to ensure that systems meet business goals and deliver value. If you have a strong background in technical business analysis, particularly within the liquidity space, and are adept at translating business requirements into functional and technical specifications, then this role is for you.

Responsibilities

Your day-to-day

  • Collaborate with senior stakeholders to define high-level business requirements and prepare business cases;
  • Recommend technology directions to align with business objectives;
  • Translate business requirements into comprehensive, complete, and accurate functional and technical specifications;
  • Develop and document business rules, interface specifications, and conceptual designs;
  • Lead design reviews and other meetings to ensure alignment and progress;
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing and other testing activities;
  • Write user manuals, functional specifications, and other project-related documentation;
  • Prepare training materials and deliver end-user training sessions.

Qualifications

Keys to your success

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a technical Business Analyst in Capital Markets;
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to drive conversations and interact with senior stakeholders, including VPs;
  • Results-driven and flexible approach, with a passion for variety in work and making meaningful contributions.

Extra edge

  • Experience with QRM software;
  • Experience in the liquidity space;
  • Knowledge and experience with reverse engineering, reading, gathering, and extracting code.

Language skills

job_information.job_title_raw: Business Analyst, Capital Markets, Collateral Risk Management
job_information.description:
Ontario region pay information

The salary range for this position in Ontario is $80,000 to $130,000. The determination of an applicant’s base salary within this range is based on the individual’s location, skills and competencies, and unique qualifications.

Notice on the use of artificial intelligence in our recruitment process 

To ensure our hiring process is transparent, we want to inform all applicants that we utilize Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies, including those integrated into our recruitment vendors' platforms. We are committed to an equitable process where applicants are evaluated based on job-related knowledge, skills, and abilities. AI technologies do not replace human judgment in the candidate selection process. All final hiring decisions are made by our hiring managers and recruitment teams.

Your role, your impact

As a Business Analyst, Capital Markets, Collateral Risk Management, you’ll work closely with various stakeholders to analyze, document and optimize business processes and systems related to derivative products.

Responsibilities

Your day-to-day

  • Analyze and document business requirements for front- and middle-office processes related to collateral risk management and over-the-counter (OTC) derivatives, including credit default swaps, swaps and repo trades;
  • Collaborate with trading, risk and operations teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of systems;
  • Develop detailed business and functional specifications, ensuring alignment with business objectives;
  • Conduct gap analysis and identify areas for process improvement and optimization;
  • Support the implementation of new systems and enhancements, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations;
  • Work with IT and development teams to ensure accurate translation of business requirements into technical solutions;
  • Participate in the testing and validation of new systems, including user acceptance testing (UAT);
  • Manage and mitigate risks associated with collateral management and derivative transactions;
  • Keep abreast of industry trends, regulatory changes and best practices in collateral risk management and derivative markets.

Qualifications

Keys to your success

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, finance, business or a related field;
  • 5 to 7 years of experience as a business analyst;
  • Minimum 4 years of experience working with the front and middle office on reporting for OTC derivatives, including experience with credit default swaps, swaps and repo trades;
  • Proven experience as a business analyst in front- and middle-office functions for derivatives;
  • Experience in collateral and margin management for OTC trades;
  • Experience with financial software systems and platforms;
  • Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies;
  • Strong understanding of credit default swaps, swaps, margining for OTC and repo trades, and collateral risk management;
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as attention to detail;
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with diverse teams.

Extra edge

  • Advanced degree or certification in finance or business analysis;
  • Experience with regulatory requirements and compliance in the derivatives market;
  • Familiarity with project management practices and tools.

Language skills

  • English: Proficient

job_information.title: QA Analyst, Business Intelligence (BI/ETL/Synapse)
job_information.description:
Votre rôle, votre impact

This job posting is available in French only due to the location of the publication.

En tant qu’analyste en assurance qualité (QA) spécialisé en intelligence d’affaires (BI/ETL/Synapse), vous serez responsable de tester, de valider et de garantir la qualité des pipelines BI, des transformations de données et des composants analytiques.

Responsibilities

Votre quotidien

  • Tester les processus ETL/ELT et transformations BI;
  • Vérifier l’intégration Synapse, le stockage et les composants analytiques;
  • Assurer la gouvernance des données et la qualité;
  • Automatiser les tests de pipelines;
  • Contribuer aux tests fonctionnels et intégrés avec les équipes BI et données.

Qualifications

Les clés de votre réussite

  • Forte expérience en BI/ETL;
  • Connaissance profonde de Synapse Analytics;
  • Compréhension des modèles sémantiques et pipelines BI;
  • Aisance avec les scripts de validation et les API;
  • Expertise technique suivante:
    • Synapse Pipelines, Linked Services, Notebooks Spark;
    • Azure Storage, Key Vault, Functions;
    • Réseau & sécurité avancés (VNet, Private Endpoints, Subnets);
    • ETL/ELT, architecture Medallion;
    • Outils BI : Semantic Models, Gateways;
    • Scripting : PySpark, PowerShell, Bash;
    • Tests d’API : Postman.

Compétences linguistiques

  • Français : Avancé
  • Anglais : Intermédiaire

Veuillez noter qu’un anglais de niveau intermédiaire est requis en raison de la nature des tâches, notamment pour communiquer de manière fréquente avec les employés et employées et les gestionnaires du Québec.

job_information.title: Analyste fonctionnel ou fonctionnelle
job_information.description:
Votre rôle, votre impact

Êtes-vous un analyste fonctionnel ou une analyste fonctionnelle qui sait transformer la rigueur analytique en levier d’action en livrant des analyses claires, ciblées et au moment opportun pour faire avancer les projets ? Joignez-vous à nous pour votre prochain défi !

Nous sommes à la recherche de talents pour renforcer notre expertise et nos communautés technologiques, engagées à soutenir nos clients de différents secteurs d’affaires, tels que l’assurance, les services financiers, les télécoms, etc., dans la réalisation de leurs projets. Vous jouerez un rôle actif dans des mandats variés, allant du développement de logiciels à la modernisation de systèmes hérités, en passant par des initiatives stratégiques de transformation numérique, telles que l’adoption de l’intelligence artificielle, de l’infonuagique et de solutions axées sur les données.

Dans ce rôle, vous serez au cœur de la réussite des projets, en assurant la liaison entre les parties prenantes techniques et non techniques. À l’aise avec des publics variés, notamment les clients, les développeurs et les experts d’affaires, entre autres, vous traduirez les besoins en solutions concrètes et favoriserez une collaboration fluide grâce à une communication claire et adaptée dans un environnement dynamique.

Cet affichage vise à créer une banque de candidatures pour de futurs postes. En postulant, vous serez pris en considération pour des postes potentiels dès qu’ils seront disponibles.

Responsibilities

Votre quotidien

  • Recueillir des besoins auprès des représentants des utilisateurs; 
  • Contribuer à l’analyse fonctionnelle des projets en produisant les analyses préliminaires, fonctionnelles et techniques; 
  • Analyser les anomalies et proposer des pistes de résolution;
  • Collaborer à la réalisation de prototypes pour définir l’expérience client; 
  • Participer aux sprints en appuyant l’équipe de développement et en validant les récits; 
  • Rédiger, documenter et réaliser des scénarios d’essais fonctionnels, et valider les résultats; 
  • Participer aux essais intégrés et préparer les données d’essais; 
  • Offrir un soutien après l’implantation et accompagner les utilisateurs lors des essais d’acceptation.

Qualifications

Les clés de votre réussite

  • 8 ans d’expérience en tant qu’analyste fonctionnel;
  • Expérience démontrée avec le framework Scrum;
  • Expérience avec les outils Jira, Confluence et Visio, ainsi qu’avec les API REST;
  • Expérience en lecture et rédaction de requêtes SQL de niveau débutant à intermédiaire (jointures, agrégation, sous-requêtes);
  • Expérience dans la validation de modèles de données, de flux d’intégration et de stratégies de migration de données;
  • Connaissance des modèles relationnels (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL) et des bases de données NoSQL (MongoDB, Cosmos DB, DynamoDB);
  • Capacité à gérer plusieurs dossiers complexes en parallèle, touchant à des dimensions telles que les affaires, le développement, l’infrastructure et la sécurité, avec rigueur et minutie;
  • Compréhension des architectures distribuées ainsi que des notions de conformité, de gouvernance et de gestion des risques;
  • Leadership affirmé, esprit de débrouillardise et aisance à communiquer clairement avec des parties prenantes à tous les niveaux hiérarchiques.

Vos atouts supplémentaires

  • Expérience avec SAFe, Azure DevOps, Figma, Miro, Lucidchart et Bizzdesign;
  • Expérience dans les secteurs de l’assurance, des services financiers ou dans tout autre secteur d’industrie;
  • Connaissance des principes d’ETL/ELT, de pipelines de données et de la gouvernance des données.

Compétences linguistiques

  • Français : Maîtrisé
  • Anglais : Maîtrisé

Veuillez noter qu’un anglais de niveau intermédiaire est requis en raison de la nature des tâches, notamment pour communiquer de manière régulière/avec les employés et employées et les gestionnaires/la clientèle/les partenaires commerciaux hors du Québec.

About Company

Un équilibre qui vous convient
L’équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée nous aide à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Nous proposons des options de travail flexibles et, grâce à notre plan de vacances illimitées, vous pouvez vous reposer et vous ressourcer lorsque vous en avez le plus besoin.

Des réalisations récompensées au fur et à mesure
Dès votre premier jour, vous aurez accès à notre programme de rémunération globale offrant un plan de rémunération complet, incluant des régimes de rémunération incitative à court terme.

Votre bien-être est important
Nos prestations sont conçues dans un souci de santé et de bien-être optimaux. Vous aurez accès à des soins de santé virtuels 24 heures sur 24 et 7 jours sur 7, ainsi qu’à un portail de bien-être complet qui fournit des outils et des ressources pour favoriser votre bien-être physique, mental, émotionnel et financier.

Croissance et apprentissage continus
Lorsque vous rejoignez Alithya, vous intégrez une équipe engagée à investir dans votre développement. Une industrie en pleine évolution exige un perfectionnement constant, et nous vous accompagnons dans votre croissance à chaque étape. Grâce à nos partenariats avec des leaders éducatifs de renommée mondiale, vous aurez accès à des milliers de cours et certifications en ligne. De plus, avec nos programmes de leadership exclusifs conçus pour vous permettre de diriger vos équipes avec assurance et d’obtenir des résultats significatifs, ainsi que notre programme de remboursement des frais de formation externe, nous vous donnons les moyens de réussir et de réaliser vos ambitions.

L’occasion d’être actionnaire
Nos collaborateurs et collaboratrices sont au cœur de notre réussite. Notre régime d’achat d’actions pour les employés et employées avec contributions jumelées cimente ce partenariat en vous permettant de partager notre croissance et de bénéficier directement de nos accomplissements collectifs.

Notre authenticité est notre force
La diversité de nos parcours, de nos expériences, de nos pensées et de nos points de vue constitue notre avantage concurrentiel. Nous favorisons un environnement collaboratif ancré dans nos valeurs fondamentales de respect, bien-être, passion, confiance, intégrité et créativité. Pour nous, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion ne sont pas de simples mots à la mode ; ce sont des moteurs indispensables d’innovation et d’excellence, et des catalyseurs puissants d’inspiration et d’idées évolutives. La valorisation de nos collaborateurs et collaboratrices est indissociable de notre rôle de conseiller de confiance. Joignez-vous à nous et célébrons ensemble notre authenticité en intégrant nos perspectives uniques afin de construire collectivement l’avenir que nous imaginons.

Un parcours inclusif vers le succès
Nous veillons à assurer un environnement où chaque personne peut s’épanouir, en commençant par un processus de recrutement accessible. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation, nous vous encourageons à nous contacter en consultant www.alithya.com/fr/accessibilite pour plus de détails.

Company

Notre mission, votre avenir
En tant que réseau mondial de conseillers et conseillères de confiance, nous créons des solutions technologiques de pointe pour relever les défis d’aujourd’hui et anticiper les besoins de demain. Tout commence par la collaboration d’une équipe diversifiée d’innovateurs passionnés et d’innovatrices passionnées ayant la volonté de faire la différence. Ensemble, nous remettons en question le statu quo et nous nous surpassons pour atteindre de nouveaux sommets.
Prêt ou prête à laisser votre empreinte sur des mandats stimulants et à façonner l’avenir grâce à la transformation numérique et au conseil stratégique ? Donnez vie à vos ambitions en relevant votre prochain défi avec nous !

job_information.title: Business Analyst (9-month Contract)
job_information.description:
About Us:
As a leading Canadian wealth management organization, Richardson Wealth offers the personal touch of a boutique firm while delivering big results. With offices across the country, we are home to some of Canada’s best investment advisors. We’ve embarked on an exciting growth phase – a multi-year transformational journey to enhance our entrepreneurial, high-performing, advisor-centric culture.
 

Position Overview    
This position is a member of the Business Solutions team, reporting to the Manager, Business Analysts.

This is an existing vacancy.

Duties and Responsibilities    
• Acts as the primary contact/relationship manager for a portfolio of business partners in the development and implementation of strategic directions, new business opportunities, product initiatives, and service developments.
• Consults with the business to understand its goals and objectives for a specific initiative or project and advises the business on the functionality, applicability, and usability of alternative solution.
• Responsible for owning the solution to satisfy the business need.
• Elicits, analysis, documents and manages business and solution requirements.
• Acts as a primary requirements management contact on projects.
• Recommends process improvements.
• Builds relationships and works collaboratively with stakeholders to identify solutions and resolve variance from product/application specifications.
• Reviews testing documentation and participates in triaging defects to ensure business needs and solution requirements are met.
• Participates in post implementation reviews and processes (e.g. lessons learned, post-install application verifications, warranty support reviews etc.).
• Provides subject matter expertise on specific application usage or area of knowledge (e.g., setting up customer data on various products).
• Supports other team members in achieving project/ business objectives and providing client services.
• Fosters a positive work environment that promotes customer service, quality, innovation and teamwork.

Qualifications    
• 7+ years progressive business analysis experience 
• Solid problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to multi-task in a multi-faceted role within a high paced environment.
• Strong relationship management, communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
• Solid understanding of requirements elicitation, analysis, documentation and management.
• Experience in large-scale implementations of third-party solutions.
• Hands-on experience in business process modelling using UML, BPMN or similar techniques. 
• Hands-on experience in identifying, documenting, and communicating data requirements.
• Knowledge of the project management lifecycle (PMLC) and experience with various applications of the software development lifecycle (Waterfall, Iterative, Agile).
• Expertise in Wealth Management domain and Wealth Management Front Office and Back Office Full Service is a definite advantage.
• Working knowledge of SQL is a strong asset.
• Familiarity with business assessment tools (e.g. feasibility studies, business cases, cost/benefit analysis, project sizing and costing) is an asset.
• Rebranding project experience is an asset

Education    
• University degree/college diploma
• Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)

The expected annualized base salary range for this role is $115,000-$130,000
The actual salary offered will take into consideration a wide array of factors including, but not limited to, the individual’s skill, experience, education and training, and the consideration of internal equity.

#LI-Hybrid

Why Apply:
Our firm is only as good as the people who work here. Our employees are exceptional because they combine in-depth expertise with enthusiasm, and empathy. From our front office talent to our colleagues behind the scenes, we have one focus: to ensure our people thrive here more than anywhere else. Are you innovative, self-driven, and client-centric?

If so, we’re ready to invest in you.

Richardson Wealth is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment. We are happy to meet your individual needs in keeping with the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Candidates may request accommodation at any point during the interview process.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst -HR
job_information.description:
Company: CGL
Department: Human Resources
Employment Type: Regular Full-Time
Work Model: Hybrid
Language: This role operates in English.
Additional Information: This/these role(s) is/are currently vacant

 

The Opportunity:

We are a leading Canadian financial services co-operative committed to being a catalyst for a sustainable and resilient society and our team is essential to deliver on this strategy.  That’s why we prioritize our people, to ensure we provide a strong culture and development opportunities which enables our team to thrive and to live our purpose.  The best part is that you will work with people that care passionately about you, our clients and our communities.

Our national Human Resources team aspires to enable a culture where our company and its employees excel. We think innovatively and strategically to solve business problems and strive for operational efficiency and simplicity in the employee experience with HR. We take a proactive approach to preparing for the future by creating agile and flexible programs to remain competitive in attracting and retaining top talent.

As the Senior Business Analyst, you will partner with HR and technology teams to translate strategy and program priorities into actionable HR technology initiatives. You will lead end-to-end analysis and delivery activities, including the development of user stories and requirements, process and workflow design, acceptance testing, and the implementation of new or enhanced HR solutions.

You will support core HR, talent, payroll, and broader people‑related processes, ensuring alignment across initiatives within the HR technology portfolio. Working closely with a wide range of stakeholders, you will ensure solutions align with enterprise digital standards, enable agile delivery practices, and deliver high quality, people-centric outcomes that create meaningful business and employee value.

How you will create impact:

  • Partner with HR and technology stakeholders to understand, analyze, and document clear business and system requirements, processes, risks and dependencies related to HR platforms.
  • Analyze HR processes and systems to identify opportunities  and recommend solutions that enhance employee and leader experiences while meeting business, compliance and data requirements.
  • Lead testing activities for HR applications, including developing test strategies, planning, and effort estimates, while ensuring adherence to HR technology and Business Systems standards, methodologies, processes, and tools.
  • Support HR system design, configuration, development,  and implementation activities by providing subject matter expertise, participating in reviews and ensuring solutions accurately reflect business needs.
  • Coach, train and support team members by sharing HR systems knowledge, providing timely feedback and contributing to the effectiveness of the HR and delivery teams in achieving departmental objectives.

How you will succeed:

  • You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs.
  • You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions.
  • You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view.
  • You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues.

To join our team:

  • You have five years of experience as a business analyst, preferably supporting enterprise HR platforms, working in an agile environment.
  • You have a post-secondary degree in Business, Human Resources, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field, and a Business Analyst certification (e.g., CBAP, CCBA, PMI‑PBA, or equivalent).
  • You bring strong knowledge/ experience analyzing and documenting end‑to‑end workflows, data, and HR systems integrations.Experience working with enterprise HR technology platforms (e.g., Workday, SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM, UKG, ADP), including support for compliance, payroll, and data privacy requirements, is preferred.
  • You have excellent business and systems analysis skills, with the ability to understand and document complex applications, data flows, procedures and workflows within an HR technology ecosystem.

What you need to know:

  • You will be subject to a Background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.

What’s in it for you?

  • Training and development opportunities to grow your career.
  • Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs.
  • A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture.
  • Paid volunteer days to give back to your community.
  • In addition to our competitive salary and incentive programs, eligible employees also benefit from a comprehensive total rewards package including group retirement savings plans, pension and benefits (e.g., health and wellness, dental, disability and life coverage), mental health support and an employee assistance program.

Expected salary $72,847.00 to $121,411.00​

The salary amount for the successful candidate is determined by Co-operators in its discretion and will vary depending on several criteria including but not limited to: local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualification, experience and education.​ ​

Employees may also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn additional compensation tied to individual and/or business performance, or other business metrics.

​

#LI-CP1

job_information.title: Operational Risk Analyst
job_information.description:
Company: CGL
Department: Enterprise Risk Mgmt
Employment Type: Regular Full-Time
Work Model: Hybrid
Language: English is required, French is an asset.
Additional Information: This/these role(s) is/are currently vacant

 

The Opportunity:

We are a leading Canadian financial services co-operative committed to being a catalyst for a sustainable and resilient society and our team is essential to deliver on this strategy.  That’s why we prioritize our people, to ensure we provide a strong culture and development opportunities which enables our team to thrive and to live our purpose.  The best part is that you will work with people that care passionately about you, our clients and our communities.

Our national Finance team aspires to create, enhance, and protect value for our organization and its stakeholders. Our knowledgeable team educates and influences the organization to make well-informed, risk-based decisions. We think innovatively and strategically to solve business problems and strive to move our business forward with practical, integrated processes and tools that ensure organizational success.

As an Operational Controls Analyst you will contribute to the implementation of the operational controls program. Your work will evolve over time to match the needs of the program to ensure controls are identified, documented, reviewed, and tested.

 

How you will create impact: 

  • Support the development of Enterprise Risk Management’s risk framework in relation to expanding regulatory expectations (e.g. OSFI B-10 Third-Party Risk, B-13 Technology and Cyber Risk, and E-21 Enterprise Risk Management)
  • Aiding in the collection, confirmation, and documentation of key operational controls within the organization and ensuring the completeness and accuracy of data.
  • Contributing to the education and communication on risk related topics such as Third-Party Risk Management, and IT Risk Management
  • Working with the team and stakeholders to identify, document, and review risk mitigation tactics.
  • Providing support to team members and functions within the team as required.

 

How you will succeed: 

  • You influence change and are committed to continuous improvement, in order to exceed client expectations.
  • You leverage critical thinking skills to identify problems and proactively propose solutions.
  • Your strong communication skills allow you to clearly convey messages.
  • You’re an effective team player who shares knowledge to support our peers.

 

To join our team:

  • You have 4-6 years of experience in Information Risk Management, Operational Risk Management, Third-Party Risk, including 2-3 years of experience in an Insurance or Financial Services environment. 
  • You have a post-secondary degree in Business, IT, Math, or a related discipline.
  • You have experience in documenting and assessing IT controls
  • Having a Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Canadian Risk Management, Professional Risk Manager, or Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) designation is an asset.
  • This position primarily works with majority non-francophone groups, and teams located outside of Québec, and requires proficiency in English. The essential non-French duties are not assignable to adjacent or other team members.

 

 What you need to know:  

  • You will travel occasionally.  
  • Detail oriented work that requires a high degree of mental concentration for extended periods of time.
  • You will be subject to a Background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.

 

What’s in it for you?

  • Training and development opportunities to grow your career.
  • Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs.
  • A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture.
  • Paid volunteer days to give back to your community.
  • In addition to our competitive salary and incentive programs, eligible employees also benefit from a comprehensive total rewards package including group retirement savings plans, pension and benefits (e.g., health and wellness, dental, disability and life coverage), mental health support and an employee assistance program.

 

 

Expected salary range $60,574 - $100,956  ​ 

The salary amount for the successful candidate is determined by Co-operators in its discretion and will vary depending on several criteria including but not limited to: local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualification, experience and education.​​ 

Employees may also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn additional compensation tied to individual and/or business performance, or other business metrics.

job_information.title: ERP Business Analyst - Finance
job_information.description:
At ALS, we encourage you to dream big.

When you join us, you’ll be part of a global team harnessing the power of scientific testing and data-driven insights to build a healthier future. 

About the Position:

The ERP Business Analyst partners with Finance and NA business stakeholders to define, optimize, and support end-to-end finance processes within ALS’s Oracle ERP Environment. This role translates business needs into functional requirements, drives process standardization, supports Oracle finance solution design and enhancements, and ensures processes, controls, and reporting meet business and compliance needs across multiple entities, currencies, and regions

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Build working relationships with finance teams understanding their processes and staying abreast of planned changes
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to support ERP-related finance initiatives across diverse platforms. · Drive assigned projects aligned with the strategic direction of the Global ERP Director, Corporate Finance, and senior leadership
  • Identify and propose new initiatives or improvements that optimize financial systems and processes.
  • Ensure solutions comply with finance standards, including IFRS, and internal audit requirements.
  • Maintain a strong understanding of core finance processes and recommend process improvements.
  • Partner with finance teams to analyze, document, and translate business needs into functional and technical requirements.
  • Facilitate clear communication between technical teams and finance stakeholders.
  • Support testing, training, and deployment activities for system changes.
  • Maintain awareness of industry trends and best practices
  • Use correct methods in accordance with the established procedures and schedules while ensuring analytical quality;
  • Observe established safety regulations and comply with all ALS health and safety policies and procedures;
  • Monitoring production support incident queue and ticket assignment.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
  • Ability to make effective presentations on controversial or complex topics.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Proficient computer skills, specifically Microsoft Office.

Required Qualifications:

  • A minimum of Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field is required.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst / Finance Systems Analyst supporting ERP finance processes.
  • Strong finance and accounting knowledge (GL, AP, AR, accruals, reconciliations, period close).
  • Experience with one or more ERP: Oracle Fusion, MS Business Central, SAP, Pronto, Totvs is strongly preferred

Our Benefits Include 

  • An estimated annual salary ranging from $85,000 to $105,000 at the time of posting. Individual compensation is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training. 
  • Comprehensive benefit package specific to your work status (including extended medical, dental, and vision coverage, access to company perks, life and disability insurance, retirement plan with company match, employee assistance and wellness programs) 
  • Additional vacation days for years of service 
  • Business support for education or training after 9 months with the company 
  • Learning & development opportunities (unlimited access to e-learnings and more) 

  

Please note: Benefits vary based on employee status. 

Working at ALS

The ALS team is a diverse and dedicated community united by our passion to make a difference in the world.

Our values are important to us, and shape how we work, how we treat each other and how we recognise excellence. 

At ALS, you’ll be supported to develop new skills and reach your full potential. We invest in our people with programs and opportunities that help you build a diverse career with us. 

We want everyone to have a safe, flexible and rewarding career that makes a positive impact on our people, the planet and our communities.

Everyone Matters

ALS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where the strengths and perspectives of each employee are both recognised and valued.

Qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties, including women, First Nations, Metis and Inuit persons, members of minority groups, and persons living with disabilities.  

ALS also welcomes applications from people with all levels of ability. Reasonable adjustments to support candidates throughout the recruitment process are available upon request. 

Eligibility
To be eligible to work at ALS you must be a Citizen or Permanent Resident of the country you are applying for, or either hold or be able to obtain, a valid working visa.

How to apply
Please apply on-line and provide a resume & cover letter that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role.

job_information.title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
job_information.description:
Lightmatter is leading the revolution in AI data center infrastructure, enabling the next giant leaps in human progress. The company invented the world’s first 3D-stacked photonics engine, Passage™, capable of connecting thousands to millions of processors at the speed of light in extreme-scale data centers for the most advanced AI and HPC workloads.

Lightmatter raised $400 million in its Series D round, reaching a valuation of $4.4 billion. We will continue to accelerate the development of data center photonics and grow every department at Lightmatter!

If you're passionate about tackling complex challenges, making an impact, and being an expert in your craft, join our team of brilliant scientists, engineers, and accomplished industry leaders.

Lightmatter is (re)inventing the future of computing with light!

Lightmatter is seeking an experienced, driven Sr. Business Systems Analyst (BSA) to join our Enterprise Applications team.

Reporting directly to the Head of IT and Security, you will be instrumental in designing the business process flows that drive our company. You will be responsible for bridging the gap between key business stakeholders and our tech stack, ensuring our systems and environments support the unique complexities of a scaling fabless semiconductor company.

Responsibilities 

  1. Semiconductor Business Architecture
  • Design & Deploy Flows: Architect and implement end-to-end business flows from scratch. You will define how a wafer moves systematically from a Foundry through OSAT (Assembly/Test) to a finished good.
  • Process Mapping: Translate complex physical manufacturing processes into digital workflows, covering Yield Management, RMA, and Subcon Manufacturing.
  1. ERP & PLM Process Management
  • System Process Ownership: Serve as the functional process expert for NetSuite and Arena PLM. You will ensure the business can run these processes flawlessly as we scale.
  • Finance & Accounting Support: Configure and optimize Finance modules, focusing on Cost Accounting, Fixed Assets, Order-to-Cash, and Procure-to-Pay processes within a manufacturing context.
  • Supply Chain Operations: Configure flows through applications tracking, Inventory Valuation, and Demand Planning.
  1. General BSA & Integration Work
  • Requirements Gathering: Act as the liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams. You will translate "semiconductor speak" from engineers and Supply Chain into technical specs for developers, and "finance speak" into logic for system configuration.
  • Integration Oversight: Manage data flows between our internal systems and external parties (foundries, OSATs/Customers).
  • Documentation & Training: Create robust documentation for new processes and lead training sessions to ensure user adoption across the company.
  • Testing and Support: Lead and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and provide feedback to the administrators.  Provide hypercare after launch and general support for systems.
  • Partner Ecosystem: Work closely with our vendors and partners to understand and design solutions. 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 8 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst
  • Bachelor's degree in business or an IT-related field. 
  • Semiconductor Experience: You must have prior experience in the semiconductor industry. You understand the chip lifecycle, from tape-out to packaged unit, and the specific data requirements of a fabless model.
  • NetSuite Expertise: Deep functional knowledge of NetSuite is required. You should be comfortable with how NetSuite works, its capabilities, and best practices.
  • Proven Builder: You have been a BSA before and have a track record of setting up business flows from scratch or executing major system implementations. You are not just maintaining existing SOPs; you are writing them.
  • Domain Versatility: You are comfortable pivoting between Supply Chain (BOMs, WIP, Logistics), Finance (COGS, Revenue Recognition, Billing), and other teams daily.
  • Process Modeling: Ability to visualize and document flows to drive consensus among stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with IPaaS/Integration tools (e.g., Celigo, Boomi) for connecting NetSuite to other platforms.
  • Experience with Arena PLM
  • Experience with EDI standards for B2B connectivity with OSATs.
  • Previous experience in a high-growth hardware startup environment.

 

We offer competitive compensation. The base salary range for this role determined based on location, experience, educational background, and market data.

Salary Range: total compensation goes beyond base salary, it also includes a new hire equity grant, annual performance-based equity, and other rewards that recognize your impact and contribution.
$175,000—$207,000 USD

Benefits

  • Comprehensive Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Savings Matching Program
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Generous Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Paid Family Leave
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Flexible, hybrid workplace model
  • Equity grants (applicable to full-time employees)

Benefits eligibility may vary depending on your employment status and location. Lightmatter recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.

Export Control

Candidates should have capacity to comply with the federally mandated requirements of U.S. export control laws.

job_information.job_title_raw: Sr. IT Business Analyst, Shop Operations
job_information.description:
Company: Gerber Collision & Glass

WELCOME TO GERBER COLLISION & GLASS
 
Our Team Members Drive Us! Gerber Collision & Glass is one of the largest collision repair companies in North America. With $2+ billion in sales, over 800 locations and growing, our 10,000+ team members across the United States and Canada are passionate about delivering our goal to WOW Every Customer and Be the Best! 
 
We invite you to join our team. Gerber offers a great place to launch and grow careers. As we continue to grow, we have endless opportunities for you to grow with us. 
 
Gerber Collision & Glass recognizes, values and welcomes all applicants with unique talents and abilities from all backgrounds and characteristics. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply, including individuals with disabilities and Protected Veterans.
 

Job Description:

The Senior Business Analyst - Operations will play a pivotal role in streamlining our operations within the automobile industry. This role involves analyzing and interpreting complex data sets, working closely with cross-functional teams, and driving efficiency throughout our production and operational processes. As a trusted advisor, you will help inform decision-making through insightful analysis, forecasting, and operational strategy development.

Responsibilities

  • Operational Analysis: Analyze current operational process, identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement, and recommend strategies to achieve operational excellence.

  • Data Interpretation: Gather and interpret data related to production, supply chain, and distribution, translating complex findings into understandable insights and actionable recommendations.

  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with departments such as Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Quality Assurance, and R&D to ensure alignment of operational strategies.

  • Forecasting: Use historical data and industry trends to forecast production needs, potential bottlenecks, and operational challenges.

  • Process Improvement: Collaborate with the operations team to design and implement new processes, ensuring they efficient, scalable, and align with the company's strategic goals.

  • Technology Integration: Partner with the IT department to recommend and implement technological solutions that can enhance operational efficiency.

  • Reporting: Create regular reports showcasing operational performance, challenges, and opportunities, presenting findings to senior management.

  • Training & Support: Guide operational teams on the implementation of new processes, or tools, providing training and ongoing support.

  • Risk Management: Identify potential operational risks and develop mitigation strategies.

  • Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in the automobile industry, ensuring our operations remain competitive.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Operations Management, or related field.

  • 5+ years of experience in a business analyst role, preferably within the automobile or manufacturing industry.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.

  • Proficiency in data analytics tools and software.

  • In-depth knowledge of the automobile industry's operations and best practices.

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

  • Ability to collaborate with multiple teams and stakeholders at all levels.

Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. 

The physical demands of your job must be met to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the job.

Benefits That Drive Your Success
Gerber offers the comprehensive benefits you expect from an industry leader, including:

  • Annual Paid Time Off (PTO) plans
  • 2 weeks of Paid Parental Leave for Full time Employees who work a minimum of 30 hours per week
  • 6 paid holidays annually
  • Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Insurance effective Day 1
  • 401(k) Retirement Plan with company match
  • Employer Paid Short-Term Disability & Life Insurance
  • Additional Voluntary Life Insurance
  • Continuing Education Opportunities
  • Free Prescription or Non-Prescription Safety Glasses annually
  • Annual Voluntary Uniform Stipend

Gerber Collision & Glass is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, pregnancy, genetic information, creed, marital status, or any other consideration, prohibited by law or by contract.

About Us
Gerber Collision & Glass has been WOWing customers with our collision repair services for over 80 years. Please visit gerbercareers.com to learn more about our company.

job_information.title: Vendor Master Data Analyst - 3 Month Contract
job_information.job_title_raw: Vendor Master Data Analyst - 3 Month Contract
job_information.description:
Winnipeg, Manitoba

We put our team members first. You’ll receive a great salary and benefits, and experience the support and opportunity you deserve. You’re empowered to make decisions. You control your future.

Job Description:

Please note this will be a 3 month contract role

The Vendor Master Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining the accuracy, integrity, and compliance of supplier information within the company’s financial systems. This role ensures that suppliers are properly onboarded, verified, and maintained according to company and regulatory requirements. The Analyst also supports process improvements, participates in 1099 issuance, and negotiates payment terms and methods with suppliers to optimize efficiency and cash flow

Key Responsibilities

  • Review and process supplier onboarding and maintenance requests, ensuring all required documentation (e.g., W-9s, banking information) is complete, accurate, and compliant with internal controls.

  • Maintain supplier master data across multiple systems (e.g., Workday, Corpay, OnPay, CCC1, ASE), ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and consistency.

  • Negotiate and establish charge accounts, appropriate payment terms and payment methods with suppliers to support company objectives and improve cash flow.

  • Communicate and coordinate with internal stakeholders and suppliers to resolve issues related to supplier setup, payment terms, tax information, or other data discrepancies

  • Support the preparation and issuance of annual 1099 tax forms, ensuring accuracy and compliance with IRS regulations.

  • Identify and analyze data issues, trends, or process gaps and recommend improvements to enhance data quality and operational efficiency.

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.

  • 1–3 years of experience in supplier maintenance, accounts payable, or vendor master data management.

 Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. 

The physical demands of your job must be met to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the job. 

 

AI Disclosure Statement:
At The Boyd Group and all affiliated companies, we do not use artificial intelligence (AI) or automated tools to screen, assess, or select applicants for employment. All hiring decisions are made by real people who review each application individually.

Compensation Details:

18 CAD Hourly

job_information.title: Manager, Technical Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Sommaire du poste

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) gestionnaire et analyste d’entreprise technique qui a un sens stratégique et analytique aiguisé pour diriger nos activités d’analyse d’entreprise tout en mettant à profit ses compétences avancées en matière de données pour accroître l’efficacité et le rendement. La personne titulaire du poste supervisera les processus d’analyse d’entreprise, collaborera avec les parties prenantes, documentera les exigences et veillera à la réussite des projets tout en encadrant une équipe d’analystes. Ce poste est idéal pour quelqu’un qui excelle à établir des liens entre données et valeur opérationnelle, à traduire les analyses en décisions importantes et à gérer les parties prenantes.


Vos futures tâches

  • Diriger, encadrer et former une équipe d’analystes d’entreprise en veillant à l’harmonisation avec les objectifs opérationnels.

  • Collaborer étroitement avec les parties prenantes pour recueillir les exigences, définir les indicateurs clés de performance et orienter la planification et l’exécution.

  • Effectuer des analyses avancées des données, des analyses des tendances et des enquêtes sur les causes fondamentales à l’aide des outils SQL.

  • Collaborer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles, y compris la gestion de produits, l’ingénierie et les unités commerciales.

  • Superviser la collecte, la documentation et l’analyse des exigences opérationnelles et techniques.

  • Traduire les besoins opérationnels en spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées, en récits utilisateurs et en flux de processus.

  • Assurer l’harmonisation entre les solutions technologiques et la stratégie d’affaires.

Expérience nécessaire

  • Excellentes compétences en leadership, en consolidation d’équipe et en gestion des parties prenantes.

  • Expérience dans l’élaboration de cas d’usage, de modèles de cas d’usage, d’exigences supplémentaires et de règles opérationnelles.

  • Solide expérience de travail avec des équipes techniques, du cycle de vie du développement logiciel et de l’intégration de systèmes.

  • Capacité éprouvée à documenter des exigences claires, concises et significatives.

  • Expérience éprouvée du traitement et de l’analyse de grands volumes de données structurées et non structurées provenant de diverses sources (API, fichiers plats, bases de données).

  • Expérience pratique de l’analyse des causes fondamentales par l’exploration approfondie des données afin de cerner les principaux facteurs qui sous-tendent les problèmes et les résultats.

  • Expérience en entreposage de données et en pipelines d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement.

  • Excellente maîtrise de SQL.

  • Excellentes capacités d’analyse et de résolution de problèmes.

Ce qui vous distingue des autres

  • Baccalauréat en administration des affaires, en informatique, en systèmes d’information ou dans un domaine connexe.

  • Au moins 10 ans d’expérience en analyse d’entreprise, dont au moins 2 ans dans un poste de direction.

  • Compétences avancées en langage SQL.

  • Au moins 3 ans d’expérience en analyse de données.

  • Expérience de travail avec les données de crédit.

  • Connaissance pratique des technologies infonuagiques.

Synopsis of the role

We are seeking a strategic and analytically strong Manager, Technical Business Analyst to lead business analysis while applying advanced data skills to drive efficiency and performance. This role will oversee business analysis processes, collaborate with stakeholders, document requirements and ensure successful project execution while mentoring a team of analysts. This role is excellent for someone who excels at connecting data to business value in translating analysis to impactful decisions and managing stakeholders.

What you’ll do

  • Lead, mentor, and develop a team of business analysts, ensuring alignment with business goals.

  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs and deliver insights that guide planning and execution.

  • Conduct advanced data analysis, trend analysis and root cause investigations using SQL tools.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product management, engineering, and business units.

  • Oversee the requirement gathering, documentation, and analysis of business and technical requirements.

  • Translate business needs into detailed functional specifications, user stories, and process flows.

  • Ensure alignment between technology solutions and business strategy.


What experience you need 

  • Excellent leadership, team-building, and stakeholder management skills.

  • Experience developing use cases, use case model, supplementary requirements, and business rules

  • Strong background in working with technical teams, software development lifecycle (SDLC), and system integrations.

  • Proven ability in documenting clear, concise and meaningful requirements.

  • Proven experience in handling and analyzing large volumes of structured and unstructured data from various sources (APIs, flat files, databases)

  • Hands on experience in conducting root cause analysis through deep data exploration uncovering key drivers behind issues/outcome.

  • Experience in Data warehousing and ETL pipelines

  • Strong proficiency in SQL skills

  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.


What could set you apart

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

  • 10+ years of experience in business analysis, with at least 2 years in a leadership role.

  • Advanced SQL skills

job_information.title: Technical Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Synopsis of the role

We are seeking an experienced and highly detail-oriented Technical Business Analyst (BSA) with a strong background in the Financial Sector. This role is critical, acting as the essential bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams. The successful candidate will be responsible for assessing, researching, analyzing, and clearly documenting sponsor/stakeholder needs in accordance with project deliverables, while also gathering requirements, analyzing existing systems, and helping to design compliant technology solutions that align precisely with business objectives. Clear articulation, strong communication skills, and the ability to lead testing efforts are paramount for success in this organized and impactful role.

What you’ll do

  • Develop functional specifications that satisfy client requirements (large scale)

  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs and deliver insights that guide planning and execution.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product management, engineering, and business units.

  • Lead team members and other stakeholders in reviewing and refining requirements. Capture and refine requirements across multi-disciplinary teams

  • Translate business needs into detailed functional specifications, user stories, and process flows.

  • Ensure alignment between technology solutions and business strategy.

  • Actively address issues; setting priorities when appropriate

  • Lead production deployment planning

  • Guide and mentor junior business analysts

  • Serve as lead for system validations, running demos, and managing stakeholder expectations on delivery

  • Serve as SME for ongoing stakeholder support with applications

  • Understand best practice methodologies for providing solutions

  • Cloud Certification Strongly Preferred

What experience you need

  • MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field 

  • 7 to 10 years of related experience

  • Diverse technology / program management background

  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects end to end, keeping stakeholders updated and engaged throughout

  • Cloud Certification Strongly Preferred

What could set you apart

An ability to demonstrate successful performance of our Success Profile skills, including:

  • Analytical Thinking - Applies data and a new perspective on existing solutions to solve complex problems, analyzing multiple sources of information; Makes decisions within guidelines and policies that impact a range of customer, operational, process, or other activities

  • Automation - Effectively cascades suggestions to others, ensures ongoing research is done to better our internal process aligned to external similar markets; Leverages influence to share and create buy-in on new ideas to improve analytic practices

  • Project Management - Effectively oversees development schedules, keeping to timelines, and has oversight and weighs in on the quality of deliverables and supporting documentation; Proactively shares updates and insights with appropriate stakeholders; Proactively plans, organizes and engages appropriate resources for project successes, addresses inefficiencies and holds project participants accountable

  • Quality Control - Understands & supports the definition of Equifax's quality standards; Manages quality improvement efforts and quality control efforts for the business, updating, educating and information appropriate stakeholders where needed

  • Systems Thinking - Provide oversight and guidance for agile planning cadences;  Collaborate with stakeholders to develop the delivery plan (timelines, resources, etc.);  Responsible for workforce planning and capacity planning

CAN-Montreal

job_information.title: Technical Business Analyst Lead
job_information.description:
Job Description:

Toppan Merrill is a global technology leader committed to simplifying the complexity of regulatory disclosure and communications. We offer the most intuitive end-to-end SaaS platform for complex compliant content creation and enhancement of multi-stakeholder collaboration. Our industry leading technology is backed by what we are best known for: unmatched market expertise and unparalleled customer service. Toppan Merrill is a leading partner for the financial, legal, health and capital markets.

We believe in high-trust collaboration and value each person's unique skills, perspectives and experiences. Our success is driven by our world-class global teams and culture. 

Learn more at https://www.toppanmerrill.com/careers/.  About Toppan Merrill

About the Opportunity:

Toppan Merrill is hiring a Lead Technical Business Analyst to oversee a growing team of experiences BA’s in our product and engineering organization.  This position is responsible for strategic problem solving, stakeholder engagement and long-term continuity planning for a broad portfolio of internal products and digital solutions.  

Job Responsibilities:

  • Serve as a strategic problem-solver, taking ambiguous business and technical challenges from concept to actionable solutions.
  • Conduct comprehensive research and analysis to identify potential solution paths, evaluate trade-offs, and recommend optimal approaches.
  • Lead vendor engagement processes, including RFP development, vendor evaluation, and selection for enterprise technology solutions.
  • Assess and mitigate business continuity risks across critical software and vendor relationships; develop strategies for build, buy, acquire, or alternate vendor options.
  • Provide leadership and mentorship to a team of Technology Business Analysts, supporting career growth, performance management, and day-to-day engagement.
  • Collaborate with senior stakeholders and leadership to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements and solution frameworks.
  • Navigate complex enterprise environments, leading through influence and fostering alignment across cross-functional teams.
  • Maintain high-level technical literacy to evaluate integration patterns, architectures, and emerging technologies without requiring deep coding expertise.
  • Support organizational initiatives in data platform development and AI adoption; bring familiarity with big data concepts and product-oriented thinking.
  • Drive early-stage project efforts, operating as a mini-project leader to organize workstreams and deliver progress without formal mandates.

Skill Requirements:

  • 10+ years of professional experience as a technical business analyst
  • Proven ability to operate within large, matrixed organizations and navigate complex stakeholder environments.
  • Experience managing and mentoring senior-level analysts; ability to handle hiring, performance reviews, and career development.
  • Strong understanding of system integration patterns, APIs, and architectural concepts; ability to engage in technical conversations at a high level.
  • Skilled at translating business needs into technical solutions and influencing decisions without formal authority.
  • Ability to lead initiatives from concept to execution, including vendor selection and early-stage project planning.
  • Exceptional ability to engage with senior stakeholders and present recommendations clearly.
  • Background in product management or exposure to product development processes.
  • Familiarity with big data platforms, data architecture, and AI-driven solutions.
  • Experience running RFPs and negotiating with vendors.
  • Prior involvement in business continuity planning for technology solutions.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to ambiguity.

We understand that your skills deserve recognition. That's why we offer a competitive pay scale ranging from $115-135k annually, based on experience and expertise. We believe in compensating our dedicated team members fairly for their hard work and commitment. Please note that actual salaries may vary within, above, or below this range based on factors such as education, training, experience, professional achievement, business needs, and location.

Toppan Merrill strives to provide our employees and loved ones with competitive benefits including:

  • Enhanced Medical, Dental, Vision and Life insurance for employees and dependents
  • Employer Contribution to retirement plan
  • Paid time off including vacation, sick, community involvement, bereavement, jury duty, and holidays.
  • Paid parental leave
  • Paid community involvement/volunteer days
  • Wellness Resources and Employee Assistance Programming

Toppan Merrill is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Qualified individuals, including qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans, are encouraged to apply.

Job Summary

Working within the Project Management Office in a dynamic environment, the Business Analyst is responsible for understanding supply chain and logistics management needs (procurement, warehousing, distribution center, and transportation) and exploring potential solutions, taking into account best practices and various constraints. They actively participate in the project lifecycle: analysis, presentations, planning, implementation, training, and operational support. They collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams (IT, Operations, Procurement, Compliance) to deliver projects involving multiple stakeholders.

  • Assist in the deployment and execution of tasks to deliver projects within defined timelines
  • Prepare and deliver user training
  • Provide post-implementation support
  • Contribute to other team members’ projects based on requirements and priorities
  • Perform any other related tasks
  • Support large-scale project deployments

Job Requirements

  • Ability to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines
  • Ability to adapt quickly to change and work under pressure with stakeholders from various levels and departments
  • Attention to detail and thoroughness in task execution
  • Customer service orientation and ability to understand internal client challenges
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn IT systems

job_information.job_title_raw: Business Analyst, Replenishment (1 year contract) (Mont-Royal, QC)
job_information.description:
Job Summary

As a member of the Replenishment team, the Replenishment Business Analyst will be responsible for working with stakeholders in Replenishment, as well as other teams across the organization. The incumbent will produce scheduled and ad hoc reports to help analyze many aspects of the business and to identifying gaps and potential improvements. The Analyst will work closely with the SAP Functional Analysts to document, help develop solutions, and support all implementations required by the Replenishment team. In addition, the Business Analyst will carry out various analysis related to replenishment and sales performance of different product categories, as well as develop new management tools and reports.

 

This position is to replace a 1 year maternity leave contract. 

Key Accountabilities

  • Generate reports to provide visibility for product flows, inventory, lead times, etc; 
  • Review sales and inventory forecasts at article and company levels;
  • Use sound judgments to analyze results (versus historical and/or forecast) and provide explanations;
  • Create business requirements for new solutions and reports in SAP and FileMaker, support development, test results, and support implementation;
  • Identify opportunities to enhance processes and reporting capabilities within SAP;
  • Maintain process documentation to ensure it is up to date, visible and always available;
  • Collaborate with other areas of the company to ensure that processes associated with Replenishment align with processes in other sectors;
  • Create ad hoc analysis and reports in support of replenishment business issues. 

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Industrial Engineering, Business or equivalent;
  • Two (2) years minimum of related experience; 
  • Experience in product/retail environment is a definite asset;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills combined with a keen attention to detail;
  • Proficiency in the development of MS Excel spreadsheets and a good working knowledge of MS Word and PowerPoint;
  • Able to deal with ambiguity and navigate in a fast-paced environment; and
  • Knowledge of SAP and Alteryx, an asset.

We thank all interested applicants. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted by our recruitment team.
