job_information.title: Business Analyst II, OPL
job_information.description:
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.


Our employee promise represents Intact’s commitment to you in exchange for living our Values, striving to do your best work, being open to change and investing in your career. In return, we promise to provide support, opportunities and performance-led financial rewards at a workplace where you can shape the future, win as a team and grow with us.

Pay at Intact is about much more than just salary.

  • Flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work model

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • Multiple benefits offered to support physical and mental wellbeing, including telemedicine, Wellness account and much more

  • Share plan & other savings: up to 12% of salary or even more (ask how you could earn guaranteed income for life)

Salary range (but not limited to):

74,800 - 91,400

Annual bonus target, based on the base salary, with a potential payout of up to double the target (subject to personal and company performance):

7.5%

As part of our commitment to Win As A Team, we share our success with employees through our annual bonus plan and Employee Share Purchase Plan (ESPP) – with Intact matching 50% of your net shares.

Our pension offerings provide flexibility and long-term security for our employees beyond their careers. We are one of the few companies offering the opportunity to receive guaranteed income for life via our defined benefit pension plan.

Salary for the candidate will be determined taking into consideration a number of factors including: experience, skills, qualifications, anticipated contribution to role, internal equity, etc. The salary range presented above is based on a 35-hour workweek and would represent a majority of different candidate profiles. However, we encourage candidates who may fall outside of this range to apply as well.


About the role

We are seeking a versatile and high-performing Business Analyst (Level II or Senior level, depending on experience) to drive the evolution of our Trade Credit division. While a primary focus will be leading the transition to our new underwriting system, this role serves as a central pillar for all Trade Credit initiatives.

You will act as the primary liaison between business stakeholders and IT, ensuring that objectives for the transition and all subsequent operational projects are met with precision. This position requires a strong background in Project Management, as you will be responsible for tracking milestones, managing scope, and providing consistent visibility to the Trade Credit Operations Manager.

What You’ll Do Here

  • System Transition Leadership: Lead requirements  to migrate business units to the new underwriting platform; document functional specifications and ensure the solution meets ROI goals.

  • Project Management & Reporting: Act as the primary point of contact for the Trade Credit Operations Manager, providing consistent status updates, risk assessments, QA testing, and progress reports on all active projects.

  • Operational Support: Beyond the system transition, provide ongoing BA support for diverse operational needs, process improvements, and ad-hoc business initiatives within the Trade Credit department.

  • Stakeholder Synthesis: Facilitate sessions with national stakeholders to seek consensus on differing interests, manage priorities, and remove roadblocks to keep teams on plan.

  • End-to-End Analysis: Analyze complex data sources to provide actionable recommendations; create guides and visual documentation to bridge the gap between IT and business users.

  • Quality & Change Management: Identify change and provide QA during test planning and execution to ensure the integrity of the Trade Credit systems and workflows.

What You Bring to the Table

  • Minimum 5 to 7 years of relevant experience.

  • Proven experience with SaaS is required.

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or any combination of equivalent education and experience.

  • Project Management Expertise: A strong background in Project Management is required. You must be comfortable managing timelines, dependencies, and reporting structures.

  • Trade Credit Knowledge: Experience in Trade Credit insurance, Underwriting systems, or the broader insurance industry is a significant asset.

  • Analytical Skills: Highly developed problem-solving skills with the ability to manage multiple files and initiatives simultaneously.

  • Language:  Bilingualism (English/French) is required. Need to interact on a regular basis with English-speaking clients and colleagues across the country.

  • Technical Proficiency:

    • Experience in Functional Analysis and Business Process Review..

    • Advanced skills in Excel, Power BI and other project systems.
       

Key Competencies

  • Adaptability: Ability to pivot between high-level system transition strategy and day-to-day operational BA tasks.

  • Communication: Exceptional ability to integrate complex information for executive reporting.

  • Autonomy: A self-starter who takes initiative and can drive projects forward with minimal supervision.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, our Value of respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength. We strive to create an accessible workplace where employees feel valued, included and encouraged to share their unique perspectives.

We encourage applications from individuals who are members of equity-deserving groups, including but not limited to women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, Black people, and members of the 2SLGBTQI+ community.

As part of Intact’s commitment to reconciliation, we acknowledge that we work, meet and travel across the land currently called Canada, originally inhabited by First Nations, Metis and Inuit people. This history extends through many centuries and continues to evolve today.

We have policies to ensure equal access and participation for people with disabilities, including providing workplace adjustments (accommodations). A copy of applicable policies is available on request.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our recruitment process and your candidate journey here.

Please note that Intact does not provide sponsorship or other support for immigration-related matters including but not limited to employer-specific closed work permits. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada from the anticipated start date and throughout their employment and are solely responsible for maintaining their work eligibility.

job_information.job_title_raw: Senior Business Analyst, Finance and Data Transformation
job_information.description:
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.


Our employee promise represents Intact’s commitment to you in exchange for living our Values, striving to do your best work, being open to change and investing in your career. In return, we promise to provide support, opportunities and performance-led financial rewards at a workplace where you can shape the future, win as a team and grow with us.

About the role

We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst with experience in financial systems, specifically with a transactional data warehouse, to join our Business Data & Design team!

Under the vice-presidency of the finance, transformation, and systems team, the Senior Business Analyst will be part of one of the teams that collaborate to deliver both large projects and small improvements. We are looking for a candidate who understands the business, financial, and IT aspects of the requirements. In addition to understanding the impacts on financial systems, this person will lead the design and delivery stages of initiatives end-to-end. Our team is responsible for the requirements for transactional data warehouses, so the analyst must have a comprehensive understanding across topics such as policies, claims, expenses, IBNR, etc. Documenting data integration, their transformation, and optimizing data flows in financial systems are our daily tasks.

What you’ll do here:

  • Lead or support requirement gathering meetings with finance or technical advisors and translate them into clear documentation.

  • Conduct data queries, perform data analysis, challenge requirements, and find solutions to integrate new data flows or update existing ones.

  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop, design, and document data integration and transformation solutions to meet business requirements.

  • Present in peer reviews, executive meetings, or to technical experts to identify the best solutions and thus deliver functional requirements for development.

  • Track progress, list work to be done, meet deadlines, and update the work management tool accordingly.

  • Deliver expected results to business and technical stakeholders to meet testing requirements.

  • Support the testing team in certain validations and preparing data.

What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems management, business intelligence, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

  • Studies/minor in finance or accounting are considered a plus.

  • Minimum of 8 years of relevant experience as a business analyst for a finance team and/or financial systems.

  • Excellent communication skills to gather clear and complete requirements, synthesize them, and present them to colleagues and executives.

  • Strong understanding of ETL principles, data elements, data structures, and data modeling.

  • Knowledge of databases, financial, IT systems, and technologies (data warehouse, SQL, SAS, ETL tools, ERP systems like Oracle, SAP, etc.).

  • Proficient use of Office 365, Excel, Visio, Jira, RDBMS (e.g., Toad, MS SQL server).

  • CPA designation and IFRS17 experience are considered an asset.

  • Knowledge of the P&C insurance industry is a major asset.

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Strong analytical skills, insight, and discipline.

  • Leadership skills, team spirit, independent and effective.

  • Ability to interact with a variety of people at all levels of the organization, including management and some external contributors.

  • No work experience in Canada is required but must have the authorization to work in Canada.

  • Bilingualism (French and English) - Requires regular interaction with colleagues across the country.

#LI-Hybrid

What we offer
 

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our National Large Loss Claims team to lead the analysis and delivery of projects, oversee risk and compliance functions, and own Large Loss reporting.

 

This role is a key player in a small team that is highly visible because it supports a wider group, requiring strategic planning and execution.  It has a broad scope of responsibility, often requiring you to make decisions and manage multiple moving parts of an initiative or governance.

 

What you’ll do here

  • Analyze information obtained from various sources, detail the high-level view and provide users with recommendations.  This is applicable to project work and recurring data analysis supporting operations.

  • Produce business cases for proposed future projects or initiatives.

  • Owner of the Large Loss reporting which includes weekly, monthly, and quarterly data collection and validation for circulation.

  • Co-ordinator of the Global Large Loss forum, an internal group of representatives from the countries where Intact operates, seeking to further collaboration.

  • Coach junior members of the team with their risk and compliance tasks.

  • Utilise your analytical skills to identify opportunities for process optimization, automation, cost reduction, or risk mitigation.

  • Collaborate closely with our Project Manager on large group initiatives.

  • Plan and co-ordinate project activities related to organizational requirements or changes.

  • Obtain requirements or document business processes from business communities using techniques such as interview and work sessions, using defined templates.

  • Act as an intermediary between immediate team and colleagues in neighbouring teams to support in the delivery of initiatives and events.

What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, or any equivalent combination of education and more than 5 years of experience.

  • A minimum of two years of claims insurance experience considered an asset.

  • Demonstrated analytical skills facilitating problem solving, time and priority management.

  • Must have demonstrated initiative and autonomy.

  • Client oriented.

  • Team spirit.

  • Good knowledge of Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.  Knowledge of PowerBI considered an asset.

  • For candidates located in Quebec, bilingualism is required considering the necessity to interact on a regular basis with English-speaking colleagues across the country.

job_information.job_title_raw: IT Business Analyst Senior, AI projects
job_information.description:
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.


Our employee promise represents Intact’s commitment to you in exchange for living our Values, striving to do your best work, being open to change and investing in your career. In return, we promise to provide support, opportunities and performance-led financial rewards at a workplace where you can shape the future, win as a team and grow with us.

Pay at Intact is about much more than just salary.

  • Flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work model

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • Multiple benefits offered to support physical and mental wellbeing, including telemedicine, Wellness account and much more

  • Share plan & other savings: up to 12% of salary or even more (ask how you could earn guaranteed income for life)

Salary range (but not limited to):

94,200 - 115,200

Annual bonus target, based on the base salary, with a potential payout of up to double the target (subject to personal and company performance):

12%

As part of our commitment to Win As A Team, we share our success with employees through our annual bonus plan and Employee Share Purchase Plan (ESPP) – with Intact matching 50% of your net shares.

Our pension offerings provide flexibility and long-term security for our employees beyond their careers. We are one of the few companies offering the opportunity to receive guaranteed income for life via our defined benefit pension plan.

Salary for the candidate will be determined taking into consideration a number of factors including: experience, skills, qualifications, anticipated contribution to role, internal equity, etc. The salary range presented above is based on a 35-hour workweek and would represent a majority of different candidate profiles. However, we encourage candidates who may fall outside of this range to apply as well.


About the role

We are seeking a Senior IT Business Analyst to join our growing AI team!

What you'll do here: 

  • Lead/participate in business requirements workshops to define IT solutions.

  • Work closely with the product manager/stakeholders to realize the product vision.

  • Conduct impact analyses and effort estimates to recommend, secure approval for, and then document the IT solution using effective methods, interacting with both business-domain users and the IT project team.

  • Support the development of solutions and the technical analyses performed.

  • Support quality assurance activities and acceptance testing.

  • Support the product manager in defining and prioritizing the product backlog.

  • Document user stories in a way that they are clearly understood by developers and the QA team.

  • Build and maintain functional documentation that is robust, accurate, and accessible to all company stakeholders.

  • Play a key communications role, acting as a bridge between external stakeholders (architects, business analysts, infrastructure, etc.) and the team.

  • Work with the Scrum Master to ensure cohesion in the team process.

  • Follow end-to-end data access request processes.

What you bring to the table: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, architecture, computer science, or equivalent.

  • At least 8 years of relevant experience as a functional analyst.

  • Strong technical understanding of the development lifecycle (MLOps, UI, backend APIs, etc.).

  • Relevant experience in artificial intelligence projects.

  • Comfortable working in complex environments and multidisciplinary teams.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Knowledge of an Agile framework or methodology (Scrum, Kanban).

  • Bilingualism (French and English) - Need to interact regularly with colleagues from across the country.

  • No Canadian work experience required however must be eligible to work in Canada.

job_information.title: Business Analyst, EDI
job_information.description:
Sunrise Farms is a group of companies with primary focus in the poultry industry.
From our hatcheries to our “ready to eat” state of the art cooking facilities we service customers in the retail, food service and industrial sectors. We are proud of our support of the Canadian farm as well as our investment in the latest equipment and technologies at our facilities across Canada. Our test kitchens have the most current cooking equipment replicating that used in commercial establishments, to facilitate precision testing. This way you know the product you receive will perform to your expectations. We are proud of our long-standing partnerships with family-owned Canadian chicken farmers to produce high quality products.

Role:

We are seeking a versatile and analytical professional who will start by supporting and maintaining our Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and operational systems, and will transition after ~16 months into a Business Analyst supporting transformation projects.
In the initial phase, this role focuses on recurring EDI tasks, monitoring and resolving integration issues, and performing root‑cause analysis. As our systems evolve, the role shifts into a Business Analyst position working closely with Manufacturing, Sales, Finance, and other operational groups on initiatives such as QMS implementation, CRM, IoT integration, M&A onboarding, and process optimization.
This is a strong opportunity for someone who enjoys solving problems, learning new systems, and acting as a bridge between business users and technical teams.


Role: We are seeking a versatile and analytical professional who will start by supporting and maintaining our Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and operational systems, and will transition after ~16 months into a Business Analyst supporting transformation projects. As our systems evolve, the role shifts into a Business Analyst position working closely with Manufacturing, Sales, Finance, and other operational groups on initiatives such as QMS implementation, CRM, IoT integration, M&A onboarding, and process optimization. job_information.title: Business Analyst, Warranty
job_information.description:
At Trisura, we expect more because we believe it can be done better.

 

We are a young, growth oriented team with a commitment to exceptional talent and have been named one of Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers since 2017. Our growth and our entrepreneurial style, niche market position and development opportunities ensure that our people see the results of their commitment reflected in the company’s success.

 

We are currently seeking a qualified individual to join the dedicated, forward-thinking Trisura Warranty Services  team in our downtown Toronto office.

 

 

BUSINESS ANALYST, WARRANTY – TORONTO

 

 

As part of the Warranty Services team, the successful candidate will be primarily responsible for processing and reconciling dealer remittances, generate monthly production reports, claims reports, accounts payable, and accounts receivable reports, and perform administrative functions such as dealer activations, cancellations and transfers.

 

 

What does our Trisura Warranty Services Department do?

 

Our Trisura Warranty Services Department provides superior protection in the automotive and powersports space by offering innovative, customized Warranty Programs which include mechanical breakdown protection and guarantee asset protection (GAP) products specifically designed to meet the needs, requirements and challenges faced by our Clients.

 

 

Our Clients fall into two broad categories:

 

  • Dealers who offer warranties and insurance policies and
  • Agents who administer Warranty Programs;

 

 

As an integral member of the team, you will bring:

 

  • Strong attention to detail in all areas of work
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with individuals, internally and externally, at all levels of the organization
  • Ability to innovate and adapt to continuous process improvement initiatives
  • Good knowledge of basic accounting concepts
  • Efficiency working as a part of a team, or independently, as required
  • Proven organizational skills, and strong time-management abilities
  • High level of personal integrity, strong work ethic and initiative

 

 

Accountabilities:

 

  • Process and reconcile Dealer remittances
  • Ensure timely processing of monthly reports
  • Prepare invoices based on monthly production files
  • Compile Agent statements and accounts payable
  • Reconcile current accounts due to Trisura, Agents and Dealer statements
  • Respond to Client inquiries via email and telephone
  • Setup and support Dealer and Agent network with inquiries and system configuration, such as Dealer sign-ups, remittance challenges, accounts payables and receivables
  • Ensuring compliance and agreements are in good order
  • Work effectively and efficiently with team members to resolve Client and system issues

 

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Advanced Proficiency in MS Excel including experience with Formulae, Pivot Tables, Lookup and Financial functions.
  • 2+ years cumulative experience in business role
  • University Degree in Business; Accounting concentration preferred
  • System Management experience is an asset
  • Basic formatting and marketing skills are an asset
  • Experience using MS Access or another relational database

 

 

Compensation:

 

  • The expected compensation in this position is within the range of $65,000 - $85,000

 

This posting does not correspond to an existing vacancy but is part of our proactive recruitment efforts

 

 

#LI-Hybrid

 

 

 

If you are looking for a career in an exciting and rewarding company, are driven to excel, thrive in a team environment and want to contribute to the success of an organization that values your contribution, we would like to hear from you!

We are committed to an inclusive and barrier-free workplace that reflects the diversity in each of our offices across Canada. Accommodations will be provided on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of our recruitment and selection process.

We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Trisura, headquartered in the heart of Canada’s financial district, is a specialty lines insurer with a focus on Surety, Specialty Insurance, Property & Casualty, and Warranty products.
 
Trisura brings innovative solutions and expertise through a select network of both national and regional brokerage firms. 
 
The company, founded in 2006, and operating across North America with offices in Toronto, Ottawa, Halifax, Montréal, Calgary, Vancouver, Stamford. Denver, Chicago, Philadelphia and Oklahoma City, is uniquely positioned to satisfy all varieties of risk in Contract, Commercial and Developer Surety, Directors' and Officers' Liability, Fidelity, and Professional Liability including Media Liability, as well as Warranty products.

Location:  Regina, SK

Overview:

Charter is seeking an experienced Business Analyst for a 14-month engagement beginning April 2026. The successful candidate will bring 8+ years of BA experience on large scale IT projects, bridging business needs and IT solutions, gathering and documenting requirements, mapping processes, creating test-plans, tracking issues/problems to resolution and facilitating cross-functional workshops.  Ideally you have developed process and workflows for compliance programs (e.g. HIPA, PCI-DSS, NERC CIP). Previous experience working in SCADA/Industrial Control System environments is an asset. Active Business Analyst certifications (i.e., CBAP, PMI-PBA) are required.

Location: Regina, SK (onsite). Term: 14 months.  

 

Qualifications and Experience:

  • 8+ years of experience as a Business Analyst on large scale IT projects, bridging business needs and IT solutions, gathering and documenting requirements, mapping processes, creating test-plans, tracking issues/problems to resolution and facilitating cross-functional workshops.
  • Experience developing process and workflows for compliance programs (e.g. HIPA, PCI-DSS, NERC CIP).
  • Previous experience working in SCADA/Industrial Control System environments is an asset.

Our Company:

Charter is an award-winning Canadian IT Solutions and Managed Services Provider founded in 1997. With offices nationwide, Charter offers innovative IT solutions, managed services, project delivery, and consulting. Our mission is to align people, processes, and technologies to enhance communication, boost performance, and modernize businesses. Using a business architecture methodology and human-centered design, we drive successful digital transformations, unlock new opportunities, and promote growth. Join our team! Forward, Together.www.charter.ca

We are seeking a Bilingual (French & English) Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team in Canada. French language proficiency is mandatory. job_information.title: Business Analyst - Client Experience
job_information.description:
About Citco:

The market leader. The premier provider. The best in the business. At Citco, we’ve been the front-runner in our field since our incorporation in 1948 led to the evolution of the asset servicing sector itself. This pioneering spirit continues to guide us today as we innovate and expand, push beyond the boundaries of our industry, and shape its future. From working exclusively with hedge funds to serving all alternatives, corporations and private clients, our organization has grown immensely across asset classes and geographies. For us, this progress is a pattern that we’ll only maintain as we move forward, always prioritizing our performance. So for those who want to play at the top of their game and be at the vanguard of their space, we say: Welcome to Citco.

Responsibilities

About the Team:

The Client Experience (CX) team is responsible for developing and collaboratively implementing our comprehensive strategy to continually enhance Citco’s client capabilities. Leading with a human-centered design mindset and a native-digital approach, these capabilities drive and enable Citco to design and deliver a positive and seamless client experience tailored for all clients across all touchpoints. The CX team works collaboratively across all global lines of business, partnering with business leaders and clients to identify needs, solutions, and value creation opportunities for stakeholders.

The business analyst will be responsible for working closely with business users, IT staff, department managers, and the project team to gather system requirements and document system specifications for CX roadmap initiatives. The business analyst is also responsible for assisting project management, development, testing, training, and support teams.

This role reports to the CX Senior Program Manager.

Your Role:

  • Work with the business staff, technology staff, and all relevant project resources to produce comprehensive requirements and detailed specifications for existing and new functionality, interfaces, and reports. Analyze enhancement requests, defects and other issues, translating them into professional specifications.
  • Represent the business in documenting, communicating, and prioritizing agreed requirements with the project team.
  • Gather and document requirements and specify solutions to complex business challenges, working with the business and/or project team, via new solutions and/ or by leveraging or extending an existing suite of solution components.
  • Develop a detailed understanding of planned and existing solution components.
  • Work with the development and project teams to determine solution effort, in order to represent options and costs within the project plan.
  • Assist the QA and UAT testing groups by providing direction & support for User Acceptance Testing, creation of test cases, and test plan creation.
  • Document outstanding current state issues into summary format for communication to the user group and project team for prioritization and subsequently to Steering Committees and project sponsors for approval of priorities. Maintain the repository of enhancement requests and issues & bugs while recording status and monitoring prioritization changes and incorporation into project planning.
  • Lead demonstrations with business, support, and training groups within the project for new and improved applications, communicate detailed descriptions of functionality changes and provide follow-up support as required.
  • Develop and maintain a working knowledge of business rules and documentation of business processes as they pertain to the business applications to ensure accuracy, consistency, legal compliance, and data integrity.
  • Some travel may be required.

  • Proficient in JIRA, Confluence, MS Project, Excel.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Experience in the asset management industry is beneficial.
  • Previous experience working with IT development teams, ideally in a SCRUM environment.
  • Knowledge and experience with CRM solutions.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, complex IT environment.
  • Highly self-motivated, energetic, strong work ethic and results-oriented with the ability to inspire performance excellence in distributed teams.

 

Salary Range: CAD $77,000 - 93,000

job_information.title: Global Payroll Transformation Business Analyst
job_information.description:
About Citco 

Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 50 office locations worldwide. With more than $1.8 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients’ needs.  

For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com  

About the Team & Business Line:  

Proprietary software solutions and innovation are at the core of what differentiates Citco in the alternative investment space. Through our network of global development centres, Citco invests heavily in technology development, security, and infrastructure to ensure our clients continue to receive award-winning products that underpin our commitment to service excellence.  

We're seeking a strategic HRIS Business Analyst to join our Oracle Cloud HCM Application Support Team, championing Citco's global payroll digital transformation initiative. As a key member of the team, you'll architect and deliver a best-in-class, unified payroll ecosystem leveraging Oracle HCM as the enterprise backbone. Reporting to the VP of HR Business Analysis, you'll drive global process harmonization, multi-vendor ecosystem consolidation, and end-to-end HRIS integration. This role offers the opportunity to lead business process reengineering efforts that will transform our global payroll operations through enterprise-scale optimization and continuous improvement methodology.  

Responsibilities

Your Role:  

Strategic Project Implementation 

  • Drive the implementation of our global payroll transformation strategy, focusing on: 
  • Standardization of payroll processes across regions 
  • Integration of multiple payroll vendors with Oracle HCM 
  • Consolidation of payroll systems and vendors 
  • Lead requirements elicitation through workshops, interviews, and documentation reviews 
  • Create and maintain project documentation, including requirements, process flows, and integration specifications 
  • Lead initiatives to consolidate disparate payroll data from multiple global locations into a unified, streamlined structure 
  • Partner with leadership to design and implement a global payroll governance framework, establishing control mechanisms, approval matrices, and standard operating procedures that ensure consistency, compliance, and risk management across operations 

System & Process Optimization 

  • Lead the optimization of Oracle HCM modules to maximize platform utilization aligned with payroll requirements 
  • Identify and implement automation opportunities across the payroll ecosystem 
  • Research and recommend innovative payroll solutions and industry best practices 
  • Drive continuous improvement initiatives through regular process reviews and optimization 
  • Work with Payroll SMEs to design and implement standardized global payroll processes 
  • Optimize employee self-service functionality for payroll 
  • Identify and eliminate redundant processes across regions to create standardized, efficient workflows 
  • Assist in the establishment of modernized best practices for global payroll operations 
  • Lead end-to-end UAT cycles, including test scenario development, script creation, and coordination of testing activities across global teams 
  • Manage UAT documentation, defect tracking, and resolution processes, ensuring thorough validation of system changes and integrations 

Integration & Data Management 

  • Design and implement automated data consolidation processes to merge information from various global payroll and benefits sources into Oracle HCM 
  • Establish global data standards and governance procedures to ensure consistency across regions 
  • Ensure seamless data flow between systems while maintaining data integrity 
  • Develop strategies for consolidating employee compensation data into a single source of truth 
  • Design and implement robust data validation and reconciliation processes 
  • Monitor and optimize integration performance and reliability 

Analytics & Reporting 

  • Support the Reporting team in gathering and documenting reporting requirements from global stakeholders 
  • Collaborate with the Reporting team to ensure data structures and integrations support reporting needs 
  • Participate in testing and validation of reports and dashboards 
  • Provide subject matter expertise on payroll data elements and business logic 
  • Help define and validate payroll KPIs and metrics for global reporting 
  • Ensure data quality and integrity in source systems to enable accurate reporting 

Stakeholder and Change Management 

  • Partner with global stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure solution alignment 
  • Facilitate change management activities related to new processes and systems 
  • Lead training and knowledge transfer sessions for end users 
  • Coordinate with vendors, functional teams, technical teams, and business users to ensure successful implementation 
  • Build consensus among global stakeholders for standardized processes and data management approaches 

Qualifications

About You: 

  • Minimum 6 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with focus on payroll systems and demonstrated success in large-scale payroll transformation projects 
  • Experience with Oracle Cloud HCM payroll modules; related certifications preferred 
  • Deep understanding of global payroll processes, regulations, and compliance requirements 
  • Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools including OTBI, Excel, and experience with system integrations and API technologies 
  • Experience managing vendor relationships and system integration projects 
  • Proven track record in process optimization, change management, and project delivery 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail 
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to influence stakeholders at all levels 
  • Self-motivated professional capable of working independently in a global environment 
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, or related field 
  • Experience managing project workflows and documentation in JIRA and Confluence, including creating and maintaining project spaces, tracking issues, and establishing documentation standards for payroll initiatives 
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities while maintaining quality and accuracy 
  • Track record of building strong relationships across business units and geographies 

 

Salary Range: CAD $68,000 - 101,000

  • This posting is for an existing vacancy

 

Our Benefits 

Your well-being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.  

We recognize diversity as a source of organizational pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.  

Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

job_information.title: Yardi Senior Business Support Analyst - AVP Platform Transformation
job_information.job_title_raw: Yardi Senior Business Support Analyst - AVP Platform Transformation
job_information.description:
About Citco:

The market leader. The premier provider. The best in the business. At Citco, we’ve been the front-runner in our field since our incorporation in 1948 led to the evolution of the asset servicing sector itself. This pioneering spirit continues to guide us today as we innovate and expand, push beyond the boundaries of our industry, and shape its future. From working exclusively with hedge funds to serving all alternatives, corporations and private clients, our organization has grown immensely across asset classes and geographies. For us, this progress is a pattern that we’ll only maintain as we move forward, always prioritizing our performance. So for those who want to play at the top of their game and be at the vanguard of their space, we say: Welcome to Citco.

About the Team & Business Line: 
The Transformation Office strives to create a consistent ability to transform our organization at all times.  By bringing together subject matter expertise across process, platform and line of business, we provide clear direction and governance to change, positioning CFS to continually evolve & scale to the changing market dynamics, to our business demands and to our client needs

As a core member of our Transformation Office, you will be working with some of the industry’s most accomplished professionals to deliver the most effective and efficient solutions for our clients and our business. 
 

The Senior Business Support Analyst will provide day-to-day operational, technical, and analytical support for Private Markets teams leveraging the Yardi and Investran platforms. The Senior Business Support Analyst also provides advanced operational, technical, and analytical support. Serves as escalation point for complex issues and leads cross-functional initiatives. This role requires strong functional knowledge of Private Markets (e.g., Private Equity, Real Estate, Infrastructure), as well as a working understanding of fund accounting principles. The analyst will serve as a liaison between the business and technology teams to ensure accurate, efficient, and scalable platform utilization in support of investment operations, fund administration, and financial reporting.

Responsibilities

Your Role:

As part of the Transformation Office, you will be working as a Senior Business Support Analyst and will provide day-to-day operational, technical, and analytical support for Private Markets teams leveraging the Yardi and Investran platforms. The Senior Business Support Analyst will also provide advanced operational, technical, and analytical support. Serves as escalation point for complex issues and leads cross-functional initiatives. This role requires strong functional knowledge of Private Markets (e.g., Private Equity, Real Estate, Infrastructure), as well as a working understanding of fund accounting principles. The analyst will serve as a liaison between the business and technology teams to ensure accurate, efficient, and scalable platform utilization in support of investment operations, fund administration, and financial reporting.

Your role will consist of the following functions:

•    Act as the primary escalation point for business users regarding issues and inquiries related to Yardi
•    Lead troubleshooting and resolution of complex system issues
•    Oversee system upgrades, patch testing, and platform enhancements
•    Ensure data quality and consistency across platforms
•    Support and review audit processes, regulatory filings (Form PF, AIFMD)
•    Interpret investment performance data, fee structures, and fund hierarchy reporting
•    Model and track fund performance metrics (TVPI, DPI, RVPI)
•    Assist in setup/maintenance of fund chart of accounts, journal entries, GL postings
•    Prepare and verify financial/operational data for audits
•    Deliver training sessions and onboarding for new hires
•    Support month-end/quarter-end close processes
•    Deliver advanced training and documentation
•    Mentor junior staff and facilitate cross-training
•    Collaborate with IT, Product, and Client Onboarding teams on technology projects and process improvements
•    Participate in governance and process optimization initiatives


Any of the above tasks may be requested to be performed across other platforms within the Platform Transformation Office.
 

Qualifications

About You:
You have: 
•    Bachelor or Master Degree in Finance
•    3 + years’ experience in Fund Accounting and FA Systems 
•    5 + years’ experience in Financial Services 
•    Excellent planning, communication and presentation skills 
•    Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
•    Strong inter-personal, negotiation and mediation skills 
•    Ability to multi-task and prioritize amid competing timelines and priorities
•    Strong Analytical skills
•    Proven complex problem resolution

Preferred:

•    Strategic thinking, team leadership, project management, stakeholder engagement, process improvement
•    Professional certification or coursework in accounting or investment operations
•    Experience working in or supporting fund accounting or finance teams
•    Familiarity with reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or SQL-based environment
 

Salary Range: CAD $108,000 - 140,000

  • This posting is for an existing vacancy

Our Benefits

Your well-being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.

We embrace diversity, prioritizing the hiring of people from diverse backgrounds. Our inclusive culture is a source of pride and strength, fostering innovation and mutual respect.

Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst
job_information.description:
Job Summary
Reporting to the Manager, Business Transformation, the Senior Business Analyst will play a key role in supporting SE to achieve overall performance targets and transition to new or improved operational solutions. Working in tandem with Operations, Information Services / Technology and other supporting teams, the Senior BA is responsible for identifying, planning and implementing technology- and process-based solutions in operations.

Job Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering and Stakeholder Engagement

  • Collaborate with operational and technical stakeholders to understand business needs, objectives and use cases.
  • Participate in and facilitate interviews, focus groups, and workflow observations to identify pain points and elicit requirements.
  • Document functional and non-functional requirements for system solutions, ensuring sufficient requirements management and tracking.
  • Maintain business relationships with stakeholders to ensure successful implementations that enable system-wide improvements and sustainability.

 

Data Analysis and Reporting

  • Lead ongoing evaluations of operational processes through the analysis and interpretation of complex data and performance metrics, with the aim of recommending and implementing optimization strategies.
  • Build dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Excel, and others.

 

Process Improvement and Workflow Optimization

  • Map current- and future-state workflows using tools like Visio and others.
  • Identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies in operational processes.
  • Participate in process and quality improvement activities such as FMEA, Value Stream Mapping, and Root Cause Analysis to improve care delivery and reduce waste.

 

Project Leadership

  • Lead the planning, implementation, and execution of strategic operations improvement initiatives 
  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams including administrators, clinicians, technical teams, finance and human resources.
  • Perform project management activities including developing and managing project schedules, managing project communications, and implementing risk mitigation strategies
  • Define key performance indicators to measure the success of initiatives and track data to demonstrate outcomes.
  • Support sustainability planning and ensure a smooth handover to Operations at project closure.

 

Solution Identification and Validation

  • Stay up to date on the latest advancements to automate and modernize systems and processes.
  • Participate in the selection of new / revised software applications, ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
  • Perform quality assurance, including defining the test approach, developing test cases, and executing testing.
  • Support user acceptance testing (UAT) with end-users.
  • Document issues and ensure resolution prior to go-live.
      
     

Training and Change Management

  • Lead and participate in change management planning and execution of identified tactics to support solution implementation.
  • Create training materials and other collateral (e.g., job aids, etc.).
  • Coordinate and facilitate the delivery of training sessions across sites, including evaluation of training effectiveness to identify opportunities and lessons learned.


Qualifications:

  • Degree in Business / Information Systems / Health Sciences or related field with supplemental business education is preferred (equivalent education and experience will be considered)
  • Minimum 3 to 5 years’ business analysis experience
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, including cross-functional communication (experience with group facilitation is preferred)
  • Experience delivering training (in-person and virtual)
  • Certified Business Analysis Profession (CBAP) certification preferred
  • Project Management Profession (PMP) certification preferred
  • Intermediate to advanced skills in MS Office applications 
  • Experience with MicroStrategy, Power BI or other business intelligence tools
  • Strong teamwork orientation and ability to effectively interact with cross-functional teams

 

Why Join SE Health?

  • Competitive Total Rewards: So much more than a paycheque! Enjoy comprehensive benefits, pension, flexible pay options, car-loan support, housing solutions and exclusive staff perks.
  • Flexibility & Belonging: Thrive with hybrid work, flexible scheduling and a supportive, inclusive culture that puts people first.
  • Purpose & Impact: Join a national social enterprise where your voice matters. Every role helps advance health, spark innovation and strengthen communities across Canada.
  • Growth That Meets Your Ambition: Access tuition support, training and meaningful career pathways across a growing, future-focused organization.

About SE Health

SE Health is a not-for-profit social enterprise advancing health with heart. With 115+ years of impact, we bring hope, happiness and exceptional care to people and communities across Canada. We lead with empathy, dignity and purpose while building a future where everyone can realize their full health and well-being potential. We’re also an inclusive, supportive workplace offering competitive compensation, strong benefits and real opportunities to grow. We’re All In Together.

COVID-19: To protect the health of our clients, teams, and communities, all SE Health employees must be fully vaccinated (two doses, 14+ days since the final dose).

Accessibility: If you require accommodations due to illness or disability, please contact Talent Acquisition at careers@sehc.com.

AI and compensation details: We use AI to take notes during our interview.  All applications and interviews are reviewed by our Talent Acquisition team. This role is a new addition. The hiring pay range is $63,000–$78,000 annually, based on experience.

job_information.title: Business Analyst - Capital Markets
job_information.description:
The Business Analyst role is a key role within this team, and will provide leadership and expertise in the following areas:

  • Presenting & explaining existing FNZ capability;

  • Capturing & documenting customer business outcomes to create requirements and solution designs;

  • Systems migration support and consultancy services;

  • Engagement with Financial Markets Infrastructure (FMI) providers (eg CDS, DTCC) regarding integration and compliance;

  • Customer training and knowledge transfer;

  • Analyst & Developer handovers and support;

  • Functional Reviews & BRS walkthroughs;

  • Defect verification and triage.

This role demands individuals who:

  • Are consistently solution & execution focused;

  • Capable of dealing with complex problems & environments;

  • Have strong technology, analytical and data interpretation skills;

  • Take ownership for an outcome on behalf of a customer;

  • Comfortable with high levels of customer, stakeholder interaction & management.

Who we are looking for:

  • Experience in a consulting, business analysis or architecture environment.

  • Equities, Fixed Income and/or Exchange-Traded Options clearing and settlement processes and workflows

  • Experience in broking and custody markets in North America.

  • An understanding of the regulatory environment in the US and Canadian markets.

  • 5+ years of experience in a delivery/consulting environment in the financial services/custody market.

  • 1st class degree or equivalent experience

  • Be able to evidence establishing an environment of continuous improvement and capability development.

  • Confident, and able to take initiative given client– and delivery-focused environment.

  • Good team communication skills, confident in dealing with internal and external clients.

  • Highly developed written and oral communication skills.

What FNZ offers:

  • A competitive base salary, bonus, and paid time off.  
  • FNZ will match pension plan contributions at 150%, up to 4% total Employee Contribution. 
  • Employer-paid medical, dental and vision insurance, and more. 
  • We are mission-led - work at the heart of a purpose-led organization where you can be proud of the impact you make, every day. Where you’ll transform the way over 20 million people invest, making wealth management more accessible, sustainable and transparent to more people.

About FNZ

FNZ is committed to opening up wealth so that everyone, everywhere can invest in their future on their terms. We know the foundation to do that already exists in the wealth management industry, but complexity holds firms back. 

We created wealth’s growth platform to help. We provide a global, end-to-end wealth management platform that integrates modern technology with business and investment operations. All in a regulated financial institution. 

We partner with over 650 financial institutions and 12,000 wealth managers, with US$1.7 trillion in assets under administration (AUA).

Together with our customers, we help over 26 million people from all wealth segments to invest in their future.

job_information.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_information.description:
About the Job
The Lifetime Value Co. is looking for an Analyst to join our growing team to influence strategy and improve decision making throughout the company.
We are looking for self-starters who attack business problems with curiosity and effectively navigate gray space to deliver results. In this remote-friendly role, you will be expected to challenge the status quo and use data to formulate recommendations that improve the business. You must be able to effectively communicate those insights and drive results across the organization, at all levels. The ideal candidate is comfortable working with complex datasets using SQL and BI tools and is thoughtful and creative when solving data problems and designing data visualizations. Our team is driven, passionate, creative, energetic, and fun. We love to challenge each other by asking difficult questions and collaborating to solve problems together.

What You Will Get to Do
  • Influence business and product strategy through data-driven insights
  • Work with the customer service team to analyze and implement business practices to maximize efficiency and quality of customer care.
  • Perform deep-dive analyses on customer service data, specifically telephony and IVR, and translate results into actionable business insights
  • Develop metrics relevant to the customer service areas and help teams to measure results
  • Create compelling visualizations and presentations to help tell the story of the customer experience
  • Present findings and make recommendations to management and stakeholders
  • Design dashboards and reports for partner teams in Looker
  • Create and maintain analytical presentation layers in our SQL database
  • Assist in building and refining models used to drive important business decisions
What You Bring to the Table
  • Bachelor’s degree in STEM, Finance, Economics, behavioral sciences, or similar quantitative field
  • 2+ years of relevant work experience, ideally as an analyst in customer care sector
  • Ability to tell a story using data, make actionable recommendations, and drive changes that improve the business
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and the desire to work with large, complex datasets
  • Strong business judgment and entrepreneurial drive
  • High attention to detail and ability to balance multiple priorities
  • Prior experience using Looker, Excel, Tableau, or other BI tools is preferred
  • Prior experience with subscription-business models, marketing-driven businesses, web analytics, and e-commerce payments are all nice-to-have as well
Why LTV Co.?
If you have ambitions to be a part of a high-growth, results-driven, industry-leading organization, LTV is the place to be. LTV builds exciting data products, and then we market them with passion. We’re a remote-first, fast-growing company with headquarters in New York City that balances the culture of a startup with the stability of being an established, profitable company. We want to work with people who strive to be in the top .01% of their field. We understand that getting to the top takes hard work, constant improvement, and by making data-driven decisions. It’s a thrilling time to join the team, as we’re expanding our product offerings in exciting new ways, driving innovation through data, marketing, and web & app development.
We believe in diversity and hiring people from all backgrounds and walks of life. You must be energetic, inventive, a team player, and looking to help build and grow the company every day. You must have an inner desire to win, and the idea of losing is a non-starter. If you are looking for a position that allows you to work with a group of smart and dedicated people who will support you but still provide the autonomy you need to execute your strategy, then you should probably apply as soon as you’re done reading this!

About Us
LTV was founded in New York by Josh Levy and Ross Cohen in 2007. At the time, their mission was to provide easy and affordable access to public records. Something that in 2007 was only really accessible to corporations. Since then, their mission has expanded to developing products and services that grant access to information and data across a number of verticals. In service of this mission, LTV has 10 consumer brands, including BeenVerified, NumberGuru, PeopleLooker, NeighborWho, Ownerly, PeopleSmart, Bumper, ReversePhone, MoneyBot5000, and Wingmate.
Our mission is to develop a diverse portfolio of technologies, products, and services that give all people equal access to unbiased data and information. We believe that through this access, people can empower and protect themselves in today’s ever-changing world, filled with fake news, deception, and a lack of transparency.

job_information.title: Senior Business Analyst (Calgary South)
job_information.description:
Who we are:

At Trail Appliances, we are committed to providing our customers with unparalleled customer service, competitive pricing, and expert advice. We pride ourselves on our strong family values and collaborative work culture that values respect, integrity, diversity, passion, and laughter. These values have helped us build a reputation as an industry leader.

Is This You?

You are confident in your ability to analyze and understand complex business processes and translate them into effective IT solutions. You are ready to dive deep into business challenges, providing strategic solutions that enhance daily operations and drive continuous improvement. You thrive in a dynamic environment and are excited to be part of a transformational team, embarking on a technological revolution with the opportunity to influence and shape the future of the business.

If you are a collaborative team player with a passion for making a significant impact, and you aspire to be part of a technological journey you can look back on with immense pride, knowing you played a crucial role, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.

The position:

Trail Appliances is seeking an experienced, self-motivated IT Business Analyst to help enhance the systems and processes that support our mission of delivering exceptional service and value to our customers. In this role, you’ll play a key part in shaping technology solutions that strengthen efficiency, enable innovation, and empower our teams to continue building on our reputation as an industry leader rooted in integrity, respect, and collaboration.

This is a hybrid position that requires availability onsite at our Calgary (South) location.

What we offer:

We offer excellent training, competitive benefits, and the support you need to succeed, including mentorship and ongoing growth opportunities. If you're passionate about customer service and looking for more than just a job, apply today to become part of our talented and high-performing team! We provide:

  • Health & dental benefits
  • Personal care days 
  • Statutory holidays off 
  • Employee & family assistance program 
  • Staff incentives and rewards
  • Employee discounts 

 

What you’ll be doing:

  • Gather, analyze, and document business requirements, workflows, and improvement opportunities in collaboration with stakeholders.
  • Design and implement scalable IT solutions aligned with business needs and company objectives.
  • Lead testing and quality assurance activities, including test planning, UAT coordination, and defect tracking.
  • Manage IT projects by developing plans, coordinating cross-functional teams, and monitoring progress to achieve milestones.
  • Provide data analysis, reporting, training, and ongoing support to ensure effective use of IT systems and drive business decisions.

What you need to be successful:

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Business, or a related field, with relevant certifications considered an asset.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Strong knowledge of business processes, IT systems, and project management methodologies (Agile/Waterfall).
  • Proficiency with data analysis, reporting, and project management tools (e.g., Power BI, Excel, JIRA, Visio).
  • Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder relationship skills, with ERP or retail/distribution experience an advantage.

Availability:

This is a full-time position and will require you to be available:
Monday to Friday from 7:00am to 5:00pm. On-call as needed

 

We value diverse perspectives and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. If your skills and experiences align with this role, we encourage you to apply and join us in delivering exceptional service.

job_information.title: Business Analyst, IT
job_information.description:
Salary Range: $100,000 - $115,000

Who we are:

Canaccord Genuity (CG) is a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry:  wealth management and capital markets.  CG is driven by an unwavering commitment to build lasting client relationships – we achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional, and corporate clients through comprehensive wealth management solutions and investment banking services.  We are a leading independent wealth management firm in Canada, and the leading mid-market provider of investment banking advisory, equity research, sales and trading services for corporations and institutions.

We pride ourselves on understanding our clients’ needs and finding innovative, bespoke solutions.  Our entrepreneurial and friendly team will challenge you to learn and grow every day.  We value great work and collaboration and strive to eliminate bureaucratic thinking.  We’re looking for talented people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to have an impact with innovative ideas and best practices.

Come be a part of our Canadian success story and help deliver superior experiences for our clients. At CG, we recognize that diversity across our business strengthens our client relationships and enables more innovative solutions.  We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. CG provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodation throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.

Our Canadian operation, Canaccord Genuity Corp., is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our Business Services team. The Business Analyst role is a key role that will work closely with the various IT teams, business units, and third-party vendors to manage enhancements with focused responsibility on information technology project work. This will require an ability to manage, analyze and synthesize complex system requirements and work with a diverse group of business users and IT team members to develop and implement solutions. The role reports to SVP, Head of Wealth Management Technology.

The ideal candidate will have the ability to communicate effectively in technical and non-technical environments. In addition, the Business Analyst will possess a strong technical background and have a hands-on role in designing solutions. Excellent collaborative and organizational skills are imperative.

Responsibilities

  • Work with stakeholders and IT team members to complete current state analysis and business process redesign;
  • Interface with vendors by providing detailed business and functional requirements, and communicating business knowledge;
  • Lead in testing of system changes and coordinate User Acceptance Testing by creating and executing Test Plans;
  • Liaise with business groups and other IT teams in capturing requirement change requests, identifying business / technical impacts and managing client expectations;
  • Create and maintain system documentation, including operations manuals and team knowledge bases;
  • Build ad-hoc reports and data extracts using SQL.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Completion of a diploma or degree in a technical or business field;
  • Knowledge of the Financial Industry and understanding of brokerage accounting;
  • Ability to organize and document system requirements;
  • Strong technical aptitude and understanding of practical uses of technology to solve business problems;
  • Strong knowledge of SQL Server database with the ability to build queries and analyze raw data.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and facilitation skills and ability to grasp abstract concepts;
  • Experience with Dataphile is considered an asset;
  • Experience with AI or Python is considered an asset;
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail;
  • Projects a mature, professional and optimistic attitude;
  • Ability to set, commit to and meet deadlines;
  • Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing business needs.

#LI-SK1 #LI-Hybrid #INDHP

All applications will be held in strict confidence.

In order to be considered for employment, candidates selected for interviews will be required to show proof of citizenship, permanent residence or eligibility to work in Canada with no restrictions.

Protecting your online safety:

Canaccord Genuity and its affiliates do not use text messages for recruitment purposes. If you have received a text message claiming to be from CG or an authorized representative regarding job recruitment, please treat as fraudulent and do not respond.

We wish to thank all candidates for their interest but only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please. Thank you for your understanding.

job_information.description:
Salary Range: $80/hour – $90/hour

Who we are:

Canaccord Genuity (CG) is a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry: wealth management and capital markets.  CG is driven by an unwavering commitment to building lasting client relationships – we achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional, and corporate clients through comprehensive investment solutions, brokerage, and investment banking services.  We are the leading independent wealth management firm in Canada, and the leading mid-market provider of investment banking advisory, equity research, sales and trading services for corporations and institutions.  

We pride ourselves on understanding our clients’ needs and finding innovative, tailored solutions.  Our entrepreneurial and friendly team will challenge you to learn and grow every day.  We value great work and collaboration and strive to eliminate bureaucratic thinking.  We’re looking for talented people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to have an impact with innovative ideas and best practices.

Come be a part of our Canadian success story and help deliver superior experiences for our clients. At CG, we recognize that diversity across our business strengthens our client relationships and enables more innovative solutions.  We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. CG provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.

Our Canadian operation, Canaccord Genuity Corp., is seeking a hybrid Business Analyst / Data Developer for a 4-month contract to complete the implementation of our in-house VIA (Vendor Invoice Allocation) system and deliver executive-level reporting. VIA is a SQL-based platform used to manage vendor invoices, allocate expenses to departments and individuals, manage platform entitlements (e.g., Bloomberg, LSEG Workspace), and store contract metadata. The contractor’s primary focus will be to complete the data integration from our existing Accounts Payable system (Concur) to the VIA database, ensure that all required financial and associated vendor contract data is correctly recorded and develop a reporting interface on VIA data model, focusing on vendor and financial management.

Responsibilities:

VIA System Completion & Data Modeling

  • Review existing VIA SQL schema, invoice allocation logic, entitlement structures, and Contracts module.
  • Complete outstanding implementation components of VIA to support accurate financial reporting and analytics.
  • Optimize SQL views, tables, and stored procedures to support reporting requirements.

Concur Integration (API / Batch Processing)

  • Implement API or batch-based ingestion of expense data from Concur into VIA.
  • Map Concur expense data to VIA entities (vendors, platforms, entitlements, departments, individuals).
  • Automate data refreshes and ensure data integrity, reconciliation, and auditability.

Expense Dashboard Enablement

  • Use the existing dashboard wireframe to define data requirements and measures.
  • Build Power BI datasets and semantic models backed by VIA SQL data.
  • Create DAX measures to support key metrics, including: expense trends by fiscal year, top vendor spend, contract-linked expenses
  • Ensure dashboards are performant, intuitive, and aligned with senior leadership expectations.

Business Analysis & Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Work with business and finance stakeholders to validate reporting logic and business rules.
  • Translate dashboard and reporting requirements into technical data structures.
  • Document data models, integrations, and assumptions for long-term maintainability.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • 3–5+ years in a Business Analyst / Data Developer / BI Developer role.
  • Advanced SQL skills (complex queries, transformations, performance tuning).
  • Strong Power BI experience (data modeling, DAX, dataset design).
  • Experience integrating third-party systems via API or scheduled batch processes.
  • Experience with expenses or financial systems (eg. Concur).
  • Ability to work independently in a partially implemented environment.
  • Familiarity with vendor management, contracts, and market data platforms (eg. Bloomberg, FactSet), is an asset
  • Experience in the financial services industry is an asset
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills;
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills

Why Join Exadel

We’re an AI-first global tech company with 25+ years of engineering leadership, 2,000+ team members, and 500+ active projects powering Fortune 500 clients, including HBO, Microsoft, Google, and Starbucks.

From AI platforms to digital transformation, we partner with enterprise leaders to build what’s next.

What powers it all? Our people are ambitious, collaborative, and constantly evolving.

What You’ll Do

  • Business Analysis & Requirements

  • System Enhancements & Delivery Support

What You Bring

Exadel Culture

job_information.title: Business Development Analyst (Oil Sands)
job_information.description:
Keyera Career Opportunity

Why Keyera?

It’s our purpose-driven culture, benefits, and people. From flexible, customizable benefits and an employer-funded pension plan to our Keyera Connects social investment program and paid employee volunteer days, we’re focused on empowering our people and communities.

When you work with us, you'll enjoy:

Flexible Benefits to meet your individual and family needs, including

  • $3,500 plus 4.5% of base salary each year to customize your benefits and investments

  • Saving plan options, including an Employee Share Purchase Plan, RRSP, and TFSA

  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan funded by Keyera up to 10% of base salary

  • Wellness Personal Spending Account of $750 per year to cover wellness expenses

Paid vacation and eight flex days each year

  • Two paid volunteer days each year to support the causes that are most important to you

  • Employee Family Assistance Program with a variety of support resources from professional counselling to financial planning support and more.

Role/Location Specific

  • Keyera’s Northern Allowance is a tiered incentive program based on years of service, currently offered to employees working at the following locations: Grande Prairie Office, Wapiti, Simonette, Gold Creek, South Cheecham, and Fox Creek Terminal. This information reflects the current state of the program and may be subject to change over time.

Please note that compensation and benefits may be different based on the work location, position, and a candidate's experience and qualifications.

Job Type:

Permanent

THE POSITION

Keyera is currently seeking a Business Development Analyst to join our Oil Sands Business Development team in our Calgary office. This role is pivotal in supporting commercial decision-making, optimizing revenue streams, and ensuring profitability within our oil sands operations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze market dynamics, assess commercial opportunities, and develop strategies to maximize value across our asset portfolio. If you are a results-driven professional with a passion for commercial analysis and strategic thinking, we invite you to apply and join our team.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Conduct comprehensive market analysis to identify industry trends, competitor activities and regulatory changes to inform commercial negotiations and decision making.
  • Perform data analysis using dashboards to evaluate commercial performance and support fact-based decision-making.
  • Support the development of preliminary economic models for new commercial opportunities, asset development, and strategic initiatives.
  • Support the identification of potential commercial growth opportunities including asset optimization, new or repurposed infrastructure, new service offerings and new commercial frameworks.
  • Cultivate and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders, including operations, finance, and planning to ensure alignment and collaboration on commercial initiatives.
  • Lead the creation of the annual budget and long-term strategic planning models and presentations.
  • Analyze operational data and work with operations/engineering to identify and justify new opportunities and/or risks.
  • Create scenario planning tools that enable businesses to assess impact of market changes and drive future business decisions.
  • Develop concise PowerPoint presentations for both internal and external audiences.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 1-3 years of experience in areas such as commercial analysis, business development, engineering, financial analysis within the oil and gas industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in financial modeling, market analysis, and contract evaluation.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
  • Knowledge of midstream oil and gas markets, commercial agreements, and industry best practices.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, PowerBI, GeoScout and other relevant software tools.

Posting Expiry Date:

Feb 25, 2026

At Keyera, we embrace collaboration, inclusion, and a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. Our values foster an environment for every person to bring their whole self to work.

We offer a well-rounded total compensation package and a comprehensive benefits program designed with the well-being and empowerment of our employees and their families in mind.

If you are interested in an opportunity to join a winning, purpose-driven culture then you’ll enjoy a career with us.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.
